original: ma nor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ma nor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: One might ask, How will it be taught by such phrases as 'unmistaken' and so forth?

original: gal te 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa chos thams cad kun brtags pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa chos thams cad kun brtags pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: If the desire realm and so on are not all phenomena that are imagined and unreal,

original: yongs su grub pa de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo zhig yin du zin na theg pa chen po 'di de dag las nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing /🔽de dag yongs su spong bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo zhig yin du zin na theg pa chen po 'di de dag las nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing / de dag yongs su spong bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'di ltar chos de dag thams cad kun brtags pa ste /
translated: then this Great Vehicle would not be a definite exit from them,🔽and they would not be completely abandoned.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas /
translated: However, since all those phenomena are imagined and unreal,

original: de'i phyir theg pa chen po 'di de dag yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa chen po 'di de dag yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: this Great Vehicle is a definite exit from them and they are completely abandoned.

original: rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa'i khams de bzhin du gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa'i khams de bzhin du gyur te /
translated: Subhūti, if the desire realm were to become thus,

original: ma nor ba dang / gzhan ma yin @155b pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / de kho na dang / yang dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te 'dod pa'i khams dngos po yod par gyur te dngos po med pa ma yin na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ma nor ba dang / gzhan ma yin @155b pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / de kho na dang / yang dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te 'dod pa'i khams dngos po yod par gyur te dngos po med pa ma yin na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Unmistaken, not otherwise, unerringly, just that, real, and so on, are applied to the statement, “If the desire realm existed as a thing, not as a non-thing…”

original: gal te 'dod pa'i khams yod par gyur te med pa ma yin na yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / rnam pa gsum gyis yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i khams yod par gyur te med pa ma yin na yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / rnam pa gsum gyis yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the desire realm existed, not not existing, it would exist in three ways: as the characteristic of the consummate, as the characteristic of the real, and as the characteristic of the unconditioned.

original: de la de bzhin du gyur pa dang / ma nor ba dang / gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba tshig gsum gyis ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de la de bzhin du gyur pa dang / ma nor ba dang / gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba tshig gsum gyis ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: Among those, the three phrases “just that, unmistaken, not otherwise” teach the characteristic of the consummate.

original: phyin ci ma log pa dang / de kho na dang / yang dag pa dang / bden pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba tshig lngas ni bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa dang / de kho na dang / yang dag pa dang / bden pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba tshig lngas ni bden pa bstan to //
translated: The five terms “non-erroneous,” “suchness,” “reality-limit,” “true,” and “as it is” indicate the truth.

original: rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can zhes bya ba tshig bzhis ni 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / brtan pa dang / ther zug dang / mi 'gyur ba'i chos can zhes bya ba tshig bzhis ni 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The four terms “permanent,” “firm,” “eternal,” and “unchanging” indicate the characteristic of the unconditioned.

original: de la yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Among them, the perfected characteristic is threefold:

original: mi 'jigs par yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa dang / mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs par yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa dang / mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: perfected as fearless, perfected as non-erroneous, and perfected as unchanging.

original: de la de bzhin du gyur zhes bya bas ni mi 'jigs par yongs su grub pa bstan to //🔽ma nor zhes bya bas ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la de bzhin du gyur zhes bya bas ni mi 'jigs par yongs su grub pa bstan to // ma nor zhes bya bas ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa bstan to //
translated: Among them, “such” indicates perfected as fearless.🔽“Non-erroneous” indicates perfected as non-erroneous.

original: gzhan ma yin zhes bya bas ni mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin zhes bya bas ni mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa bstan to //
translated: “Not otherwise” indicates perfected as unchanging.

original: bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bden pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The characteristics of reality are also fivefold.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid ni dper na smig rgyu la chur phyin ci log tu gyur pa med pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid ni dper na smig rgyu la chur phyin ci log tu gyur pa med pa lta bu ste /
translated: The characteristic of non-error is like the non-erroneous perception of water in a mirage.

original: de ni phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni phyin ci ma log pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the term non-inverted.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni dper na sgyu ma la ngo bo nyid med pa'i dngos po lta bu ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni dper na sgyu ma la ngo bo nyid med pa'i dngos po lta bu ste /
translated: The characteristic of intrinsic reality is like the absence of intrinsic reality in an illusion.

original: de ni de kho na zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni de kho na zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the term thatness.

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni dper na skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa med pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni dper na skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa med pa lta bu ste /
translated: The characteristic of existence is like the non-existence of the characteristic of existence in the hair of a tortoise and so on.

original: de ni yang dag pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the term reality.

original: mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid ni dper na zla ba gnyis su gyur pa la sogs par 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid med pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid ni dper na zla ba gnyis su gyur pa la sogs par 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid med pa lta bu ste /
translated: The characteristic of non-deceptiveness is like the non-deceptive characteristic of the moon’s reflection and so on.

original: de ni bden pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni bden pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the term truth.

original: rigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni dper na rtag pa dang @156a * //
analyzed: rigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni dper na rtag pa dang @156a * //
translated: The definition of a reason is, for example, permanence,

original: bde ba dang / bdag la sogs pa 'thad pa dang bral bar gyur pa med pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / bdag la sogs pa 'thad pa dang bral bar gyur pa med pa lta bu ste /
translated: happiness, self, and so on, which are devoid of justification.

original: de ni ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by “as it is.”

original: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhin te /
translated: The definition of the unconditioned is fourfold.

original: skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The definition of non-arising and non-ceasing is, for example,

original: rtag pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: “permanent.”

original: rtag tu gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The definition of abiding forever is, for example,

original: brtan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: “stable.”

original: 'chad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'chad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The definition of non-disintegration is, for example,

original: ther zug ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ther zug ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: “firm.”

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The definition of immutability is, for example,

original: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: “having the nature of non-change.”

original: rab 'byor de'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams ni kun brtags pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor de'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams ni kun brtags pa /
translated: Subhūti, therefore, the desire realm is imagined,

original: rnam par bsgrub pa tshig gis bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par bsgrub pa tshig gis bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: in the teaching of the treatise, it is called “verbal designation.”

original: brtags pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: brtags pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The word “imagined” shows that it is not real, because it is not true.

original: rnam par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gis bkod pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gis bkod pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The word “constructed” shows that it is a false imagination, because it is constructed by other factors.

original: tshig gis bstan pa zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob yin pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gis bstan pa zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob yin pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: The word “taught” shows that it is expressible, because it is conventional.

original: dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ste /
translated: It is non-existent.

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni med pa ste yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni med pa ste yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “non-existent” shows that it is not real, because it does not exist.

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum ste /
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum ste /
translated: The phrase “the world with its gods, humans, and asuras” refers to the three worlds.

original: lha ma yin smos pas ni 'og gi 'jig rten bstan to //
analyzed: lha ma yin smos pas ni 'og gi 'jig rten bstan to //
translated: The word “asura” shows the lower world.

original: mi smos pas ni bar gyi 'jig rten bstan to //
analyzed: mi smos pas ni bar gyi 'jig rten bstan to //
translated: The word “human” shows the middle world.

original: lha smos pas ni gong ma'i 'jig rten bstan to //
analyzed: lha smos pas ni gong ma'i 'jig rten bstan to //
translated: The word “god” shows the upper world.

original: 'gres 'di la yang khams gsum po dag dang / phung po rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang / 'dus te reg pa'i chogs drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / khams drug dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa dang /
analyzed: 'gres 'di la yang khams gsum po dag dang / phung po rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang / 'dus te reg pa'i chogs drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / khams drug dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa dang /
translated: This pattern also applies to the three realms, the aggregates, the sense spheres, the six collections of consciousness, the six collections of contact, the six collections of feeling, the six elements, the twelve links of dependent origination,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang /
translated: suchness, unmistaken suchness, unaltered suchness, phenomena, the expanse of phenomena, the establishment of phenomena, the nature of phenomena, the very limit of reality,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / pha rol tu phyin pa @156b drug dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mtha' la thug pa rnams dang / rigs kyi sa'i chos la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mtha' la thug pa rnams dang /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / pha rol tu phyin pa @156b drug dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mtha' la thug pa rnams dang / rigs kyi sa'i chos la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi mtha' la thug pa rnams dang /
translated: the qualities of the stage of potential and so on, up to the ultimate qualities of the Buddha;🔽the nature of potential and so on, up to the ultimate qualities of the Buddha;

original: rigs nyid la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi mtha' la thug pa rnams dang / sems bskyed pa thams cad dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams dang / 'od dang / yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i dbyangs dang /
analyzed: rigs nyid la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi mtha' la thug pa rnams dang / sems bskyed pa thams cad dang / rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams dang / 'od dang / yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i dbyangs dang /
translated: all the arousals of mind, the vajra-like wisdom, the marks of a great being, the light, the voice endowed with sixty aspects,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo dang / sems can rnams dang / 'di dag bstan to //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo dang / sems can rnams dang / 'di dag bstan to //
translated: the wheel of Dharma, and sentient beings.

original: de la yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de la yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las /
translated: Regarding the “voice endowed with sixty aspects,” the Tathāgataguhya Sūtra says:

original: ji skad du zhi ba'i blo glos gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung yan lag rnam pa drug cu dang ldan pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji skad du zhi ba'i blo glos gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung yan lag rnam pa drug cu dang ldan pa 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, the Tathagata's speech has sixty branches:

original: mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du 'thad pa dang / dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / gsal ba dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / mnyan par 'os pa dang / mi tshugs pa dang /
analyzed: mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du 'thad pa dang / dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / gsal ba dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / mnyan par 'os pa dang / mi tshugs pa dang /
translated: It is gentle, smooth, pleasing, agreeable, pure, stainless, clear, melodious, worthy of being listened to, and unassailable.

original: snyan pa dang / dul ba dang / mi rtsub pa dang / mi brlang ba dang / rab tu dul ba dang / rnar snyan pa dang / lus sim par byed pa dang / sems tshim par byed pa dang / snying dga' bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: snyan pa dang / dul ba dang / mi rtsub pa dang / mi brlang ba dang / rab tu dul ba dang / rnar snyan pa dang / lus sim par byed pa dang / sems tshim par byed pa dang / snying dga' bar byed pa dang /
translated: It is pleasant, disciplined, not harsh, not rude, very disciplined, pleasing to the ear, refreshing to the body, satisfying to the mind, and gladdening to the heart.

original: dga' ba skyed pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / kun shes par byed pa dang / rnam par rig par bya ba dang / rnam par gsal ba dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / mngon par dga' bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: dga' ba skyed pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / kun shes par byed pa dang / rnam par rig par bya ba dang / rnam par gsal ba dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / mngon par dga' bar byed pa dang /
translated: It produces joy, is not tormenting, causes understanding, is intelligible, very clear, delightful, and very pleasing.

original: cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa dang / tshig zur chag med pa dang / ma tshang ba med pa dang / ma zhum pa dang / mi zhan pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / khyab pa dang / chub pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang /
analyzed: cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa dang / tshig zur chag med pa dang / ma tshang ba med pa dang / ma zhum pa dang / mi zhan pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / khyab pa dang / chub pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang /
translated: It is also the speech of the Buddha that is endowed with all the qualities of the speech of the Buddha, such as being well-spoken, etc.🔽It is well-spoken, because it is not contrary to the scriptures. It is endowed with good letters, because it is easy to understand. It is endowed with good words, because it is easy to grasp. It is endowed with good meanings, because it teaches the means of attaining the two goals. It is endowed with good reasoning, because it is not contradictory. It is endowed with good expression, because it is easy to understand. It is endowed with good timing, because it is not untimely. It is endowed with good explanation, because it is not incomplete. It is endowed with good purification, because it is not defiled. It is endowed with good accomplishment, because it is not timid. It is endowed with good pervasiveness, because it is not narrow. It is endowed with good completion, because it is not interrupted.

original: 'brel pa dang / sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa dang / dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa dang / ma smad pa dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / ma brtabs pa dang / 'khor kun tu grags pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang / sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa dang / dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa dang / ma smad pa dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / ma brtabs pa dang / 'khor kun tu grags pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is endowed with good continuity, because it is not disjointed. It is endowed with good connection, because it is not incoherent. It is endowed with good fulfillment of all speech, because it satisfies all faculties. It is not contemptible, because it is not vulgar. It is not changeable, because it is not frivolous. It is not fearful, because it is not timid. It is renowned in all circles, because it is not unknown. It is endowed with the best of all aspects, because it is not inferior.

original: de la gnyen po ni khams dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnyen po ni khams dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the antidote is the teaching of all the elements and the roots of virtue.

original: 'jam pa ni tshe 'di nyid la bde ba la reg par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽yid du 'ong ba ni don bzang po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni tshe 'di nyid la bde ba la reg par byed pa'i phyir ro // yid du 'ong ba ni don bzang po'i phyir ro //
translated: It is gentle, because it brings the experience of happiness in this very life.🔽It is pleasing, because it has a good meaning.

original: yid du 'thad pa ni tshig 'bru bzang po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'thad pa ni tshig 'bru bzang po'i phyir ro //
translated: It is agreeable, because it has good words.

original: dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa bla na med pa'i rjes la byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa bla na med pa'i rjes la byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pure because it arises after the supramundane, unsurpassed path.

original: dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang / bag chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang / bag chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is immaculate because it is free from all the latent tendencies and propensities of the afflictions.

original: gsal ba ni tshig dang yi ge grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ni tshig dang yi ge grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is clear because the words and letters are well known.

original: snyan cing 'jebs pa ni mu stegs can thams cad kyi log pa'i blo gros dang / lta ba 'jig pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan cing 'jebs pa ni mu stegs can thams cad kyi log pa'i blo gros dang / lta ba 'jig pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pleasant and agreeable because it has the quality of destroying the false understanding and views of all the tīrthikas.

original: mnyan par 'os pa ni sgrub pas nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyan par 'os pa ni sgrub pas nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is worthy of being heard because it definitely leads to liberation through practice.

original: mi tshugs pa ni phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis bar mi chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi tshugs pa ni phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis bar mi chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is invincible because it cannot be interrupted by any opponents.

original: snyan pa ni dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan pa ni dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is delightful because it brings joy.

original: dul ba ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dul ba ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is disciplined because it is the antidote to desire.

original: mi rtsub pa ni bslab pa bcas pa thabs sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtsub pa ni bslab pa bcas pa thabs sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not harsh because the precepts are easy to follow.

original: mi brlang ba ni de las 'das pa dag yang dag par 'byung ba ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brlang ba ni de las 'das pa dag yang dag par 'byung ba ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not harsh, because it teaches the avoidance of what is evil.

original: rab tu dul ba ni theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dul ba ni theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is well disciplined, because it teaches the discipline of the three vehicles.

original: rnar snyan pa ni g-yeng ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rnar snyan pa ni g-yeng ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro//
translated: It is pleasing to the ear, because it is the antidote to distraction.

original: lus sim par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus sim par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is soothing to the body, because it causes the attainment of meditative concentration.

original: sems tshim par byed pa ni lhag mthong gis mchog tu dga' ba thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems tshim par byed pa ni lhag mthong gis mchog tu dga' ba thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is satisfying to the mind, because it causes the attainment of the highest joy through insight.

original: snying dga' bar byed pa ni the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying dga' bar byed pa ni the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is gladdening to the heart, because it resolves doubts.

original: dga' bde bskyed pa ni log par nges pa sel ba'i @157b phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' bde bskyed pa ni log par nges pa sel ba'i @157b phyir ro //
translated: It generates joy and bliss, because it removes wrong decisions.

original: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni bsgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni bsgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not feverish, because there is no regret in the practice.

original: kun du shes par bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du shes par bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is fully understandable, because it is the basis for the perfection of the knowledge that comes from listening.

original: rnam par rig par bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig par bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be known because it is the basis for the perfection of the wisdom that arises from reflection.

original: rnam par gsal ba ni slob dpon gyi chos kyi dpe mkhyud med pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽dga' bar byed pa ni bdag gi don rjes su thob pa rnams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gsal ba ni slob dpon gyi chos kyi dpe mkhyud med pa las byung ba'i phyir ro // dga' bar byed pa ni bdag gi don rjes su thob pa rnams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is clear because it arises from the absence of the teacher’s miserliness with regard to the Dharma.🔽It is pleasing because it pleases those who have attained their own goal.

original: mngon par dga' bar byed pa ni bdag gi don ma thob pa rnams re bar byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽kun shes par byed pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar byed pa ni bdag gi don ma thob pa rnams re bar byed pa'i phyir ro // kun shes par byed pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is delightful because it inspires hope in those who have not attained their own goal.🔽It is to be fully understood because it teaches the inconceivable Dharma.

original: rnam par rig par byed pa ni bsam du yod pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig par byed pa ni bsam du yod pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be known because it teaches the conceivable Dharma.

original: rigs pa ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable because it does not contradict valid knowledge.

original: 'brel ba ni ci rigs par 'dul ba la ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba ni ci rigs par 'dul ba la ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is connected because it teaches the Vinaya appropriately.

original: zlos pa'i skyon med pa ni don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zlos pa'i skyon med pa ni don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fault of repetition is not present, because it is not meaningless.

original: seng ge'i sgra'i shugs ni mu stegs can gyi tshogs thams cad skrag par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽glang po che'i sgra skad ni sgra gsang mtho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra'i shugs ni mu stegs can gyi tshogs thams cad skrag par byed pa'i phyir ro // glang po che'i sgra skad ni sgra gsang mtho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The force of the lion’s roar is to frighten the entire herd of tīrthikas.🔽The voice of the elephant is to have a loud voice.

original: 'brug gi sgra dbyangs ni zab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brug gi sgra dbyangs ni zab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the dragon’s voice is to be deep.

original: klu'i dbang po'i sgra ni gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: klu'i dbang po'i sgra ni gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the lord of the nāgas is to be worthy of being held.

original: dri za'i glu dbyangs ni snyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri za'i glu dbyangs ni snyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The song of the gandharva is to be pleasant.

original: bya ka la ping ka'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa ni myur du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ka la ping ka'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa ni myur du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can gyi phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the voice of the kalaviṅka bird is to be of a nature that quickly changes.

original: tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa ni rgyang ring du grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa ni rgyang ring du grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the voice of Brahmā is to be heard from afar.

original: shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su grags pa ni thams cad du grub pa thog mar 'gro ba'i bkra shis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su grags pa ni thams cad du grub pa thog mar 'gro ba'i bkra shis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the voice of the śaṅkha bird is to be the auspicious beginning of all accomplishments.

original: lha'i dbang po'i dbyangs ltar snyan pa ni 'gal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po'i dbyangs ltar snyan pa ni 'gal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like the voice of the lord of the gods, because it is not opposed.

original: rnga'i sgra ni bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad pham par bya ba la thog mar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnga'i sgra ni bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad pham par bya ba la thog mar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like the sound of a drum, because it goes before all the demons and opponents in order to defeat them.

original: ma khengs pa ni bstod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma khengs pa ni bstod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not arrogant, because it is not defiled by praise.

original: mi dma' ba ni smad pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni rnam par bsgrub pa thams cad dang / mtshan nyid rnam pa thams @158a * //
analyzed: mi dma' ba ni smad pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro // sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni rnam par bsgrub pa thams cad dang / mtshan nyid rnam pa thams @158a * //
translated: It is not low, because it is not defiled by contempt.

original: cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the entry into all sounds, because it is the entry into all accomplishments and all aspects of the characteristics of sounds.

original: tshig zur chag med pa ni brjed par de mi 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig zur chag med pa ni brjed par de mi 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not distorted, because it does not distort the meaning.

original: ma tshang ba med pa ni 'dul ba'i bya ba la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma tshang ba med pa ni 'dul ba'i bya ba la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not incomplete, because it is always available for the activities of taming.

original: ma zhum pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi rtag pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: ma zhum pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi rtag pa'i phyir ro//
translated: It is not faint, because it is not dependent on gain and honor.

original: mi zhan pa ni 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi zhan pa ni 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not weak, because it is fearless.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni bde ba byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni bde ba byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is joyful, because it is the source of happiness.

original: khyab pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pervasive, because it is applied to all the branches of knowledge.

original: chub pa ni sems can rnams kyi don mtha' dag sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chub pa ni sems can rnams kyi don mtha' dag sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is perfected, because it accomplishes all the aims of beings.

original: rgyun chags pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is continuous, because it is uninterrupted.

original: 'brel pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is connected, because it is applied to the various arts.

original: sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni sgra gcig la sgra'i rnam par rig pa du ma nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni sgra gcig la sgra'i rnam par rig pa du ma nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the fulfillment of all sounds, because many sounds are present in a single sound.

original: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa ni gcig gis don du ma'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽ma smad pa ni dam bcas pa bzhin du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa ni gcig gis don du ma'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro // ma smad pa ni dam bcas pa bzhin du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the satisfaction of all faculties, because many objects are present in a single one.🔽It is irreproachable, because it acts in accordance with its promises.

original: mi 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unchanging, because it is applied in the future.

original: ma brtabs pa ni rtab rtab por mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brtabs pa ni rtab rtab por mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not hasty means not speaking in a hurried manner.

original: 'khor kun tu grags pa ni 'khor nye ring la mtshungs par grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor kun tu grags pa ni 'khor nye ring la mtshungs par grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Renowned everywhere means being renowned equally in all circles, near and far.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten don dang / dpe'i chos thams cad kyi yongs su grub pa'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon gyi man ngag go //🔽/ bam po bcu drug pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten don dang / dpe'i chos thams cad kyi yongs su grub pa'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon gyi man ngag go // / bam po bcu drug pa /
translated: Endowed with the best of all aspects means being fully accomplished in all worldly and transcendent qualities and examples. This is the teacher's instruction.

original: da ni rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes smras pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig gnyis pa bzung ste bstan to //
analyzed: da ni rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes smras pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig gnyis pa bzung ste bstan to //
translated: Now, the second statement is taken up and taught beginning with Subhūti, when you said 'That vehicle is equal to space,' and so on.

original: kun brtags pa'i dngos po rnams ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig gis rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i dngos po rnams ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig gis rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The imagined things are established in twenty-one ways.

original: theg pa chen po 'di la ni rnam par gzhag pa de dag med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di la ni rnam par gzhag pa de dag med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since those establishments do not exist in this Great Vehicle, it should be known as being equal to space.

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig ni phyogs rnam par gzhag pa dang / dbyibs dang / kha dog dang / dus dang / 'grib cing 'phel ba la sogs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par byang ba dang / skye zhing 'gag @158b pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig ni phyogs rnam par gzhag pa dang / dbyibs dang / kha dog dang / dus dang / 'grib cing 'phel ba la sogs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par byang ba dang / skye zhing 'gag @158b pa dang /
translated: The twenty one aspects are the classification of directions, shape, color, time, decrease and increase, and so on, affliction and purification, arising and ceasing,

original: dge ba la sogs pa dang / mthong zhing thos pa la sogs pa dang / shes par bya ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par smin cing rnam par smin pa'i chos can dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / khams dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu dang /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa dang / mthong zhing thos pa la sogs pa dang / shes par bya ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par smin cing rnam par smin pa'i chos can dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / khams dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu dang /
translated: virtue and so on, seeing and hearing and so on, objects of knowledge and so on, karmic maturation and karmically neutral states, attachment and so on, the elements, the ten bodhisattva levels such as the Joyous,

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba dang / rigs kyi sa la sogs pa sa bcu dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag gi sa dang / gnyis dang / chos kyi mdo dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / gsang ba dang / mi gsang ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba dang / rigs kyi sa la sogs pa sa bcu dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag gi sa dang / gnyis dang / chos kyi mdo dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / gsang ba dang / mi gsang ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: the ten levels such as the level of seeing white, the level of the arya being, the two levels, the level of the sutra of Dharma, the door of liberation, the secret and the nonsecret and so on,

original: rnyed pa la sogs pa dang / rab tu brjod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa dang / rab tu brjod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: gain and so on, and praise and so on.

original: de la 'grib pa dang 'phel ba ni rim gyis so //
analyzed: de la 'grib pa dang 'phel ba ni rim gyis so //
translated: Among them, decrease and increase are gradual.

original: 'bri ba ni chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'bri ba ni chad pa'o //
translated: Diminution is a break.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams thog ma skye ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams thog ma skye ba'o //
translated: Arising is the beginning of things.

original: 'gag pa ni skad cig gcig la 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni skad cig gcig la 'jig pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the destruction of things in one moment.

original: gnas pa ni de ltar skye zhing 'gag pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyun ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni de ltar skye zhing 'gag pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyun ma chad pa'o //
translated: Endurance is the uninterrupted continuum of things that arise and cease in that way.

original: mthar thug pa ni de'i rgyun chad cing bltar mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni de'i rgyun chad cing bltar mi snang ba'o //
translated: Termination is the interruption of that continuum and the non-appearance of things.

original: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyun snga ma dang / phyi ma bye brag can du gyur pa de mi 'dra bar gyur pa'o //🔽shes par bya ba yang ma yin pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ltar shes pas rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyun snga ma dang / phyi ma bye brag can du gyur pa de mi 'dra bar gyur pa'o // shes par bya ba yang ma yin pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ltar shes pas rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Change while enduring is the difference between the earlier and later parts of that continuum, their dissimilarity.🔽It is not an object of knowledge because it is not a thing that is fully understood by knowledge, unlike form and so on.

original: kun brtags pa'i chos ni shes pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos ni shes pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: An imputed phenomenon is not fully understood by knowledge.

original: de'i tshe na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist at that time.

original: shes par mi bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni ri bong gi rva ltar shin tu med pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: shes par mi bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni ri bong gi rva ltar shin tu med pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Nor is it not to be known means that it is not totally nonexistent like the horn of an ass.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba la sogs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni bden par rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba la sogs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni bden par rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it to be fully understood, etc. means that it is not realized as a truth.

original: 'bras bu gang yin pa ni rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin pa ni rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The result is the maturation.

original: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa'i chos can no //
translated: That which is to be matured is the one who possesses the maturation.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid du'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid du'o //
translated: The stages of joy, etc. are the nature of the supramundane mind.

original: 'thob pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rnyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'thob pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rnyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not attained means that it is not to be acquired.

original: dmigs su yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs su yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not an object means that it is not the domain of the sense faculties.

original: brjod du yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lam du ma gtogs pa'i @159a * //
analyzed: brjod du yod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lam du ma gtogs pa'i @159a * //
translated: It is not expressible means that it is not included in the verbal path.

original: phyir ro // brjod du med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi tshig gi lam gyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyir ro // brjod du med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi tshig gi lam gyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is not inexpressible means that it is taught by the path of conventional words.

original: de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu /
translated: After that,

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du ji ltar nam mkha' sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i go 'byed do zhes smras pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig gsum bstan te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du ji ltar nam mkha' sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i go 'byed do zhes smras pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig gsum bstan te /
translated: the three phrases beginning with Subhūti, regarding what you said, 'How is space the liberator of limitless, countless sentient beings?' are taught.

original: rab 'byor sems can med pa'i phyir nam mkha' med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor sems can med pa'i phyir nam mkha' med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, space should be known as nonexistent because sentient beings do not exist.

original: nam mkha' med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha' med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: Space should be known as nonexistent because the Mahāyāna does not exist. What is the meaning of that?

original: gang zag la bdag med pas chos la bdag med pa 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir sngar sems can med pa la gnas nas nam mkha' med pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pas chos la bdag med pa 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir sngar sems can med pa la gnas nas nam mkha' med pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the selflessness of phenomena is entered by the selflessness of persons, first one abides in the nonexistence of sentient beings and then abides in the nonexistence of space.

original: nam mkha' med pas theg pa chen po med pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' med pas theg pa chen po med pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will stand in the non-existence of the Great Vehicle because of the non-existence of space.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang med pa nyid de chos thams cad kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang med pa nyid de chos thams cad kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the non-existence of these, the dharmas of the immeasurable, etc. also do not exist. And all dharmas should be known in this way.

original: sems can med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems can med pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / sgra'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems can med pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / sgra'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the non-existence of beings, suchness should be known as non-existent. Because of the non-existence of beings, the suchness of imagined form, the suchness of imagined sound, etc. should be known as non-existent.

original: de ltar chos thams cad med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs pas go skabs 'byed do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs pas go skabs 'byed do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, because all dharmas do not exist, space is similar to an opening.

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir dpag tu med pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir dpag tu med pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of non-existence, the immeasurable, etc. come about.

original: 'gres 'di la nyi shu rtsa drug ste sems can med pa'i phyi nam mkha' med do //
analyzed: 'gres 'di la nyi shu rtsa drug ste sems can med pa'i phyi nam mkha' med do //
translated: There are twenty-six permutations here. Because of the non-existence of beings, space does not exist.

original: nam mkha' med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po med do zhes bya ba ni 'gres dang po'o //🔽gsum po de dag nyid dpag tu med pa dang sbyar ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po med do zhes bya ba ni 'gres dang po'o // gsum po de dag nyid dpag tu med pa dang sbyar ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The first permutation is “because space does not exist, the Great Vehicle does not exist.”🔽The second permutation is the application of those three to the immeasurable.

original: grangs med pa dang sbyar ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: grangs med pa dang sbyar ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third permutation is the application of those three to the incalculable.

original: tshad med pa dang sbyar ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa dang sbyar ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth permutation is the application of those three to the infinite.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang sbyar ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang sbyar ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth permutation is the application of those three to the expanse of reality.

original: de bzhin nyid dang sbyar ba ni drug pa'o //🔽sems can dang srog la sogs pa bcu gsum gyis bsnan te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang sbyar ba ni drug pa'o // sems can dang srog la sogs pa bcu gsum gyis bsnan te /
translated: The sixth permutation is the application of those three to suchness.

original: tha ma yang dag pa'i mtha' dang sbyar ba ni bdun pa'o //🔽de nyid la yang dag pa'i mtha' bkol te /
analyzed: tha ma yang dag pa'i mtha' dang sbyar ba ni bdun pa'o // de nyid la yang dag pa'i mtha' bkol te /
translated: The seventh permutation is the application of those three to the ultimate, adding the thirteen, such as sentient beings and life.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings @159b dang sbyar ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings @159b dang sbyar ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth permutation is the application of those three to the inconceivable expanse, excluding the ultimate from the seventh permutation.

original: de dag nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i chos dang sbyar ba ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i chos dang sbyar ba ni dgu pa'o //
translated: The ninth permutation is the application of those three to the phenomena of the aggregates of form and so on.

original: de dag nyid nang gi skye mched drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid nang gi skye mched drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu pa'o //
translated: The tenth permutation is the application of those three to the six inner sense bases.

original: phyi rol gyi drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: The eleventh chapter is the one that deals with the six external bases.

original: rnam par shes pa drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The twelfth chapter is the one that deals with the six consciousnesses.

original: reg pa drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: The thirteenth chapter is the one that deals with the six contacts.

original: tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourteenth chapter is the one that deals with the six sets of feelings.

original: khams drug dang sbyar ba ni bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: khams drug dang sbyar ba ni bco lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifteenth chapter is the one that deals with the six elements.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang sbyar ba ni bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang sbyar ba ni bcu drug pa'o //
translated: The sixteenth chapter is the one that deals with dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang sbyar ba ni bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventeenth chapter is the one that deals with the six perfections.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang sbyar ba ni bco brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang sbyar ba ni bco brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighteenth chapter is the one that deals with all the emptinesses.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang sbyar ba ni bcu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang sbyar ba ni bcu dgu pa'o //
translated: The nineteenth chapter is the one that deals with the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa nas gzungs kyi sgo'i bar dang sbyar ba no nyid shu pa'o //🔽stobs bcu nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa nas gzungs kyi sgo'i bar dang sbyar ba no nyid shu pa'o // stobs bcu nas /
translated: The twentieth chapter is the one that deals with the noble truths up to the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: ma 'dres pa'i bar dang sbyar ba ni nyi shu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i bar dang sbyar ba ni nyi shu gcig pa'o //
translated: The twenty-first chapter is the one that deals with the ten powers🔽up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: rigs kyi sa'i chos nas byas pa rtogs pa'i bar dang sbyar ba ni nyi shu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa'i chos nas byas pa rtogs pa'i bar dang sbyar ba ni nyi shu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The twenty-second is the application to the stage of lineage up to the realization of what has been done.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar gyi gang zag dang sbyar ba ni nyi shu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar gyi gang zag dang sbyar ba ni nyi shu gsum pa'o //
translated: The twenty-third is the application to the persons from stream-enterer up to arhat.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas dang sbyar ba ni nyi shu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas dang sbyar ba ni nyi shu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The twenty-fourth is the application to the pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and buddhas.

original: theg pa gsum dang sbyar ba ni nyi shu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum dang sbyar ba ni nyi shu lnga pa'o //
translated: The twenty-fifth is the application to the three vehicles.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dpe bstan pa ni 'gres nyi shu rtsa drug pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dpe bstan pa ni 'gres nyi shu rtsa drug pa ste /
translated: The twenty-sixth is the teaching of the examples of nirvāṇa.

original: de dag ni 'gres nyi shu rtsa drug go //🔽theg pa 'di la 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: de dag ni 'gres nyi shu rtsa drug go // theg pa 'di la 'ong ba'am /
translated: These are the twenty-six applications.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba yang mi dmigs shing gnas pa zhes bya ba yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig bzhi pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba yang mi dmigs shing gnas pa zhes bya ba yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig bzhi pa bstan te /
translated: In this vehicle, coming or going is not apprehended, and abiding is also non-existent.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni dbye ba med pa ste /🔽de dag gang du yang 'dor ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni dbye ba med pa ste / de dag gang du yang 'dor ba med do //
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are undifferentiated,🔽they are not discarded anywhere,

original: gang nas kyang 'ong ba med do //
analyzed: gang nas kyang 'ong ba med do //
translated: they do not come from anywhere,🔽and they do not go anywhere.

original: gar yang gnas pa med do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i theg pa chen po'i gnas skabs na chos thams cad de bzhin nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gar yang gnas pa med do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i theg pa chen po'i gnas skabs na chos thams cad de bzhin nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir /
translated: “Nowhere does it abide” means that in the situation of the ultimate Great Vehicle, all phenomena are exhausted in suchness alone.

original: skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gnas pa med pas mi g-yo bar snang ngo //🔽rang bzhin dang de bzhin nyid dang ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i theg pa chen po'i sa la chos kyi dbyings de nyid rang bzhin nyid @160a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gnas pa med pas mi g-yo bar snang ngo // rang bzhin dang de bzhin nyid dang ngo bo nyid dang zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i theg pa chen po'i sa la chos kyi dbyings de nyid rang bzhin nyid @160a * //
translated: Since there is no arising, no cessation, and no abiding, it appears as unmoving.🔽“Nature, suchness, essence, and characteristic” means that on the ultimate stage of the Great Vehicle, that very dharma-dhātu is apprehended as just the nature,

original: dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid kho nar bzung ste /
analyzed: dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid kho nar bzung ste /
translated: suchness, essence, and characteristic.

original: de nyid rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan med do //
analyzed: de nyid rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan med do //
translated: It is just the nature, there is no other.

original: de nyid de bzhin nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin no //🔽de nyid ngo bo nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin no // de nyid ngo bo nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin no //
translated: It is just suchness, there is no other.🔽It is just the essence, there is no other.

original: de nyid mtshan nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid mtshan nyid yin gyi gzhan ma yin te /
translated: It is just the characteristic, there is no other.

original: de las phye ste ste smos pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de las phye ste ste smos pa tsam du zad do //
translated: It is just a mere designation, distinguished from that.

original: de la mi g-yo ba'i 'gres ni dang po'o //
analyzed: de la mi g-yo ba'i 'gres ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is the invariable order.

original: de nas phung po rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang reg pa rnams dang / tshor ba rnams dang / khams drug dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de nas phung po rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang reg pa rnams dang / tshor ba rnams dang / khams drug dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang /
translated: Then, the aggregates, the sense spheres, the consciousnesses, the contacts, the feelings, the six elements, the limbs of dependent origination, the perfections,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa rnams dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa rnams dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang /
translated: all the emptinesses, the applications of mindfulness, etc., the unmixed final [factors], suchness, unmistaken suchness, unaltered suchness, the true nature of dharmas,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnams te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnams te /
translated: the dharma-realm, the stability of dharmas, the faultlessness of dharmas, the very limit of reality, the inconceivable realm, enlightenment, buddhahood, the conditioned, and the unconditioned.

original: de dag dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply them to those.

original: de'i 'og tu theg pa de la sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu theg pa de la sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs /
translated: After that, in that vehicle, the prior limit is not apprehended,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yang mi dmigs /
translated: the later limit is not apprehended,

original: dbus kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: dbus kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: and the middle is not apprehended.

original: de ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa ste /
analyzed: de ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa ste /
translated: That is the vehicle of the sameness of the three times.

original: de bas na theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di la /
analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di la /
translated: Therefore, it is called the Great Vehicle.

original: de ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa zhes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig bzung ste /
analyzed: de ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa zhes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig bzung ste /
translated: In this passage, the words “That is the vehicle of the sameness of the three times” should be taken as the words that are to be applied.

original: dus zhes bya ba dang / gsum zhes bya ba dang / mnyam pa zhes bya ba dang / theg pa zhes bya ba so sor smos nas /
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba dang / gsum zhes bya ba dang / mnyam pa zhes bya ba dang / theg pa zhes bya ba so sor smos nas /
translated: The word “time,” the word “three,” the word “sameness,” and the word “vehicle” should be applied individually.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyang 'das pa'i dus kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dus sel lo //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyang 'das pa'i dus kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dus sel lo //
translated: “The past time is empty of the past time” and so on eliminate time.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyang dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa zhes bya bas sel to //
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyang dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa zhes bya bas sel to //
translated: “The sameness of the three times is empty of the sameness of the three times” eliminates “sameness.”

original: theg pa chen po yang theg pa chen pos stong ngo zhes bya bas ni theg pa sel to //🔽byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpas stong ngo zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po yang theg pa chen pos stong ngo zhes bya bas ni theg pa sel to // byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpas stong ngo zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The Great Vehicle is empty of the Great Vehicle is an exclusion of the vehicle.

original: skabs nas smos pa'i byang chub @160b sems dpas sel to //
analyzed: skabs nas smos pa'i byang chub @160b sems dpas sel to //
translated: The bodhisattva is empty of the bodhisattva is an exclusion of the bodhisattva mentioned in the context.

original: rab 'byor stong pa nyid la gcig ces bya ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor stong pa nyid la gcig ces bya ba med do //
translated: Subhūti, in emptiness there is no one,

original: gnyis sam gsum mam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gnyis sam gsum mam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: no two, no three, up to🔽no ten.

original: bcu zhes bya ba'i bar du med do zhes bya bas ni grangs kyi tshig sel to //
analyzed: bcu zhes bya ba'i bar du med do zhes bya bas ni grangs kyi tshig sel to //
translated: Thus, the words of number are excluded.

original: de bas na 'di ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa'o zhes bya bas mjug bsdus te bstan pa ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa'o zhes bya bas mjug bsdus te bstan pa ci las dgongs she na /
translated: Therefore, this is the vehicle of the equality of the three times.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i theg pa chen po la bya'o //🔽theg pa chen po yang tha dad du bya ba thams cad dang bral bas /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i theg pa chen po la bya'o // theg pa chen po yang tha dad du bya ba thams cad dang bral bas /
translated: The vehicle of the equality of the three times is the ultimate Great Vehicle.

original: gcig pu'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gcig pu'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The Great Vehicle is the nature of oneness, free from all distinctions.

original: de la ni dus zhes bya ba dang / dus mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba dang / theg pa chen po zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba thams cad stong pa nyid tsam du zad pa'i theg pa'o //
analyzed: de la ni dus zhes bya ba dang / dus mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba dang / theg pa chen po zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba thams cad stong pa nyid tsam du zad pa'i theg pa'o //
translated: In this, all that is called “time,” “sameness of time,” “Great Vehicle,” and “bodhisattva” is reduced to mere emptiness, and this is the vehicle.

original: stong pa nyid tsam du zad pa de la ni kun brtags pa'i chos de dag med pa'i phyir thams cad sel to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid tsam du zad pa de la ni kun brtags pa'i chos de dag med pa'i phyir thams cad sel to //
translated: Since all those imagined phenomena do not exist in mere emptiness, everything is eliminated.

original: de ltar bstsal nas kyang thams cad gcig gi bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bstsal nas kyang thams cad gcig gi bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: And having eliminated them, everything becomes the nature of one.

original: de bas na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa ste zhes bya ba thams cad kyi mjug bsdus so //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa ste zhes bya ba thams cad kyi mjug bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, this is the vehicle of the sameness of the three times of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas. Thus, he concludes everything.

original: de ltar mdor bsdus te bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bsdus te bstan nas /
translated: Having taught this in brief,

original: theg pa chen po 'di la mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas spros te yan lag thams cad sel to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di la mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas spros te yan lag thams cad sel to //
translated: he eliminates all elaborations with “equality and inequality are not apprehended in this Great Vehicle,” and so on.

original: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa nyid tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa nyid tha dad pa'o //
translated: and the difference between equality and inequality.

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “ Attachment and nonattachment are not apprehended” and so on.

original: 'dod chags ni mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: Attachment is inequality.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni mnyam pa'o /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni mnyam pa'o /
translated: Nonattachment is equality.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how it should be applied.

original: de ltar chos thams cad gnyis kyi ngo bor med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad gnyis kyi ngo bor med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that all phenomena do not have the nature of duality,

original: rab 'byor 'das pa'i gzugs ni 'das pa'i gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'das pa'i gzugs ni 'das pa'i gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: “Subhūti, past form is empty of past form” and so on.

original: yang so so'i ming smos te med par bstan to /
analyzed: yang so so'i ming smos te med par bstan to /
translated: Again, having mentioned their individual names, he taught that they do not exist.

original: stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid kyis stong pas dmigs su med na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid kyis stong pas dmigs su med na /
translated: Since emptiness is also empty of emptiness, it is not apprehended.🔽How could past form be apprehended in emptiness?”

original: stong pa nyid la 'das pa'i gzugs dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba la gzugs stong pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs dang 'brel ba'i stong pa nyid smos pa de'i tshe stong pa @161a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la 'das pa'i gzugs dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba la gzugs stong pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs dang 'brel ba'i stong pa nyid smos pa de'i tshe stong pa @161a * //
translated: “ Form is empty” means that when emptiness is mentioned in relation to form, emptiness is not apprehended in emptiness.

original: de nyid kyang kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin na stong pa nyid de la gzugs yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid kyang kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin na stong pa nyid de la gzugs yod par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since that is also an imagined nature, it does not exist. How could form exist in that emptiness?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang /
translated: The dharmas of the perfections such as generosity,

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid la mi dmigs par bstan nas ;
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid la mi dmigs par bstan nas ;
translated: are taught to be non-apprehended in the equality of the three times.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyang mnyam pa nyid la mi dmigs na zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyang mnyam pa nyid la mi dmigs na zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
translated: If equality is not apprehended in equality, what is the intention?

original: mthar thug pa'i theg pa chen po'i sa la ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos thams cad rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur nas /
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i theg pa chen po'i sa la ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos thams cad rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur nas /
translated: In the ultimate Mahāyāna stage, all dharmas such as the perfections become the nature of karmic ripening,

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su zhugs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su zhugs te /
translated: and enter into the essence of emptiness.

original: de bas na de la dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba yang med la /
analyzed: de bas na de la dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba yang med la /
translated: Therefore, there is also no so-called equality of the three times,

original: dus gsum du gtogs pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: dus gsum du gtogs pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yang med do //
translated: and there are no perfections such as generosity included in the three times.

original: de'i phyir / mnyam pa nyid la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mnyam pa nyid la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: How could the perfection of giving in the past, future, and present be apprehended in equality?

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all.

original: 'gres ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / chos thams cad gnyis kyi sgo nas bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / phung po lnga'i chos rnams la dus gsum bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / stong pa nyid la dus gsum du gtogs pa'i phung po lnga'i chos rnams bstsal ba'i 'gres dang /
analyzed: 'gres ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / chos thams cad gnyis kyi sgo nas bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / phung po lnga'i chos rnams la dus gsum bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / stong pa nyid la dus gsum du gtogs pa'i phung po lnga'i chos rnams bstsal ba'i 'gres dang /
translated: The summary verses are: The summary verse on the equality of the three times, the summary verse on all phenomena being twofold, the summary verse on the phenomena of the five aggregates in the three times, and the summary verse on the phenomena of the five aggregates belonging to the three times in emptiness.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid la pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / de dag la stong pa nyid bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / de dag nyid la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag bstsal ba'i 'gres dang /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid la pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / de dag la stong pa nyid bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / de dag nyid la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag bstsal ba'i 'gres dang /
translated: The six perfections are to be supplied in the context of the equality of the three times, and the emptinesses are to be supplied in the context of those perfections. The applications of mindfulness, etc., up to the unentangled factors of enlightenment are to be supplied in the context of those perfections.

original: so so skye bo bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bstsal ba'i 'gres rnams su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: so so skye bo bstsal ba'i 'gres dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bstsal ba'i 'gres rnams su shes par bya'o //
translated: The ordinary person is to be supplied in the context of those factors of enlightenment, and the śrāvaka, pratyekabuddha, bodhisattva, and tathāgata are to be supplied in the context of the ordinary person.

original: de bas na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni chen po rnams kyi theg pa yin pas theg pa chen po zhes bya bar nges pa'i tshig gis bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni chen po rnams kyi theg pa yin pas theg pa chen po zhes bya bar nges pa'i tshig gis bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this is called the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas. This is taught by way of the etymology of mahāyāna, since it is the vehicle of the great beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni shes rab @161b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i slad du bsgo ba mdzad pas 'di ni theg pa chen po bstan par sems so zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan gang pos 'og nas bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir gsol
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni shes rab @161b kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i slad du bsgo ba mdzad pas 'di ni theg pa chen po bstan par sems so zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan gang pos 'og nas bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir gsol
translated: This is Subhūti's request to open the section that will be explained below.

original: pa'o // sngar gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa bshad pa rtsom pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtsams te /
analyzed: pa'o // sngar gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa bshad pa rtsom pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtsams te /
translated: In the composition of the explanation of the previous instruction and subsequent teaching, the Blessed One said, Subhūti, you, having begun with the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bar spobs par gyis shig ces shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir bskos la /
analyzed: ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur bar spobs par gyis shig ces shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir bskos la /
translated: speak with eloquence in such a way that the bodhisattva mahāsattvas will attain certainty in the perfection of wisdom.

original: da ltar ni theg pa chen po bshad pa byas pa las zhus pa ni de'i sgo nas 'og nas bshad pa'i lam 'dod do //
analyzed: da ltar ni theg pa chen po bshad pa byas pa las zhus pa ni de'i sgo nas 'og nas bshad pa'i lam 'dod do //
translated: Now, having explained the Great Vehicle, he asks about it in terms of the path explained below.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'gal bar theg pa chen po bstan pa'am gcig tu ma gyur lags grang zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / theg pa chen po gnyis tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'gal bar theg pa chen po bstan pa'am gcig tu ma gyur lags grang zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / theg pa chen po gnyis tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Lord, I fear that I may have taught the Great Vehicle in a way that contradicts the perfection of wisdom. He thinks that the Great Vehicle and the perfection of wisdom are not different.

original: theg pa chen po bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bstan pa yin par dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bstan pa yin par dgongs pa ste /
translated: By teaching the Great Vehicle, he thinks that the perfection of wisdom is also taught.

original: theg pa chen po bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By teaching the Great Vehicle, the perfection of wisdom is taught.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pas theg pa chen po bstan par 'gyur ro zhes tha ma'i tshig bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pas theg pa chen po bstan par 'gyur ro zhes tha ma'i tshig bstan to //
translated: By teaching the perfection of wisdom, the Great Vehicle is taught. This is the meaning of the final statement.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bcus /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bcus /
translated: The Blessed One, in the following ten phrases beginning with “Thus, a bodhisattva is not apprehended in the past,”

original: 'og nas bshad pa'i sa bon phyi tshig rnams bstan to //
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa'i sa bon phyi tshig rnams bstan to //
translated: teaches the outer seeds that will be explained below.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' sngon byung ba dang / phyis 'byung ba dang / da ltar yang yod do zhes dus gsum la byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs par bstan to //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' sngon byung ba dang / phyis 'byung ba dang / da ltar yang yod do zhes dus gsum la byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs par bstan to //
translated: Therein, with the words “a bodhisattva is not apprehended in the past,” and so on, it is shown that a bodhisattva is not apprehended in the three times, saying that a bodhisattva did not exist in the past, will not exist in the future, and does not exist now.

original: gang gi phyir mtha' gsum po 'di dag la byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pa de'i phyir mtha' med pas byang chub sems dpa' la mtha' thug pa med par bstan nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mtha' gsum po 'di dag la byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pa de'i phyir mtha' med pas byang chub sems dpa' la mtha' thug pa med par bstan nas /
translated: Since a bodhisattva is not apprehended in these three limits, therefore, it is shown that a bodhisattva is limitless because of the absence of limits.

original: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' kun du @162a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' kun du @162a * //
