translated: After that, the Blessed One says, “Blessed One, a bodhisattva is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of form.”

original: mtha' yas par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mtha' yas par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: One should know it as infinite.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la mtha' gsum med pas kun du mtha' yas pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la mtha' gsum med pas kun du mtha' yas pa nyid de /
translated: Since all phenomena such as form and so on are infinite because they are free from the three extremes,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang kun du mtha' yas par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang kun du mtha' yas par rig par bya'o /
translated: one should know that the bodhisattva is also infinite.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa kun du mtha' yas par byang chub sems dpa' kun du mtha' yas pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa kun du mtha' yas par byang chub sems dpa' kun du mtha' yas pa zhes bya na /
translated: If the bodhisattva is said to be infinite because form and so on are infinite,

original: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: then form and so on would become the bodhisattva.

original: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu yang ma mchis /
analyzed: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu yang ma mchis /
translated: It is said, Form is not called the bodhisattva,

original: mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is not apprehended.

original: de ltar dus gsum la byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pas gzugs la sogs pa la yang byang chub sems dpa' ngo bor mi dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum la byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pas gzugs la sogs pa la yang byang chub sems dpa' ngo bor mi dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dmigs su med do //
translated: In this way, since the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the three times, the bodhisattva is not apprehended as the essence of form and so on, so the bodhisattva is not apprehended.

original: de mi dmigs pas gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa gnyis kyang med do //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pas gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa gnyis kyang med do //
translated: Since it is not apprehended, there is no instruction and no teaching.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du ma dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bstan pa'i don nyid bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du ma dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bstan pa'i don nyid bstan to //
translated: Blessed One, if I do not apprehend anything at all of all the bodhisattvas in every way, then I will teach the very same point that was taught above, beginning with the words, “Blessed One, in that case, this so-called ‘bodhisattva’ is just a mere name.”

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba 'di ni ming tsam du bas so zhes bya bas ni de ltar dmigs su med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun brtags pa tsam du zad par ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba 'di ni ming tsam du bas so zhes bya bas ni de ltar dmigs su med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun brtags pa tsam du zad par ston to //
translated: “Blessed One, in that case, this so-called ‘bodhisattva’ is just a mere name” shows that because of that non-apprehension, the bodhisattva is just a mere imputation.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' don dam par med par bstan nas dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' don dam par med par bstan nas dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus shown that the bodhisattva does not exist ultimately, in order to teach the example,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na bdag ces bgyi ba yang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na bdag ces bgyi ba yang /
translated: “Blessed One, it is like this. For example, this so-called ‘self’

original: bdag ni shin tu mngon par grub pa ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag ni shin tu mngon par grub pa ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: is not at all established.”

original: de ltar bstan nas de'i 'og tu gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon par 'grub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de gnyi ga yang med par bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar bstan nas de'i 'og tu gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon par 'grub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de gnyi ga yang med par bstan te /
translated: Having taught that, then after that, he taught that both the characteristic of the non-establishment of form and so on, and the characteristic of the non-existence of establishment are non-existent.

original: de la mngon par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid med pa ni bcom ldan 'das de ltar rang bzhin dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos rnams la gang mngon par 'grub pa'i gzugs de gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid med pa ni bcom ldan 'das de ltar rang bzhin dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos rnams la gang mngon par 'grub pa'i gzugs de gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: Therein, the non-existence of the characteristic of establishment is taught in the passage beginning with “Blessed One, in that way, for phenomena that are essentially non-existent, what is that form which is established?”

original: @162b gzugs la sogs pa ni sgyu ma lta bu yin pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir mngon par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: @162b gzugs la sogs pa ni sgyu ma lta bu yin pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir mngon par 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: Form and so on are like illusions, and because they are essentially non-existent and unborn, they do not have the characteristic of establishment.

original: de'i 'og tu mngon par 'grub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngon par 'grub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to teach the non-existence of the characteristic of the non-existence of establishment,

original: gang mngon par grub pa de ni gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang mngon par grub pa de ni gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, “That which is established is not form” and so on.

original: mngon par 'grub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: The characteristic of non-establishment is the characteristic of the perfected.

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the imagined form and so on.

original: de ltar kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i phyir gdams pa'i 'os ma yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i phyir gdams pa'i 'os ma yin par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that the imagined bodhisattva is not a suitable object of instruction because he does not exist,

original: da ni don dam pa'i chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: da ni don dam pa'i chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: now, from the perspective of the ultimate reality bodhisattva,

original: bcom ldan 'das mngon par ma grub pa las gud na byang chub kyi slad du spyod par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dmigs su ma mchis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mngon par ma grub pa las gud na byang chub kyi slad du spyod par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dmigs su ma mchis na /
translated: the Blessed One is asked, Blessed One, if a bodhisattva practicing for enlightenment cannot be observed apart from non-establishment,

original: mngon par ma grub pa mngon par grub pa mngon par grub pa'i shis rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi'am zhes bya ba gsol te /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa mngon par grub pa mngon par grub pa'i shis rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi'am zhes bya ba gsol te /
translated: should the non-established be instructed and taught the perfection of wisdom of the established?

original: don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas mngon par ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas mngon par ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The ultimate bodhisattva is the nature of the dharma-dhātu, and so has the characteristic of non-establishment.

original: de yang spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa'i 'os ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa'i 'os ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover, because he is beyond all conceptual elaborations, he is not suitable as an object of instruction and teaching. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the ultimate bodhisattva,

original: gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems zhum par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems zhum par mi 'gyur na /
translated: if, when taught in this way, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not become disheartened,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
translated: one should know that bodhisattva-mahāsattva is practicing the perfection of wisdom. This shows the practice of the ultimate.

original: 'di man chad ni sngar glengs pa nyi shu rtsa dgu bzhag pa'i nang nas /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni sngar glengs pa nyi shu rtsa dgu bzhag pa'i nang nas /
translated: From here on, among the twenty-nine topics mentioned earlier,

original: rab 'byor khyod ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang rjes su mthun par theg pa chen po ston to zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang rjes su mthun par theg pa chen po ston to zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Subhuti, you teach the Great Vehicle in accordance with the perfection of wisdom.

original: gtan la dbab pa'i tshig bcu gnyis bkod pa gang yin pa de dag da bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gtan la dbab pa'i tshig bcu gnyis bkod pa gang yin pa de dag da bstan par bya'o //
translated: From there, the twelve topics of ascertainment will be taught.

original: bstan nas kyang bshad par bya'o //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu sems can med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon @163a * //
analyzed: bstan nas kyang bshad par bya'o // tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu sems can med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon @163a * //
translated: Having taught, they will be explained.

original: gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus kyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus kyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Venerable Shariputra, because there are no sentient beings, the bodhisattva is not apprehended at the limit of the past, the limit of the future, or in the middle. This is because of the selflessness of persons.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa'i dus na byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa'i dus na byung ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva existed in the past.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma 'ongs pa na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma 'ongs pa na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva will exist in the future.

original: byang chub sems dpa' da ltar byung ba na yod do zhes bya ba dus gsum du nye bar 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' da ltar byung ba na yod do zhes bya ba dus gsum du nye bar 'gro ba med do zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: The bodhisattva exists in the present. This shows that there is no going to the three times.

original: de'i 'og tu gzugs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos la bdag med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzugs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos la bdag med pa bstan to //
translated: After that, with “because of the formlessness” and so on, he teaches the selflessness of dharmas.

original: 'di dag thams cad gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ni thams cad yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du thams cad gcig par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ni thams cad yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du thams cad gcig par dgongs pa'o //
translated: “ All of these are nondual, not to be made dual” means that all are one in the characteristic of the perfected.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu de bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i de bzhin nyid kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir med pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu de bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i de bzhin nyid kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir med pa'o //
translated: “ Venerable Śāriputra, because suchness does not exist, the bodhisattva is not apprehended at the prior limit” and so on teaches the nonexistence of the suchness of the three times and the suchness of the bodhisattva because they are imagined.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu ci'i phyir gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun du mtha' yas par rig par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig gnyis pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu ci'i phyir gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun du mtha' yas par rig par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig gnyis pa bstan te /
translated: “ Venerable Śāriputra, why is it that the bodhisattva should be known as infinite because of the infinity of form” and so on teaches the second phrase.

original: kun du mtha' yas pa de dag gi sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du mtha' yas pa de dag gi sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their prior limit and so on are non-existent.

original: tshig gsum pa las /
analyzed: tshig gsum pa las /
translated: In the third phrase,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa chos nyid kyi gzugs ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa chos nyid kyi gzugs ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “form, Venerable Śāriputra, is empty of form” means that the form of the perfected nature is empty of the imagined form.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid la gzugs med ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid la gzugs med ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “In emptiness there is no form.”

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid la kun brtags pa'i gzugs med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid la kun brtags pa'i gzugs med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that in the emptiness of form there is no imagined form.

original: tshig bzhi pa la /
analyzed: tshig bzhi pa la /
translated: In the fourth phrase,

original: gzugs ni gzugs la mi dmigs /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs la mi dmigs /
translated: “form is not apprehended in form,”

original: gzugs ni tshor ba la mi dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po la btsal na chos thams cad mi dmigs par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni tshor ba la mi dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po la btsal na chos thams cad mi dmigs par bstan pa ste /
translated: “form is not apprehended in feeling,” and so on, it is taught that all phenomena are not apprehended when sought in their own and others’ natures.

original: 'dis ni thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains “in every way.”

original: tshig lnga pa la 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du @163b ming du btags pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig lnga pa la 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du @163b ming du btags pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the fifth verse, it says, “Thus, this so-called bodhisattva is a name that is adventitiously ascribed.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin na kun rdzob tu de la tha snyad du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin na kun rdzob tu de la tha snyad du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: A bodhisattva is the nature of ultimate emptiness, but in terms of the conventional, the name “bodhisattva” is adventitiously ascribed in order to refer to it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming glo bur du btags pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming glo bur du btags pa ste /
translated: It is a name that is adventitiously ascribed.

original: glo bur zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: glo bur zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: “Adventitiously” means that it does not exist by its own nature.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi ming ltar phyogs bcu gang nas kyang mi 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro zhes bya bas ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi ming ltar phyogs bcu gang nas kyang mi 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro zhes bya bas ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid ston to //
translated: “Just like the names of all phenomena, it does not come from anywhere and does not go anywhere” shows that it does not exist.

original: yang dag par skye ba'i dus na yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
analyzed: yang dag par skye ba'i dus na yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
translated: When it arises, it does not come from anywhere.

original: 'gag pa'i dus na yang gang du yang mi 'gro'o //🔽byang chub sems /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i dus na yang gang du yang mi 'gro'o // byang chub sems /
translated: When it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: dpa'i ming 'ba' zhig de lta yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dpa'i ming 'ba' zhig de lta yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the name of the bodhisattva like that,

original: chos thams cad kyi ming yang 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pas med par bstan nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ming yang 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pas med par bstan nas /
translated: Having taught that the names of all phenomena do not come or go,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro'o zhes bya bas mjug bsdus te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro'o zhes bya bas mjug bsdus te /
translated: he concludes, “In the same way, the name of a bodhisattva does not come from anywhere or go anywhere.”

original: chos thams cad kyi ming dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ming dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The names of all phenomena, of a bodhisattva, and of the name of a bodhisattva do not exist.

original: de ltar ming med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar ming med par bstan nas /
translated: Having taught that names do not exist,

original: 'di ltar gzugs zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'di dag ni ming du btags pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad ming du zad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'di dag ni ming du btags pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad ming du zad par bstan to //
translated: he teaches that all the imputed phenomena, such as “form,” “feeling,” “discrimination,” “compositional factors,” and “consciousness,” are merely names.

original: de'i 'og tu 'di ltar gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming du btags pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa dang / ming dag tha dad pa ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'di ltar gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming du btags pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa dang / ming dag tha dad pa ma yin par bstan te /
translated: After that, it is said, “That which is designated as the name ‘form’ is not form,” and so on. This teaches that the form of reality and so on and the names are not different.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming kun brtags pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming kun brtags pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The name “form” is a designation. This means that the name is the ultimate form.

original: de skad bstan nas de'i 'og tu 'di ltar ming ni ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: de skad bstan nas de'i 'og tu 'di ltar ming ni ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: After teaching that, it is said, “The name is empty of the name’s own entity.

original: stong pa gang yin pa de ni ming ma yin no zhes bya bas ming dang / stong pa gnyis tha dad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan te kun brtags pa'i ming gang yin pa de ni ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
analyzed: stong pa gang yin pa de ni ming ma yin no zhes bya bas ming dang / stong pa gnyis tha dad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan te kun brtags pa'i ming gang yin pa de ni ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
translated: That which is empty is not a name.” This teaches the reason that the name and emptiness are not different. The name that is a designation is empty of the name’s own entity.

original: de'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the emptiness of that is not the name’s own entity.

original: de ltar ming @164a * //
analyzed: de ltar ming @164a * //
translated: Thus, the name

original: yod pa ma yin pa dang / don dam pa'i chos rnams yod pa'i phyir chos de dag ming gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa dang / don dam pa'i chos rnams yod pa'i phyir chos de dag ming gi rang bzhin no //
translated: because they do not exist, and because the ultimate dharmas do exist, those dharmas are of the nature of names.

original: de bas na don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang ming gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate bodhisattva also is not of the nature of a name.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba glo bur du btags pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba glo bur du btags pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that “bodhisattva” is a mere adventitious designation,

original: de'i phyir 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said: “Therefore, this, namely ‘bodhisattva,’ is a mere name.”

original: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams la yang mthun par bsgre bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams la yang mthun par bsgre bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the elements, sense bases, and dependent origination should be understood in the same way.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la ni tha dad de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la ni tha dad de /
translated: However, the perfections and so on are different.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang ming med ming la yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yang kun brtags pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang ming med ming la yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yang kun brtags pa nyid yin la /
translated: The perfection of giving, etc. are also just imagined,

original: ming yang kun brtags pa nyid do //
analyzed: ming yang kun brtags pa nyid do //
translated: and the name is also just imagined.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ming gnas pa yang ma yin ming la yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ming gnas pa yang ma yin ming la yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, the perfection of giving does not dwell in the name, nor does the name dwell in the perfection of giving,

original: gnyi ga yang sgyu ma dang mtshungs pas dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang sgyu ma dang mtshungs pas dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are like an illusion, and are therefore non-entities.

original: de bas na 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang med cing /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar ming gang yin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang med cing /
translated: Therefore, it is said that neither the name nor the perfection of giving exist,

original: mi dmigs zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mi dmigs zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and that both are non-apprehensible.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to everything.

original: tshig drug pa la /
analyzed: tshig drug pa la /
translated: The six-word [verse]🔽is as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu 'di ltar bdag shin tu med pas mi dmigs na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu 'di ltar bdag shin tu med pas mi dmigs na /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, since a self is utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,🔽how could it be established?

original: de mngon par grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod ces bya ba la sogs pas bdag la sogs pa gang zag rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams shin tu med la /
analyzed: de mngon par grub par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod ces bya ba la sogs pas bdag la sogs pa gang zag rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams shin tu med la /
translated: Thus, persons such as a self and phenomena such as form are utterly nonexistent.

original: yod pa ma yin na mngon par 'grub pa dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin na mngon par 'grub pa dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
translated: If they do not exist, how could they be established or arise?

original: de bas na chos thams cad mngon par 'grub pa shin tu med pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad mngon par 'grub pa shin tu med pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are taught to have the characteristic of being utterly unestablished.

original: mngon par 'grub pa med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa med pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: “Non-establishment” should be understood as emptiness.

original: tshig bdun pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo la ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: tshig bdun pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo la ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
translated: “There is no intrinsic nature” in the Seven-Line Prayer means that there is no intrinsic nature in its own nature.

original: rang gi gang yin pa de nyid ngo bo nyid ces bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rang gi gang yin pa de nyid ngo bo nyid ces bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: What is its own nature is called its intrinsic nature.

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not something else.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos @164b thams cad ni brten nas 'byung gi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos @164b thams cad ni brten nas 'byung gi /
translated: All phenomena such as form arise in dependence.

original: ma brten par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma brten par ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not arise independently.

original: gang zag gzhan las brten te 'byung ba de dag ni gzhan gyi nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zag gzhan las brten te 'byung ba de dag ni gzhan gyi nyid yin gyi /
translated: Those that arise in dependence on other persons are other,

original: rang gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ni ma yin no //
translated: not one’s own.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: since all phenomena are essentially unreal,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: they are said to be “essenceless.”

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa rnams nus par 'gyur ba'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa rnams nus par 'gyur ba'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de /
translated: Therefore, the emptiness that is the insubstantiality of imagined form, etc.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin zhing /
translated: is not dependently arisen,

original: gzhan la ltos pa ma yin pas de nyid chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du rigs so //🔽de bas na 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa ma yin pas de nyid chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du rigs so // de bas na 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bshad de /
translated: and does not depend on another. It is reasonable that it is the essence of all phenomena.🔽Therefore, it is said that the essence of the dependently arisen is insubstantial.

original: 'dus pa las byung ba ni ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dus pa las byung ba ni ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the dependently arisen is not an essence.

original: 'dus nas 'byung bas na 'dus pa las 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus nas 'byung bas na 'dus pa las 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they arise from a collection, they are called “arisen from a collection.”

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'byung zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they arise from a collection of causes and conditions.

original: de la 'gres rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
analyzed: de la 'gres rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
translated: There are three ways of explaining this.

original: 'dus pa las byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni gcig go //
analyzed: 'dus pa las byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni gcig go //
translated: One is that they are essenceless because they arise from a collection.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba yang gcig go //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba yang gcig go //
translated: Another is that they are essenceless because they are impermanent, and so on.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin zhing rnam par 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba yang gcig go //
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin zhing rnam par 'jig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba yang gcig go //
translated: Yet another is that they are essenceless because they do not endure eternally and do not disintegrate.

original: chos thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mi rtag pa ste gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: All phenomena are impermanent, but not because they are devoid of anything.

original: nyan yan/ thos kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba chos skyes pa gyes pa dang zhig pa la bya'o //
analyzed: nyan yan/ thos kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba chos skyes pa gyes pa dang zhig pa la bya'o //
translated: In the system of the Hearers, impermanence is said to be the arising and passing away of things.

original: 'dir ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid de lta ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: 'dir ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid de lta ma yin par ston te /
translated: Here, it is taught that impermanence is not like that.

original: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po 'di la mi rtag pa'i don ni med pa'i don to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir mi rtag pa'i sgra ni med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po 'di la mi rtag pa'i don ni med pa'i don to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir mi rtag pa'i sgra ni med pa la bya'o //
translated: The term “impermanent” refers to nonexistence, because it is said that “in this Great Vehicle, the meaning of impermanent is the meaning of nonexistence.”

original: ji lta zhe na rtag pa las bzlog pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na rtag pa las bzlog pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: How so? The opposite of permanent is called “impermanent.”

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni gang rtag tu yod pa de la bya ste /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni gang rtag tu yod pa de la bya ste /
translated: “Permanent” refers to what is always existent.

original: de bas na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni gang rtag tu med pa de la bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni gang rtag tu med pa de la bya'o //
translated: Therefore, “impermanent” refers to what is always nonexistent.

original: gang rtag tu dus thams cad du med pa de la mi rtag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang rtag tu dus thams cad du med pa de la mi rtag ces bya'o //
translated: What is always nonexistent at all times is called “impermanent.”

original: de'i phyir med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of nonexistence is the meaning of impermanent.

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Thus, all imagined phenomena such as form and so on are impermanent.

original: med pa'i phyir yod pa las gyur pa gang yang med @165a * //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir yod pa las gyur pa gang yang med @165a * //
translated: Because they do not exist, there is nothing that becomes existent.

original: ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu 'di ltar mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa dang zad pa ste zhes bya ba la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni med pa dang / dngos po ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ri'i bu 'di ltar mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa dang zad pa ste zhes bya ba la mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni med pa dang / dngos po ma yin pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, in this way, what is impermanent is non-entity and exhausted.

original: stong pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: The term “impermanent” refers to emptiness.

original: zad ces bya ba'i sgra ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: zad ces bya ba'i sgra ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams la bya'o //
translated: The term “exhausted” refers to the imagined dharmas.

original: de ltar ni mi rtag pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid dang / kun brtags pa'i chos zad pa dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi rtag pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid dang / kun brtags pa'i chos zad pa dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, what is impermanent is emptiness, and the imagined dharmas, which are exhausted, are non-entity. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar chos thams cad ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, “all dharmas are impermanent” is taught to be “all dharmas are non-entity.”

original: de bas na chos thams cad kyi yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad kyi yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of the perfected nature, suchness, is taught.

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: All dharmas are the non-entityness of nature.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad la dngos po'i rnam par mngon par zhen nas nye bar len na sdug bsngal gsum gyi rgyur 'gyur bas sdug bsngal zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad la dngos po'i rnam par mngon par zhen nas nye bar len na sdug bsngal gsum gyi rgyur 'gyur bas sdug bsngal zhes brjod do //
translated: Likewise, all phenomena are suffering means that all phenomena, such as form, are imagined, and when one clings to them as real entities and appropriates them, they become the cause of the three kinds of suffering, and so they are called suffering.

original: gang gi tshe kun brtags pa'i rnam pa dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su shes nas mngon par mi zhen cing spong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun brtags pa'i rnam pa dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su shes nas mngon par mi zhen cing spong ba de'i tshe /
translated: When one fully understands that the imagined aspect is the identity of non-entity and does not cling to it and abandons it,

original: sdug bsngal med pa'i rgyur gyur pas bde ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa'i rgyur gyur pas bde ba yin no //
translated: it becomes the cause of the absence of suffering and so is bliss.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: sdug bsngal ni kun brtags pa'i chos zhes bya ba'o //🔽chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa rnams dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kho nar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni kun brtags pa'i chos zhes bya ba'o // chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa rnams dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kho nar bstan pa yin te /
translated: suffering is called an imagined phenomenon.🔽All phenomena are suffering means that the imagined are taught to have the mere character of non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Because they are the identity of non-entity, all phenomena are suffering.

original: 'dir yang sdug bsngal ni gang dang yang bral bas ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir yang sdug bsngal ni gang dang yang bral bas ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Here also, suffering is not due to being separated from anything whatsoever.

original: sdug bsngal ni bde ba'i rnam pa yod pa gang dang yang bral bas ni ma yin gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni bde ba'i rnam pa yod pa gang dang yang bral bas ni ma yin gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Suffering is not due to being separated from anything whatsoever that has the aspect of pleasure. The meaning is that suffering is due to the nonexistence of an entity.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de ni med pa dang zad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de ni med pa dang zad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: whatever is suffering is called nonexistent and exhausted.

original: kun brtags pa'i chos zad par gyur ba rnams dngos po ma yin pa dang / med pa la phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen par gyur pa la sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos zad par gyur ba rnams dngos po ma yin pa dang / med pa la phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen par gyur pa la sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the exhaustion of imputed phenomena is called suffering because of the nonexistence of an entity and the nonexistence of what is erroneously inverted.

original: bdag med pa yang gang dang yang @165b bral bas ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa yang gang dang yang @165b bral bas ma yin te /
translated: Selflessness is also not due to being separated from anything whatsoever.

original: bdag med pa dang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is due to the selflessness and the absence of an intrinsic nature.

original: bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa dang / zad pa ste zhes bya ba ni zad pa'i chos rnams kyi dngos po med pa gang yin pa de nyid bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa dang / zad pa ste zhes bya ba ni zad pa'i chos rnams kyi dngos po med pa gang yin pa de nyid bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the non-entityness of phenomena that are extinguished is itself selflessness.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all [the other negations].

original: chos thams cad ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: All phenomena are not permanent and not extinguished. This is also a reason of the nature of non-entityness.

original: gal te kun brtags pa rnams la ngo bo nyid 'ga' zhig yod na ni de ther zug tu gnas pa rtag pa'am /
analyzed: gal te kun brtags pa rnams la ngo bo nyid 'ga' zhig yod na ni de ther zug tu gnas pa rtag pa'am /
translated: If the imagined had any nature, it would be either permanent, in the sense of being stable, or

original: 'jig pa mi rtag pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'jig pa mi rtag pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: impermanent, in the sense of being extinguished.

original: de ltar de ni sgyu ma'i gzugs bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pas /
analyzed: de ltar de ni sgyu ma'i gzugs bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pas /
translated: But since it is like an illusory form, it has no nature.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: sgyu ma'i gzugs la rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i gzugs la rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: One cannot say of an illusory form that it is permanent,

original: mi rtag ces bya bar brjod par mi nus pa de'i phyir chos thams cad ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar brjod par mi nus pa de'i phyir chos thams cad ni ther zug tu gnas pa ma yin /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are not permanent.

original: 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not destroyed.

original: tshig brgyad pa la gzugs mngon par 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa po gang yang med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshig brgyad pa la gzugs mngon par 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa po gang yang med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: In the eighth verse, “form is unconditioned” means that form and so on are unconditioned because there is no one who conditions them.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan to //
translated: they are said to be unarisen.” Thus, all phenomena are taught to have the nature of emptiness.

original: tshig dgu pa la /
analyzed: tshig dgu pa la /
translated: In the ninth verse,

original: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: “form is empty by nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med de /
translated: That which is empty by nature does not arise or perish.

original: skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa gang yin pa de la gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med do zhes bya ba la gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid de stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa gang yin pa de la gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med do zhes bya ba la gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid de stong pa nyid do //
translated: That which is not produced and does not cease also does not transform into something else. The nature of phenomena such as form is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Emptiness is the nature of all phenomena.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa de la /
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature🔽is not produced and does not cease.

original: skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos yongs su grub pa rnams la skye ba dang / 'gag pa gnyis med do //
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'jig pa med do zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos yongs su grub pa rnams la skye ba dang / 'gag pa gnyis med do //
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature is not produced and does not cease.

original: de gnyis med pas gzhan du 'gyur ba rga ba yang med do //
analyzed: de gnyis med pas gzhan du 'gyur ba rga ba yang med do //
translated: That which is not produced and does not cease also does not transform into something else.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba rnams med pa'i phyir skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba dang ldan par kun brtags shing @166a * //
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba rnams med pa'i phyir skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba dang ldan par kun brtags shing @166a * //
translated: Thus, because of the absence of intrinsic production, cessation, and transformation, the imagined, which is endowed with production, cessation, and transformation,

original: mngon par grub pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag don dam par mngon par ma grub pas med pa'i phyir gang mngon par ma grub pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mngon par grub pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag don dam par mngon par ma grub pas med pa'i phyir gang mngon par ma grub pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Whatever is characterized by manifest existence, such as form, etc., is ultimately nonexistent because of not being manifestly existent. Therefore, whatever is not manifestly existent is not form, etc.

original: gang mngon par ma grub pa de rnam par shes pa'i bar dum yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang mngon par ma grub pa de rnam par shes pa'i bar dum yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Whatever is not manifestly existent is not consciousness, etc.

original: tshig bcu pa la /
analyzed: tshig bcu pa la /
translated: In the Ten-Verse [Perfection of Wisdom Sutra],

original: mngon par ma grub pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: it says: Whatever is not manifestly existent is the perfection of wisdom.🔽Whatever is the perfection of wisdom is not manifestly existent.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba la mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba la mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The term not manifestly existent refers to suchness,

original: stong pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: which should be understood as emptiness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i sgra yang de bzhin nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i sgra yang de bzhin nyid la bya'o //
translated: The term perfection of wisdom also refers to suchness.

original: de bas na mngon par ma grub pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis la tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na mngon par ma grub pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis la tha dad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, non-establishment and the perfection of wisdom are not different.

original: de'i phyir ci ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mngon par ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su gdams par bgyi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mngon par ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su gdams par bgyi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “How can the ultimate Bodhisattva, whose nature is non-establishment, instruct and teach the perfection of wisdom, whose nature is non-establishment?”

original: stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid ji ltar gdams par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid ji ltar gdams par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is, “How can emptiness instruct emptiness?”

original: tshig bcu gcig pa la /
analyzed: tshig bcu gcig pa la /
translated: In the eleventh verse,

original: mngon par ma grub pa yang gzhan la byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan zhes bya ba yin par yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa yang gzhan la byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan zhes bya ba yin par yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: “I do not see any other non-establishment and any other Bodhisattva,” shows that the Bodhisattva is of the nature of emptiness.

original: mngon par ma grub pa dang / gzugs la gnyis su med do zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs bzung nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa dang / gzugs la gnyis su med do zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs bzung nas bstan pa'o //
translated: And form is nondual with the unestablished is taught by apprehending the form of reality.

original: tshig bcu gnyis pa la /
analyzed: tshig bcu gnyis pa la /
translated: In the twelfth phrase,

original: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa dang mtshungs par so sor brtags na gang la bying ba'am skrag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /🔽// / bam po bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa dang mtshungs par so sor brtags na gang la bying ba'am skrag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / // / bam po bcu bdun pa /
translated: all phenomena are similar to illusions, mirages, and so on. When examined, one will not become depressed or frightened. This is the meaning of the phrase.

original: de ltar re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa yid la byed pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa yid la byed pa bstan nas /
translated: In this way, the nonconceptual mental attention has been taught.

original: de'i 'og tu yid la byed pa de dag gi 'bras bu ston te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yid la byed pa de dag gi 'bras bu ston te /
translated: After that, the result of those mental attentions is taught.

original: de'i tshe 'di ni gzugs zhes bgyi bar gzugs la mi 'dzin cing mi len mi gnas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di ni gzugs zhes bgyi bar gzugs la mi 'dzin cing mi len mi gnas te /
translated: At that time, this is form is not apprehended, not taken up, not dwelled upon,🔽not clung to,

original: mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la /
translated: and not imputed with respect to form.

original: 'dogs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir tshig lnga smos te /
analyzed: 'dogs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir tshig lnga smos te /
translated: This is taught by the five phrases for the purpose of demonstrating the apprehension of the object.

original: @166b thog mar 'du shes kyis mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: @166b thog mar 'du shes kyis mi 'dzin to //
translated: First, it is not apprehended by discrimination.

original: de'i 'og tu yid kyis mi len to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yid kyis mi len to //
translated: Then, the mind does not take hold of it.

original: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyis gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyis gnas par mi byed do //
translated: Then, wisdom does not make it abide.

original: de'i 'og tu lta bas mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lta bas mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: Then, views do not cling to it.

original: de'i 'og tu tshig gis gzhan dag la 'dogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshig gis gzhan dag la 'dogs par mi byed do //
translated: Then, words do not impute it to others.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is because form is unborn.

original: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs lags so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs lags so //
translated: The unborn nature of form is form.

original: de ltar na gzugs dang ma skyes pa de gnyis su ma mchis te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs dang ma skyes pa de gnyis su ma mchis te /
translated: Thus, form and the unborn are not two,

original: gnyis su bgyir ma mchis so //
analyzed: gnyis su bgyir ma mchis so //
translated: nor are they divided.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar ma skyes pa ni gcig pa ma lags mang po ma lags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar ma skyes pa ni gcig pa ma lags mang po ma lags zhes bya ba la /
translated: Blessed One, it is because the unborn is neither one nor many.

original: gzugs ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs ma skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs ma skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The unborn nature of form means the unborn nature of the true nature of form.

original: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs de'i ma skyes pa zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs de'i ma skyes pa zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: The statement “The non-arising of form is not form” means that the reality of form, which is called “non-arising,” is not the imagined nature of form.

original: de ltar na gzugs dang ma skyes pa de gnyis su ma mchis te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs dang ma skyes pa de gnyis su ma mchis te /
translated: Thus, form and non-arising are not dual.

original: gnyis su bgyir ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya bas ci bstan zhe na /🔽de la gzugs ma skyes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni yongs su grub pa ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su bgyir ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya bas ci bstan zhe na / de la gzugs ma skyes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni yongs su grub pa ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement “They are not made dual by anything” indicates what?🔽The phrase “The non-arising of form” indicates the perfected nature, which is the non-arising reality.

original: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi skye ba la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med par bstan pa yin te de ltar chos nyid kyi gzugs mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang mi skye ba yang
analyzed: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi skye ba la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med par bstan pa yin te de ltar chos nyid kyi gzugs mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang mi skye ba yang
translated: The statement “The non-arising of form is not form” indicates that non-arising does not have the imagined nature. Thus, the reality of form is the non-arising nature, and non-arising

original: chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba dang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid de tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba dang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid de tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is the nature of reality, what is called “form” and what is called “unborn” are the same, not different.

original: ma skyes pa ni gcig ma lags mang po ma lags zhes bya ba la ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de de la ni gcig gam gnyis she'am /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni gcig ma lags mang po ma lags zhes bya ba la ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de de la ni gcig gam gnyis she'am /
translated: The unborn is not one, not many.

original: gsum zhes bya ba'i grangs kyi bye brag yod pa ma yin te de bas na mi skye ba la bye brag med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa thams cad kyang rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba'i grangs kyi bye brag yod pa ma yin te de bas na mi skye ba la bye brag med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa thams cad kyang rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The unborn is thusness, and it is not that it has a specific number, such as one, two, or three. Therefore, because there is no distinction in the unborn, at the time of the perfected, all forms and so on would have the same nature.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Thus,

original: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang @167a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang @167a * //
translated: The unborn of form

original: lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi skye ba med pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi skye ba med pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “That which is not form” means that the reality of the non-production of form is not the essential nature of the imagined form.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni ma skyes pa ste de bzhin nyid kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de de bzhin nyid ma lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni ma skyes pa ste de bzhin nyid kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de de bzhin nyid ma lags te /
translated: “Bhagavān, thusness is non-produced. The non-production of thusness is not thusness.

original: de ltar na de bzhin nyid dang / ma skyes pa de gnyis su ma mchis te gnyis su bgyir ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa bzung nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin nyid dang / ma skyes pa de gnyis su ma mchis te gnyis su bgyir ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa bzung nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, thusness and non-production are not two, nor are they divided.” This should be applied to the thusness that is together with stains and the thusness that is without stains.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni mi rtag pa ste gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni mi rtag pa ste gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags te /
translated: “Bhagavān, form is impermanent. The diminution of form is not form.

original: de ltar na gzugs dang 'grib pa de gnyis su ma mchis shing gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs dang 'grib pa de gnyis su ma mchis shing gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: Thus, form and its disappearance are not two, nor are they divided.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'di ltar 'grib pa ni gcig ma lags mang po ma lags pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'di ltar 'grib pa ni gcig ma lags mang po ma lags pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Bhagavān, it is because disappearance is neither one nor many.🔽Therefore, whatever is the disappearance of form is not form.

original: de'i slad du gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags so zhes bya ba la med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i slad du gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags so zhes bya ba la med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is said that the meaning of nonexistence is the meaning of impermanence,

original: gzugs mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “form is impermanent” means “form does not exist.”

original: gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzugs med pa la kun brtags pa'i rnam pa ni 'gyur ba'i phyir 'grib pa zhes bya ste brtags pa'i gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang yin pa ni chos nyid kyi gzugs ma yin
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzugs med pa la kun brtags pa'i rnam pa ni 'gyur ba'i phyir 'grib pa zhes bya ste brtags pa'i gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang yin pa ni chos nyid kyi gzugs ma yin
translated: “Whatever is the disappearance of form is not form” means that since the aspect imagined in nonexistence is changeable, it is called “disappearance.” Whatever is the disappearance of imagined form is not the form of reality.

original: no // de ltar na gzugs dang 'grib pa de gnyis su ma mchis shing gnyis su bgyir ma mchis zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang 'grib pa gnyi ga yang brtags pa yin pas med pa'i phyir gcig kho na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: no // de ltar na gzugs dang 'grib pa de gnyis su ma mchis shing gnyis su bgyir ma mchis zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang 'grib pa gnyi ga yang brtags pa yin pas med pa'i phyir gcig kho na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that since both form and its extinction are imagined, they are nonexistent, and therefore they are one only.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar 'grib pa ni gcig ma lags mang po ma lags zhes bya ba ni 'grib pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar 'grib pa ni gcig ma lags mang po ma lags zhes bya ba ni 'grib pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Blessed One, in this way, extinction is not one, nor is it many.

original: sgyu ma'i gzugs bzhin du don dam par grangs kyi bye brag med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i gzugs bzhin du don dam par grangs kyi bye brag med do //
translated: This means that since extinction does not exist, ultimately it is not divided into different numbers, like the form of an illusion.

original: de bas na brtags pa'i rang bzhin thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na brtags pa'i rang bzhin thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, all imagined natures are the same in being the nature of nonexistence.

original: de lta bas na gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma @167b lags zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi 'grib pa de chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma @167b lags zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi 'grib pa de chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, whatever is the extinction of form is not form. This means that the extinction of imagined form is not the reality nature of form.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One, suchness is impermanent.🔽That which is the decrease of suchness is not suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de de bzhin nyid ma lags zhes bya ba 'di la yang dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i bye brag gis sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de de bzhin nyid ma lags zhes bya ba 'di la yang dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i bye brag gis sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be applied by way of the distinction of being with stain and being without stain.

original: 'di ltar sngar dri ma dang bcas par gyur pa las phyis dri ma med par 'gyur te de'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar dri ma dang bcas par gyur pa las phyis dri ma med par 'gyur te de'i phyir mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is impermanent because it becomes with stain and later becomes without stain.

original: de ltar mi rtag pa'i de bzhin nyid la gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag pa'i de bzhin nyid la gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid /
translated: Thus, the decrease of suchness that is impermanent is not the suchness of form,

original: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i 'grib pa de yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i 'grib pa de yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: the suchness of feeling, and so on.🔽That which is called form, Blessed One, is reckoned as non-dual.

original: gang yang 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das gzugs zhes bgyi ba 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis pa'i grangs su bgyis pa'o zhes bya ba la gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid de don dam pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das gzugs zhes bgyi ba 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis pa'i grangs su bgyis pa'o zhes bya ba la gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid de don dam pa'o //
translated: Non-dual means reality, the ultimate.

original: don dam pa de'i grangs su bya ba ni 'di lta ste gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa de'i grangs su bya ba ni 'di lta ste gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa byas pa'o //
translated: The enumeration of that ultimate is as follows: form, feeling, etc.

original: des ci bstan zhe na don dam pa gcig kho na ste gnyis su med pa la /
analyzed: des ci bstan zhe na don dam pa gcig kho na ste gnyis su med pa la /
translated: What does that teach? The one ultimate alone, which is nondual,

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs /🔽chos nyid kyi tshor ba /🔽chos nyid kyi 'du shes /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs / chos nyid kyi tshor ba / chos nyid kyi 'du shes /
translated: is taught by the words “the reality of form,”🔽“the reality of feeling,”

original: chos nyid kyi 'du byed /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi 'du byed /
translated: “the reality of perception,”🔽“the reality of volitional predispositions,”

original: chos nyid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis don dam pa gcig ste gnyis su med pa la rnam pa mang por phye nas bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis don dam pa gcig ste gnyis su med pa la rnam pa mang por phye nas bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “the reality of consciousness,” etc., as being divided into many aspects, the one ultimate alone, which is nondual.🔽Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Subhūti.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes pa 'di gang dang sbyar zhe na /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes pa 'di gang dang sbyar zhe na /
translated: To what does this refer?

original: gang rnam par mi rtog pa yid la byed pa'i 'bras bu bstan ma thag pa la gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis 'gres bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: gang rnam par mi rtog pa yid la byed pa'i 'bras bu bstan ma thag pa la gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis 'gres bzhi bstan te /
translated: The elder Subhūti taught the fourfold summary in regard to the just-taught result of the nonconceptual mental state.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing chos de dag la 'di ltar nye bar rtog pa de'i tshe gzugs la mi 'dzin cing mi len mi gnas te mngon par zhen par
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing chos de dag la 'di ltar nye bar rtog pa de'i tshe gzugs la mi 'dzin cing mi len mi gnas te mngon par zhen par
translated: Blessed One, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom and investigate those dharmas in this way, at that time they do not grasp, do not take up, do not dwell on, and do not settle down on form.

original: mi bgyid ces bya ba ni gcig go //
analyzed: mi bgyid ces bya ba ni gcig go //
translated: This is the first.

original: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa'o //🔽gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba ni @168a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa'o // gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba ni @168a * //
translated: The second is “The non-arising of form is not form.”🔽The third is “The decrease of form is not form.”

original: gsum pa'o // gzugs zhes bgyi ba 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis pa'i grangs su bgyis pa lags so zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'o // gzugs zhes bgyi ba 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis pa'i grangs su bgyis pa lags so zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is “This so-called form is a non-dual number.”

original: 'gres bzhi po 'di dag nye bar bzung nas de las rgya cher bstan pa nyan 'dod pa'i phyir gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus dri ba dris so zhes bya ba de lta bur sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gres bzhi po 'di dag nye bar bzung nas de las rgya cher bstan pa nyan 'dod pa'i phyir gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus dri ba dris so zhes bya ba de lta bur sbyar ro //
translated: Taking up these four sets, in order to listen to the extensive teaching from them, the elder Śāriputra asked questions.

original: de la 'gres dang po la /
analyzed: de la 'gres dang po la /
translated: The first repetition is as follows.🔽A bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom should investigate as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing 'di ltar nye bar rtog ste zhes bya ba tshig gsum nye bar bzung nas dri ba gsum dris te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing 'di ltar nye bar rtog ste zhes bya ba tshig gsum nye bar bzung nas dri ba gsum dris te /
translated: Having taken up these three phrases, he asks three questions:

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang /
translated: What is a bodhisattva?🔽What is the perfection of wisdom?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang nye bar rtog pa ni gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang nye bar rtog pa ni gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is investigation?

original: de dag go rims bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag go rims bzhin du bshad par bya ste /
translated: They should be explained in order.🔽Bodhi itself is a sattva, therefore it is called a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub nyid sems dpa' ste de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la byang chub ces bya ba ni chos kyi sku la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub nyid sems dpa' ste de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la byang chub ces bya ba ni chos kyi sku la bya'o //
translated: Here, bodhi is to be taken as the dharma body.

original: sems can thams cad kyang chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid de de bas na byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub kyi bdag nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid de de bas na byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub kyi bdag nyid kho na'o //
translated: All sentient beings are also the nature of the dharma body, therefore a bodhisattva is also just the nature of enlightenment.

original: de lta bas na byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid ni sems dpa' yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid ni sems dpa' yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, since the essence of enlightenment is a hero, it is a synonym for “enlightenment hero.”

original: de ltar na sems can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na sems can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then wouldn’t all sentient beings be enlightenment heroes?

original: spyir gleng ba la khyad par du brjod par 'dod pas khyad par du byang chub dang 'brel ba'i sems dpa' la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bas 'di la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: spyir gleng ba la khyad par du brjod par 'dod pas khyad par du byang chub dang 'brel ba'i sems dpa' la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bas 'di la nyes pa med do //
translated: Since it is a general statement, and it is the particular that is intended, it is a particular enlightenment hero, one connected with enlightenment, that is called an enlightenment hero.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi tshol zhing de'i don mi sgrub pa rnams ni byang chub dang 'brel pa gang yang med pa'i phyir 'di ni khyad par du byang chub dang 'brel ba'i sems dpa' la byang chub sems dpa' zhes
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi tshol zhing de'i don mi sgrub pa rnams ni byang chub dang 'brel pa gang yang med pa'i phyir 'di ni khyad par du byang chub dang 'brel ba'i sems dpa' la byang chub sems dpa' zhes
translated: Sentient beings other than that one, who do not seek the knowledge of all aspects and do not accomplish its aim, are not connected with enlightenment at all. Therefore, it is a particular enlightenment hero, one connected with enlightenment, that is called an enlightenment hero.

original: bya'o // de bas na 'di'i spyod pa khyad par can yang ston te /
analyzed: bya'o // de bas na 'di'i spyod pa khyad par can yang ston te /
translated: And so it is a special practice that is taught here.

original: byang chub des kyang chos thams cad kyi rnam pa shes te chos de dag la mngon par zhen pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pas ni shes te don dam par ni mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub des kyang chos thams cad kyi rnam pa shes te chos de dag la mngon par zhen pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pas ni shes te don dam par ni mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: By the conventional truth he knows, but ultimately he does not settle down.🔽By what aspects, by what signs, by what marks?

original: rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis zhes bya ba la rnam pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis zhes bya ba la rnam pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: By what aspects means the teaching.

original: rtags dang mtshan ma gnyis ni de'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rtags dang mtshan ma gnyis ni de'i bshad pa'o //
translated: The two, signs and marks, are the explanation of that.

original: ming @168b dang / brda dang brtags pa la sogs pa ni rtags so //
analyzed: ming @168b dang / brda dang brtags pa la sogs pa ni rtags so //
translated: Name, symbol, and designation, etc. are signs.

original: mtshan nyid dang / spyod pa ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / spyod pa ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: Characteristic and activity are marks.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus gang la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba de ni ring du song ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus gang la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba de ni ring du song ba ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The venerable Śāriputra said, “That which is called the perfection of wisdom has gone far,

original: chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu song ba'i shes rab ni chos de dag thams cad las ring du gyur pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu song ba'i shes rab ni chos de dag thams cad las ring du gyur pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, which has gone to the other side of all dharmas, is called the perfection of wisdom because it has gone far beyond all those dharmas.
