original: thabs dang rigs pas rtogs pa ni nye bar rtogs pa'o //🔽de'i 'og tu 'gres gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: thabs dang rigs pas rtogs pa ni nye bar rtogs pa'o // de'i 'og tu 'gres gnyis pa ni /
translated: Realization by means of method and reasoning is thorough understanding.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir de skad du gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes zer zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir de skad du gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes zer zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: After that, the second repetition is taught by the passage beginning with “Venerable Subhūti, why is it said that the non-arising of form is not form?” and so on.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de gzugs kyi dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de gzugs kyi dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, form is empty of form” means that the imagined form does not exist as the entity of form. This is the meaning.

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin te skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin zhing skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin🔽no // tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni skye ba med pa ste skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin te skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin zhing skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no // tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni skye ba med pa ste skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no
translated: The emptiness of form is not form, because it is not produced. This means that the emptiness of the intrinsic reality of form, which is the reality of form, is not the reality of form, nor is it the reality of production.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for this reason, the non-production of form is not form. This means that imagined form is not produced, nor is it the reality of production.

original: // de bas na mi skye ba ni gzugs ma yin par de ltar grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: // de bas na mi skye ba ni gzugs ma yin par de ltar grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, non-production is not form. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: de'i 'og tu 'gres gsum pa'i skabs ni tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir na de skad du gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes zer zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'gres gsum pa'i skabs ni tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir na de skad du gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes zer zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: The next section, the third repetition, is taught by “Venerable Subhūti, why do you say, ‘The decrease of form is not form’?”

original: gzugs gang yin pa dang 'grib pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis gzugs kyang brtags pa /
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa dang 'grib pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis gzugs kyang brtags pa /
translated: “Form and the decrease of form are neither conjoined nor disjoined” is as previously explained, form is imputed,

original: 'grib pa yang brtags pa ste /
analyzed: 'grib pa yang brtags pa ste /
translated: and the decrease of form is imputed.

original: de bas na gnyi ga yang mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnyi ga yang mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, both are without a defining characteristic.

original: 'gres bzhi pa la /
analyzed: 'gres bzhi pa la /
translated: In the fourth repetition,

original: ma skyes pa yang gzhan ma yin gzugs kyang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang gzhan ma yin gzugs kyang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: “unproduced is not one thing and form is not another,”

original: ma skyes pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
translated: “unproduced is itself form,”

original: gzugs nyid kyang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis gzugs zhes bya ba @169a * //
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis gzugs zhes bya ba @169a * //
translated: “form is itself unproduced” is as previously explained, what is called “form”

original: dang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: dang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la bya ste /
translated: and what is called “unproduced” are to be taken as reality.

original: de'i phyir gnyis su med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis su med do //
translated: Therefore, they are not two.

original: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid mngon sum du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid mngon sum du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “the non-arising of form will be seen” means that suchness will be directly perceived.

original: gzugs ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “the non-arising of form”

original: snga ma gzhin du chos nyid kyi gzugs dang de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir de skad bstan to //
analyzed: snga ma gzhin du chos nyid kyi gzugs dang de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir de skad bstan to //
translated: is taught in this way because, as before, the form of reality and suchness are one.

original: 'di man chad ni gnas brtan gnyis kyis dris pa dang lan 'debs pa zhib mor 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni gnas brtan gnyis kyis dris pa dang lan 'debs pa zhib mor 'byung ste /
translated: From here on, the questions and answers of the two elders are presented in detail.🔽The passage beginning with the words “Venerable Subhūti, if form is non-arising and up to the qualities of the Buddha are non-arising, then the śrāvakas would not have attained the śrāvaka enlightenment”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te gzugs kyang skye ba med la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du yang skye ba med pa yin na ni nyan thos kyis kyang nyan thos kyi byang chub thob zin par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la sogs pas
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te gzugs kyang skye ba med la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du yang skye ba med pa yin na ni nyan thos kyis kyang nyan thos kyi byang chub thob zin par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la sogs pas
translated: is a question.

original: ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught?

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa dang / de bzhin nyid gcig pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa dang / de bzhin nyid gcig pa yin na /
translated: If form and so on and suchness are one,🔽then the śrāvakas would have attained the śrāvaka enlightenment.

original: de lta na gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pas de bzhin nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pas de bzhin nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, by understanding form and so on, one would understand suchness.

original: sems can thams cad kyang don dam pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang don dam pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And all sentient beings would see the ultimate.

original: de ltar gyur na sems can thams cad kyis bsgrim mi dgos pa nyid du so so'i byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na sems can thams cad kyis bsgrim mi dgos pa nyid du so so'i byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then without any effort, all sentient beings would attain their individual enlightenment.

original: 'o na ni byang chub rnam pa lnga po dag kyang tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni byang chub rnam pa lnga po dag kyang tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But then the five types of enlightenment would not be distinct.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnams kyang 'dres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnams kyang 'dres par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the stream enterer, once returner, nonreturner, arhat, pratyekabuddha, and the knowledge of all aspects would be mixed up.

original: de ltar gyur na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa yang sangs rgyas yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa yang sangs rgyas yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then even the stream enterer and so on would be a buddha.

original: nyon mongs pa lhag ma spong bar 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa lhag ma spong bar 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the effort to abandon the remaining afflictions would be pointless.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang byang chub thob zin pas dka' ba spyad pa la sogs pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang byang chub thob zin pas dka' ba spyad pa la sogs pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the bodhisattvas would have already attained enlightenment, so that the practice of austerities and so on would be pointless.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would be pointless for them to attain complete enlightenment as a knower of all aspects and to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni chos ma skyes pa la 'thob pa dang / mngon par rdzogs pa yod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni chos ma skyes pa la 'thob pa dang / mngon par rdzogs pa yod par mi 'dod do //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not assert that there is attainment or clear realization of a dharma that is unborn.

original: bdag ni ma skyes pa la rgyun du zhugs pa yod par mi 'dod /
analyzed: bdag ni ma skyes pa la rgyun du zhugs pa yod par mi 'dod /
translated: I do not assert that there is a stream enterer who is unborn.🔽I do not assert that there is the fruition of stream entry.”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya bas ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya bas ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is shown by this?

original: @169b chos ma skyes pa ni sus kyang thob pa'am /
analyzed: @169b chos ma skyes pa ni sus kyang thob pa'am /
translated: A dharma that is unborn cannot be attained or

original: mngon par rtogs par mi nus /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par mi nus /
translated: clearly realized by anyone.

original: ma skyes pa la gang yang rgyun du zhugs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ma skyes pa la gang yang rgyun du zhugs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: No one at all becomes a stream enterer in what is unborn.

original: kun brtags pa'i sgrib pa tsam bstsal ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir thob pa dang mngon par rtogs par 'dod do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i sgrib pa tsam bstsal ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir thob pa dang mngon par rtogs par 'dod do //
translated: The attainment and realization of the reality of form, etc. is asserted to be the removal of only the obscurations of imputation, because of the absence of the conceptualization of subject and object.

original: de bas na de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that reality is not realized by reality.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pas de bzhin nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sngar smras pa'i skyon de skyon du mi 'gyur te nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pas de bzhin nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sngar smras pa'i skyon de skyon du mi 'gyur te nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the previously stated fault does not apply, namely, that the realization of reality occurs through the realization of form, etc., because the obscurations of affliction and the knowable do exist.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' dka' ba spyad pa spyod par mi 'dod ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la don dam par de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir de skad bstan to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' dka' ba spyad pa spyod par mi 'dod ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la don dam par de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir de skad bstan to //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not assert that bodhisattvas practice difficult conduct. This is taught because bodhisattvas do not have such conceptualization in the ultimate sense.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas gang gi tshe chos thams cad kyi thams cad du mi dmigs pa de'i tshe skye ba la sogs pa dang bral bar dka' ba spyad pa rtsom ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas gang gi tshe chos thams cad kyi thams cad du mi dmigs pa de'i tshe skye ba la sogs pa dang bral bar dka' ba spyad pa rtsom ste /
translated: Because bodhisattvas attain the acceptance that phenomena are not produced on the eighth level, when they do not apprehend anything at all of any phenomenon, at that time they begin to practice austerities free of birth and so on.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa la mgo bcad pa la sogs pa la dka' ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa la mgo bcad pa la sogs pa la dka' ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: At that time, when bodhisattvas possess the mental state of nonapprehension, they do not have any idea of difficulty, such as having their heads cut off,🔽or any idea of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes gang yang mi 'byung ngo zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad rnam pa thams cad du chos gang yang mi len mi dmigs so zhes bya ba mjug gi tshig gis bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes gang yang mi 'byung ngo zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad rnam pa thams cad du chos gang yang mi len mi dmigs so zhes bya ba mjug gi tshig gis bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the concluding words, “The great bodhisattva does not apprehend or take up any phenomenon in any way.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni ma skyes pa la de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma skyes pa chos kyi sku la de bzhin gshegs pa gang gis ma skyes pa rtogs par 'gyur ba'i
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni ma skyes pa la de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma skyes pa chos kyi sku la de bzhin gshegs pa gang gis ma skyes pa rtogs par 'gyur ba'i
translated: The passage beginning “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not assert that the Tathāgata exists in the unborn” and so on is as follows.🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis pa yod par mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis pa yod par mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, I do not assert that the Tathāgata exists in the unborn” teaches that the Tathāgata is not asserted to be a second unborn Tathāgata who realizes the unborn, which is the dharma body.

original: de bas na ma skyes pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ma skyes pa nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bas na ma skyes pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ma skyes pa nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, the unborn itself is the Tathāgata, and the unborn itself is perfect complete enlightenment.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos kyis kyang ma skyes pa thob par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid la rab tu rtogs par byed par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos kyis kyang ma skyes pa thob par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid la rab tu rtogs par byed par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The passage “I do not assert that the unborn is attained by the unborn” teaches that suchness is not asserted to be realized by suchness.

original: de skad smras pa dang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de skad smras pa dang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: When this was said, the elder Śāriputra

original: gal te ma skyes @170a * //
analyzed: gal te ma skyes @170a * //
translated: said to Subhūti, “If the unborn is not attained by the unborn,

original: pas ma skyes pa'i thob pa mi thob na ci ma skyes pas skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob bam /
analyzed: pas ma skyes pa'i thob pa mi thob na ci ma skyes pas skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob bam /
translated: If one does not obtain the nonarisen obtainment of the result, does one obtain the arisen obtainment of the result through the nonarisen obtainment of the path?

original: 'on te skyes pas ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob ces rnam par rtog pa gnyis dris te /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci chos ma skyes pas skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob bam 'on te chos skyes pas ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob ces bya ba ni gal te de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid 'ga' zhig gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs
analyzed: 'on te skyes pas ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob ces rnam par rtog pa gnyis dris te / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci chos ma skyes pas skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob bam 'on te chos skyes pas ma skyes pa'i thob pa 'thob ces bya ba ni gal te de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid 'ga' zhig gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs
translated: Or does one obtain the nonarisen obtainment of the result through the arisen obtainment of the path?🔽The elder Subhūti asked, “Venerable Śāriputra, does one obtain the arisen obtainment of the result through the nonarisen obtainment of the path?🔽Or does one obtain the nonarisen obtainment of the result through the arisen obtainment of the path?”

original: pa kun brtags pa rnams thob par 'gyur na /🔽de lta na ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyis /
analyzed: pa kun brtags pa rnams thob par 'gyur na / de lta na ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyis /
translated: If the imputed results of stream entry and so on were obtained by some essential nature of suchness,

original: skyes pa'i thob pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa'i thob pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then in that case the nonarisen obtainment of the result would be obtained through the arisen obtainment of the path.

original: gal te kun brtags pa'i gang zag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can rnams thob par 'gyur na de ltar gyur na ni skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa'i thob pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te kun brtags pa'i gang zag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can rnams thob par 'gyur na de ltar gyur na ni skyes pa'i chos kyis ma skyes pa'i thob pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If the imputed person obtained the fruit of stream enterer and so on, which have the nature of suchness, then the nonarisen obtainment of the fruit would be obtained by an arisen phenomenon.

original: de gnyi ga yang ma bzod nas /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang ma bzod nas /
translated: Since neither of these two is acceptable,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyis skyes pa thob par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyis skyes pa thob par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the elder Sariputra said, I do not assert that the nonarisen obtains the arisen.🔽Obtainment exists and manifest realization exists, but not in the manner of a duality.

original: thob pa yang yod mngon par rtogs pa yang yod de gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pas skyes pa 'thob pa dang / skyes pas ma skyes pa 'thob pa 'di gnyis ni med kyi /
analyzed: thob pa yang yod mngon par rtogs pa yang yod de gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pas skyes pa 'thob pa dang / skyes pas ma skyes pa 'thob pa 'di gnyis ni med kyi /
translated: Obtainment of the arisen by the nonarisen and obtainment of the nonarisen by the arisen do not exist.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba tsam la thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa gdags pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa gang zag tu gdags par bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba tsam la thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa gdags pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa gang zag tu gdags par bstan to //
translated: In terms of worldly convention, the attainment and clear realization are designated merely in the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, and the person is designated as the stream-enterer, the worthy one, and the Tathāgata.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ji ltar 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa gzugs med pa /🔽bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ji ltar 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa gzugs med pa / bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, just as in worldly convention the attainment and clear realization are formless,🔽unobstructed, and have a single defining characteristic in that they are without defining characteristics,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa de bzhin du ma skyes pa yang de lta yin nam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa de bzhin du ma skyes pa yang de lta yin nam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is the non-arisen also like that?

original: ci thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa yang don dam par yang med pa yin nam zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: ci thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa yang don dam par yang med pa yin nam zhes 'dri'o //
translated: This is asking, “Just as the attainment and clear realization do not exist ultimately, is the non-arisen also like that?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ni gzung du med cing brjod du med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa yang ma skyes pa'i rnam pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ni gzung du med cing brjod du med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa yang ma skyes pa'i rnam pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, it is so! ” indicates that the ultimate is unborn, because it is not apprehended and is inexpressible.

original: da ni skye ba yang bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skye ba yang bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute arising,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu @170b rnam grangs des na skye ba yang mi skye mi skye ba yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu @170b rnam grangs des na skye ba yang mi skye mi skye ba yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the passage beginning with “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, for these reasons arising does not arise; non-arising also does not arise” is stated.

original: ma skyes pa ni yongs su grub pa yin pas mi skye'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni yongs su grub pa yin pas mi skye'o //
translated: Since the unarisen is the perfected, it does not arise.

original: skye ba ni kun brtags pa yin te med pa'i phyir mi skye'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni kun brtags pa yin te med pa'i phyir mi skye'o //
translated: Arising is the imagined, and it does not arise because it does not exist.

original: de bas na rnam grangs 'di la skye ba yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na rnam grangs 'di la skye ba yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, in this enumeration, “arising also does not exist” is the meaning.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i chos ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya bar brjod par spobs sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i chos ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya bar brjod par spobs sam /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, do you have the courage to speak about the non-arisen dharma as the non-arisen dharma?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor chos ma skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa yang brjod par spobs sam zhes bya ba la ma skyes pa dang skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis ka yang de bzhin nyid kyi rnam grangs su grags te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor chos ma skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa yang brjod par spobs sam zhes bya ba la ma skyes pa dang skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis ka yang de bzhin nyid kyi rnam grangs su grags te /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, are you confident to speak about the non-arising of unarisen phenomena?”🔽Here, both the terms “unarisen” and “non-arising” are known as synonyms for suchness.

original: gang gi tshe de gnyis chos kyi sgras bye brag tu phye nas ma skyes pa'i chos dang / skye ba med pa'i chos zhes brjod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de gnyis chos kyi sgras bye brag tu phye nas ma skyes pa'i chos dang / skye ba med pa'i chos zhes brjod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When those two are distinguished by the term “phenomenon,” as in “unarisen phenomena” and “non-arising phenomena,”

original: kun brtags pa'i chos kyi tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos kyi tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: they become the words for imputed phenomena.

original: ci de skad brjod du rung ngam zhes dris pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci de skad brjod du rung ngam zhes dris pa de'i tshe /
translated: When asked, “Is it appropriate to speak in that way?”

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa'i sgra gnyis kun brtags pa'i tshig tu yang grags pa yin nam snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa'i sgra gnyis kun brtags pa'i tshig tu yang grags pa yin nam snyam du bsams nas /
translated: the elder Subhūti thought, “Are the terms ‘unarisen’ and ‘non-arising’ known as the words for imputed phenomena?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu ma skyes pa'i chos ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya bar brjod pa'i spobs pa yang bdag la med do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu ma skyes pa'i chos ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya bar brjod pa'i spobs pa yang bdag la med do //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not have the eloquence to say that unarisen phenomena are unarisen.

original: chos ma skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa brjod pa'i spobs pa yang bdag la med do gsungs so //
analyzed: chos ma skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa brjod pa'i spobs pa yang bdag la med do gsungs so //
translated: I do not have the eloquence to say that the non-arising of unarisen phenomena is non-arising.

original: de'i 'og tu ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa gnyi ga yang kun brtags pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa gnyi ga yang kun brtags pa nyid du ston te /
translated: After that, both non-arising and non-arising are shown to be just imputed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, why is that?

original: 'di ltar ma skyes pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / skye ba med pa gang yin pa dang / spobs pa gang yin pa dang / brjod pa gang yin pa dang / mi skye ba gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma skyes pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / skye ba med pa gang yin pa dang / spobs pa gang yin pa dang / brjod pa gang yin pa dang / mi skye ba gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is like this: those phenomena that are unarisen, that are non-arising, that are eloquence, that are expressions, and that are non-arising—all those phenomena are neither conjoined nor disjoined;

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: they are formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: and are unimpeded.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa dag go zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i chos dang / skye ba med par brjod par spobs so zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di la ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / mi skye ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa dag go zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i chos dang / skye ba med par brjod par spobs so zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di la ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / mi skye ba dang /
translated: Thus, they are said to be “characterized by a single characteristic, which is the absence of a characteristic.”🔽The phrase “one is eloquent in speaking of non-arising and non-production” indicates the following six topics: non-arising, non-production, non-origination,

original: chos dang spobs pa dang / brjod pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di drug bstan to //
analyzed: chos dang spobs pa dang / brjod pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di drug bstan to //
translated: the Dharma, eloquence, and speaking.

original: de dag thams cad kyang kun brtags pa yin pas med pa'o zhes bya ba'i @171a * //🔽tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang kun brtags pa yin pas med pa'o zhes bya ba'i @171a * // tha tshig go //
translated: All of these are imaginary and therefore non-existent.

original: chos yod pa ni sems las byung ba'am /
analyzed: chos yod pa ni sems las byung ba'am /
translated: If the Dharma exists, it must be either a mental factor,

original: sems dang mi ldan pa'am /🔽gzugs can nam /
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa'am / gzugs can nam /
translated: something that is not associated with the mind,

original: 'dus ma byas pa zhig yin grang na /🔽de la ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya bas ni sems las byung ba'i dngos por yod pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa zhig yin grang na / de la ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya bas ni sems las byung ba'i dngos por yod pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: something that is physical, or something that is unconditioned.🔽The phrase “it is not associated” indicates that it does not exist as a mental factor.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya bas ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya bas ni sems dang mi ldan pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: The phrase “it is not non-associated” indicates that it does not exist as something that is not associated with the mind.

original: gzugs can ma yin zhes bya bas ni rnam par rig byed pa ma yin pa la sogs pa gzugs kyi chos bcu gcig po ltar gzugs can gyi dngos por yod pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin zhes bya bas ni rnam par rig byed pa ma yin pa la sogs pa gzugs kyi chos bcu gcig po ltar gzugs can gyi dngos por yod pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: The phrase “not having form” shows that it does not exist as a real entity that has form, like the eleven types of entities that are classified as having form.

original: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog bzhin du bstan du yod pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog bzhin du bstan du yod pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: The phrase “cannot be shown” shows that it does not exist as a real entity that can be shown, like the color blue, for example.

original: thogs pa med pa zhes bya bas ni dbang po'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid du yong pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa zhes bya bas ni dbang po'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid du yong pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: The phrase “cannot be discerned” shows that it does not exist as a real entity that has the defining characteristic of form that is possessed by the faculties.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa dag go zhes bya bas ni 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa dag go zhes bya bas ni 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: The phrase “having a single defining mark, which is the absence of a defining mark” shows that it does not exist as a real entity that has the defining mark of being unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i chos ni gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i chos ni gang yang med do //
translated: There is no real entity that is called “the defining mark of the unconditioned.”

original: de med pas yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid las rnam par grol ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa ste mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid du mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de med pas yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid las rnam par grol ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa ste mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid du mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since that does not exist, it is free from the characteristics of existence and nonexistence, and therefore it is without characteristics, which is to say, it is characterized by the absence of characteristics.

original: de nas yang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus ci brjod pa la sogs pa yang mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin nam zhes 'dri ste /
analyzed: de nas yang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus ci brjod pa la sogs pa yang mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin nam zhes 'dri ste /
translated: Then the elder Śāriputra asks, “Is what is said, etc., also nonarisen?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci brjod pa yang skye ba med /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci brjod pa yang skye ba med /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, is what is said also nonarisen?

original: spobs pa yang skye ba med /
analyzed: spobs pa yang skye ba med /
translated: Is eloquence also nonarisen?🔽Are the phenomena that are the basis of what is said and eloquence also nonarisen?”

original: chos kyang skye ba med pa gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni ci brjod pa dang / spobs pa dang / chos dang brjod par bya ba'i chos thams cad kyang skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos kyang skye ba med pa gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni ci brjod pa dang / spobs pa dang / chos dang brjod par bya ba'i chos thams cad kyang skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means, “Are what is said, eloquence, phenomena, and all phenomena that are the basis of what is said also essentially nonarisen?”

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de de bzhin no zhes bya ba thams cad kyang skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par khas len te /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de de bzhin no zhes bya ba thams cad kyang skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par khas len te /
translated: Then the elder Subhūti accepts that everything is the non-arising essence, saying “That is so!”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te brjod pa ni skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te brjod pa ni skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is so. Expression is non-arising.

original: spobs pa ni skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa ni skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Eloquence is non-arising.

original: chos ni skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Dharma is non-arising.

original: gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med pa'o @171b zhes de skad brjod nas /
analyzed: gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med pa'o @171b zhes de skad brjod nas /
translated: Those dharmas that are expressed with eloquence, they too are non-arising.

original: gzugs skye ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad kyang skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston cing skye ba med pa'i 'gres sngar bstan pa nyid kyang ston to //
analyzed: gzugs skye ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad kyang skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston cing skye ba med pa'i 'gres sngar bstan pa nyid kyang ston to //
translated: Having said that, he teaches that everything is the non-arising essence, saying “Form is non-arising,” and so on, and he teaches the previously explained refrain of non-arising.

original: bstan pa 'di la yang sngar smos pa'i skyon 'gro ba lnga po dag kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dran par byas nas /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la yang sngar smos pa'i skyon 'gro ba lnga po dag kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dran par byas nas /
translated: And in this teaching, the previously mentioned fault that “the five destinies would not be different,” and so on, should be remembered.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar 'gro ba lnga po rnams kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de la lan 'debs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar 'gro ba lnga po rnams kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de la lan 'debs te /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is said that ‘thus the five destinies would not be distinct.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu ji ltar 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar don dam par thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa gnyis med pa dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu ji ltar 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar don dam par thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa gnyis med pa dang /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, just as attainment and clear realization exist as worldly conventions,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa yang med pa de bzhin du theg pa gsum po dag kyang de bzhin nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir don dam par 'bras bu la bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa yang med pa de bzhin du theg pa gsum po dag kyang de bzhin nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir don dam par 'bras bu la bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: so too the three vehicles are not ultimately distinct with respect to their results, because they are exhausted as just suchness.

original: 'o na sngon bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe las kyi bye brag kyang yod la de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par smin pa'i bye brag dang / de bzhin du 'bras bu'i tshe yang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams skyes pa dang /
analyzed: 'o na sngon bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe las kyi bye brag kyang yod la de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par smin pa'i bye brag dang / de bzhin du 'bras bu'i tshe yang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams skyes pa dang /
translated: And likewise, at the time of the effect, there are different types of arisen and unarisen afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience,🔽and there are different types of thoroughly afflicted and completely pure states due to those.

original: ma skyes pa las gyur ba'i bye brag dang / de dag nyid kyi dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba las gyur ba'i bye brag kyang yod do zhes log par zhugs pa rnams kyi phyir tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar don dam par ni las kyang med /
analyzed: ma skyes pa las gyur ba'i bye brag dang / de dag nyid kyi dbang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba las gyur ba'i bye brag kyang yod do zhes log par zhugs pa rnams kyi phyir tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar don dam par ni las kyang med /
translated: In order to refute those who have entered such wrong paths, the venerable Śāradvatīputra said, “In this way, ultimately there is no karma,

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med /
translated: there is no ripening of karma,

original: skye ba yang med /
analyzed: skye ba yang med /
translated: there is no arising,

original: 'gag pa yang med /
analyzed: 'gag pa yang med /
translated: there is no ceasing,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med /
translated: there is no thorough affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba yang med do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang med do zhes gsungs te /
translated: and there is no complete purity.”

original: 'di dag thams cad ni kun brtags pa ste yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni kun brtags pa ste yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: All of these are imagined, and do not exist.

original: de bas na de dag gi dbang gis de bzhin nyid tha dad du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi dbang gis de bzhin nyid tha dad du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that thusness is differentiated by their power.

original: de ltar ma skyes pa bstsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar ma skyes pa bstsal nas /
translated: Having thus refuted non-arising,

original: yang skye ba'i chos bstsal pa'i phyir dri ba brtsams te /
analyzed: yang skye ba'i chos bstsal pa'i phyir dri ba brtsams te /
translated: in order to refute the dharma of arising, the question is raised:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, does an unarisen dharma arise?

original: 'on te skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'on te skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Or does an arisen dharma arise?

original: de la 'di 'dri ste /
analyzed: de la 'di 'dri ste /
translated: Here it is asked:

original: ci gang gi @172a * //
analyzed: ci gang gi @172a * //
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: tshe sa bon las myu gu la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir /🔽myu gu skye ba de ma byung ma skyes pa zhig skye'am /
analyzed: tshe sa bon las myu gu la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir / myu gu skye ba de ma byung ma skyes pa zhig skye'am /
translated: When a sprout arises from a seed,🔽does an unarisen, non-arisen sprout arise?

original: 'on te byung zhing skyes zin pa zhig skye zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te byung zhing skyes zin pa zhig skye zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or does an arisen, already arisen sprout arise?

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / gal te myu gu ma skyes pa skye na ni ma skyes pa thams cad kyang nges pa med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / gal te myu gu ma skyes pa skye na ni ma skyes pa thams cad kyang nges pa med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a sprout that has not arisen were to arise, then all that has not arisen would arise without exception.

original: gal te skyes zin pa zhig skye na ni yang dang yang du bzlas te /
analyzed: gal te skyes zin pa zhig skye na ni yang dang yang du bzlas te /
translated: If that which has already arisen were to arise, then it would arise again and again.

original: skye bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa rigs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyi ga ltar yang smrar mi rung nas /
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa rigs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyi ga ltar yang smrar mi rung nas /
translated: Since that would be contradictory to reasoning, it is not tenable to say that either that which has arisen or that which has not arisen arises.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyang skye bar mi 'dod /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyang skye bar mi 'dod /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not assert that a nonarisen phenomenon arises.

original: skyes pa'i chos kyang skye bar mi 'dod do zhes gnas brtan gyis smras te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i chos kyang skye bar mi 'dod do zhes gnas brtan gyis smras te /
translated: I also do not assert that an arisen phenomenon arises.

original: ma skyes pa ni ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir med de med pa nyid kyi phyir mi skye'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir med de med pa nyid kyi phyir mi skye'o //
translated: Since that which has not arisen is itself nonarisen, it does not exist. Since it does not exist, it does not arise.

original: skyes pa yang skyes zin pa nyid kyi phyir yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: skyes pa yang skyes zin pa nyid kyi phyir yang mi skye ste /
translated: Since that which has arisen is itself arisen, it does not arise again.

original: de bas na don dam par skye ba'i chos med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na don dam par skye ba'i chos med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, ultimately there is no phenomenon that arises. This is the meaning.

original: de skad smras pa dang 'ga' zhig ma skyes pa'i chos ri bong gi rva la skye ba med dam skyes pa 'das pa rnams la skye ba med dam zhes smrar 'ong zhes de'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad smras pa dang 'ga' zhig ma skyes pa'i chos ri bong gi rva la skye ba med dam skyes pa 'das pa rnams la skye ba med dam zhes smrar 'ong zhes de'i phyir /
translated: If you say that, some will say, Is it that non-arisen phenomena, like the horn of an ass, do not arise, or is it that arisen, past phenomena do not arise?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor khyod ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar mi 'dod pa gang yin zhes bya ba dang / skyes pa skye bar mi 'dod pa gang yin zhes bya ba'i 'gres gnyis dris so //🔽yang skye ba bstsal ba'i phyir /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor khyod ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar mi 'dod pa gang yin zhes bya ba dang / skyes pa skye bar mi 'dod pa gang yin zhes bya ba'i 'gres gnyis dris so // yang skye ba bstsal ba'i phyir / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Therefore, the elder asked, Venerable Subhūti, what is it that you do not assert arises, a non-arisen phenomenon, or what is it that you do not assert arises, an arisen phenomenon?🔽Again, in order to refute arising, he asked, Venerable Subhūti, does a non-arisen phenomenon arise, or does an arisen phenomenon arise?

original: 'on te skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur zhes de skad smras pa dang / mi skye ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir mi skye la /
analyzed: 'on te skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur zhes de skad smras pa dang / mi skye ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir mi skye la /
translated: When asked this, Subhūti replied, Non-arising does not arise because it is unconditioned, and

original: skye ba yang kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba yang kun brtags pa ste /
translated: arising is also imputed,

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mi skye bas gnas brtan gyis /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mi skye bas gnas brtan gyis /
translated: but it does not arise because it does not exist.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dvi ti bu skye ba yang mi skye /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dvi ti bu skye ba yang mi skye /
translated: Therefore, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, arising does not arise,🔽and non-arising does not arise.

original: mi skye ba yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa de'i gtan tshigs su tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dvi ti'i bu 'di ltar skye ba gang yin pa dang mi skye ba gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang
analyzed: mi skye ba yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa de'i gtan tshigs su tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dvi ti'i bu 'di ltar skye ba gang yin pa dang mi skye ba gang yin pa de gnyis ka yang ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang
translated: The Venerable Śāradvatīputra said, “In this way, that which arises and that which does not arise are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: They are not conjoined with anything at all.

original: mi skye ba nyid do zhes bya ba yang gsungs te /
analyzed: mi skye ba nyid do zhes bya ba yang gsungs te /
translated: Non-arising is non-arising.”

original: de lta yin yang gnyi ga yang don dam par de bzhin nyid tsam du zad do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin yang gnyi ga yang don dam par de bzhin nyid tsam du zad do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Even though that is so, the thought is that both are ultimately just suchness.

original: de skad bstan nas skye ba med pa'i 'gres sngar bstan pa nyid kyang bstan te /
analyzed: de skad bstan nas skye ba med pa'i 'gres sngar bstan pa nyid kyang bstan te /
translated: Having taught that, he also taught the previous explanation of the absence of arising.

original: de ltar na gzugs skye ba med do zhes bya @172b ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du skye ba med do zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs skye ba med do zhes bya @172b ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du skye ba med do zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that “form does not arise,” up to “the knowledge of all aspects does not arise,”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs 'dis na brjod pa ni skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs 'dis na brjod pa ni skye ba med pa ste /
translated: the Venerable Śāradvatīputra said, “By this one of many explanations, the expression is non-arising.

original: spobs pa yang skye ba med la /
analyzed: spobs pa yang skye ba med la /
translated: Eloquence is also non-arising.

original: chos kyang skye ba med de gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med pa'o zhes mjug bsdus so //
analyzed: chos kyang skye ba med de gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med pa'o zhes mjug bsdus so //
translated: The Dharma is also unborn, for those dharmas which are the subject matter of the discourse are also unborn.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs bstan pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, form is empty by nature.

original: de bas na de ni nang na yang mi gnas phyi rol na yang mi gnas /
analyzed: de bas na de ni nang na yang mi gnas phyi rol na yang mi gnas /
translated: Therefore, it does not abide internally, it does not abide externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽gal te de 'ga' zhig la gnas na nang ngam phyi rol lam /
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba gsungs so // gal te de 'ga' zhig la gnas na nang ngam phyi rol lam /
translated: and it is not apprehended as being in both.🔽If it were to abide anywhere, it would abide internally, externally,

original: gnyi ga las gzhan 'ga' zhig la gnas grang na /
analyzed: gnyi ga las gzhan 'ga' zhig la gnas grang na /
translated: or somewhere other than those two.

original: 'di ltar de gsum char la yang don dam par med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de gsum char la yang don dam par med de /
translated: But since it does not exist in any of those three ways ultimately,

original: de bas na mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi gnas pa'o //
translated: it does not abide.

original: de skad bstan nas gnas pa dang mi gnas pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid legs par rgya bskyed de byang chub kyi lam yongs su spyad pa'i thabs ston te /
analyzed: de skad bstan nas gnas pa dang mi gnas pa de nyid kyi mtshan nyid legs par rgya bskyed de byang chub kyi lam yongs su spyad pa'i thabs ston te /
translated: Having taught that, in order to expand upon the characteristics of abiding and non-abiding, he teaches the method for practicing the path to awakening.

original: 'jig rten pa yang yod 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang yod 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: There is also mundane and supramundane.

original: 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phags mi 'da' zhes bya ba de kun brtags pa las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phags mi 'da' zhes bya ba de kun brtags pa las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Mundane means not moving, not rising, not transcending.

original: bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is threefold by way of the small, middling, and great patience.

original: lhag ma ni don gsal lo //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don gsal lo //
translated: The rest is clear in meaning.🔽The seven terms beginning with “that by which there is the world” are as follows:

original: gang dag gis 'jig rten du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bdun ni de la kha cig tu ni 'jig rten gyi sgra phung po lnga la bya /
analyzed: gang dag gis 'jig rten du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bdun ni de la kha cig tu ni 'jig rten gyi sgra phung po lnga la bya /
translated: In some places the term “world” refers to the five aggregates.

original: kha cig tu ni sems can gyi 'jig rten /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni sems can gyi 'jig rten /
translated: In some places it refers to the world of sentient beings.

original: kha cig tu ni snod kyi 'jig rten /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni snod kyi 'jig rten /
translated: In some places it refers to the world of the physical cosmos.

original: kha cig tu ni so so'i skye bo'i 'jig rten /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni so so'i skye bo'i 'jig rten /
translated: In some places it refers to the world of ordinary beings.

original: kha cig tu ni 'khor ba /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni 'khor ba /
translated: In some places it refers to saṃsāra.

original: kha cig tu ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams /
translated: In some places it refers to the imagined dharmas.

original: kha cig tu ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams la bya ste /
translated: In some places it refers to the five sense pleasures.

original: gang dag gis 'jig rten du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i 'jig rten no //
analyzed: gang dag gis 'jig rten du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i 'jig rten no //
translated: The phrase those who are in the world refers to the world of beings.

original: gang dag 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The phrase those who create the world refers to the world of the container.

original: gang dag 'jig rten dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: The phrase those who are equal to the world refers to those who are equal to the imaginary entities that constitute the world.

original: gang dag gis 'jig rten gyi phyir sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'jig rten gyi phyir sbyin @173a * //
analyzed: gang dag gis 'jig rten gyi phyir sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'jig rten gyi phyir sbyin @173a * //
translated: The phrase those who give to the world refers to the five sense pleasures that are given to the world.

original: pa'o ; / gang dag gis 'jig rten las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i 'jig rten las so //
analyzed: pa'o ; / gang dag gis 'jig rten las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i 'jig rten las so //
translated: The phrase those who do not go beyond the world refers to the world of samsara.

original: gang dag 'jig rten 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i 'jig rten te /🔽'byung ba ni 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i 'jig rten te / 'byung ba ni 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase those who emerge from the world refers to the world of ordinary beings.

original: gang dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten du sems can gyi 'jig rten 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten du sems can gyi 'jig rten 'byung ngo //
translated: The phrase those who emerge in the world refers to the emergence of the world of sentient beings in the world of the container.

original: gang dag gis 'jig rten sgrol ba zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: gang dag gis 'jig rten sgrol ba zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
translated: Those by which one is liberated from the world means from the world of sentient beings.

original: gang dag 'jig rten sel bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten sel bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams so //
translated: Those by which one is liberated from the world means from the five sense pleasures.

original: 'jig rten gyis gang dag gis sgrol bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i gang zag gi 'jig rten gyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis gang dag gis sgrol bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i gang zag gi 'jig rten gyis so //
translated: Those by which one is liberated from the world means from the world of noble persons.

original: gang dag 'jig rten ma yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten ma yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those by which one becomes not-of-the-world means one becomes fully accomplished.

original: gang dag gis 'jig rten las 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i 'jig rten las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis 'jig rten las 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i 'jig rten las 'byung ba'o //
translated: Those by which one emerges from the world means one emerges from the world of saṃsāra.

original: gang dag 'jig rten las sgrol ba zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten las so //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten las sgrol ba zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten las so //
translated: Those by which one is liberated from the world means from the world of the environment.

original: gang dag 'jig rten du sgrol bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'jig rten rnams su'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten du sgrol bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'jig rten rnams su'o //
translated: Those by which one is liberated in the world means in the worlds of phenomena.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu legs so legs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu legs so legs so //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, excellent, excellent!

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig brjod pas don nyid yongs su bzung ba ni tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dmigs su phebs so zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu'i tshig la tshig rnam pa gsum gyis rjes su
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig brjod pas don nyid yongs su bzung ba ni tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dmigs su phebs so zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu'i tshig la tshig rnam pa gsum gyis rjes su
translated: This is the third statement in Śāriputra’s statement.

original: yi rang ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: yi rang ba'i tshig ste /
translated: These are the words of rejoicing.

original: legs shing rigs pas dmigs su phebs par don yongs su bzung ngo zhes ston to //
analyzed: legs shing rigs pas dmigs su phebs par don yongs su bzung ngo zhes ston to //
translated: He shows that he has taken up the meaning well and correctly, and has arrived at the object.

original: sems can med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of a sentient being, attention should be known to be nonexistent.

original: sems can stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the emptiness of a sentient being, attention should be known to be emptiness.

original: sems can dben pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa dben pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dben pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa dben pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the isolation of a sentient being, attention should be known to be isolation.

original: sems can ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the intrinsic realitylessness of a sentient being, attention should be known to be intrinsic realitylessness.

original: sems can mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba yid la byed pa de lnga de las gzhan pa rnams la med de de bas na de dag byang
analyzed: sems can mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba yid la byed pa de lnga de las gzhan pa rnams la med de de bas na de dag byang
translated: Because there are no sentient beings who are fully awakened, you should know that there is no mental attention that is fully awakened.

original: chub sems dpa' ma yin no zhes bstan @173b pa yin no //
analyzed: chub sems dpa' ma yin no zhes bstan @173b pa yin no //
translated: These five mental attentions are not present in those other than bodhisattvas. Therefore, they are not bodhisattvas.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gnas pa 'di dang / yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral lo zhes bdag smra'o zhes bstan to //🔽de ltar re zhig cho 'phrul bstan pa dang bcas /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gnas pa 'di dang / yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral lo zhes bdag smra'o zhes bstan to // de ltar re zhig cho 'phrul bstan pa dang bcas /
translated: Therefore, I say that the bodhisattva mahāsattva is not separated from this state and this mental attention.

original: 'bras bu bstan pa dang bcas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bring du bshad pa yongs su rdzogs par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu bstan pa dang bcas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bring du bshad pa yongs su rdzogs par byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, for the time being, the explanation of the middle perfection of wisdom, together with the demonstration of miracles and the demonstration of results, is completed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis mdo dang 'bring dang rgyas pa rnam pa gsum du bstan to zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis mdo dang 'bring dang rgyas pa rnam pa gsum du bstan to zhes bshad de /
translated: The Tathagata taught this perfection of wisdom in three versions: extensive, middle length, and brief.

original: de la 'dul ba'i dbang gis mdo dang 'bring gi tshul gnyis ni bstan zin to //🔽'di man chad ni 'dul ba'i 'gro ba'i yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyi the tshom skyes shing skyes pa rnams bsal bas yongs su smin par byas na yongs su smin pa rnams de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par byed pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i
analyzed: de la 'dul ba'i dbang gis mdo dang 'bring gi tshul gnyis ni bstan zin to // 'di man chad ni 'dul ba'i 'gro ba'i yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyi the tshom skyes shing skyes pa rnams bsal bas yongs su smin par byas na yongs su smin pa rnams de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par byed pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i
translated: The two versions of the middle length and extensive were taught in accordance with the disciples' faculties.🔽From here on, the extensive version is taught in two parts: the extensive version for those disciples whose minds are ripe, who have already given rise to doubts, and who will be ripened by having their doubts removed; and the extensive version for those disciples whose minds are ripe and who will realize the meaning of thatness.

original: tshul rnam par dbye bas rgyas pa rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: tshul rnam par dbye bas rgyas pa rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
translated: The extensive version for those whose minds are ripe is taught by the analysis of the conventional and the ultimate modes.

original: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal po chen po gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad dang / lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma lhan cig tu 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ci'i phyir lha rnams 'dus par yang bstan la /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu brjod pa'i skabs ni gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal po chen po gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad dang / lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma lhan cig tu 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pas ci'i phyir lha rnams 'dus par yang bstan la / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu brjod pa'i skabs ni gang yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it also taught that the devas assembled?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di sngon ma byung ba'i phyir sngon ma byung ba'i chos bstan pa'i ltas su 'khor 'dus pa yang mdor bstan dgos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di sngon ma byung ba'i phyir sngon ma byung ba'i chos bstan pa'i ltas su 'khor 'dus pa yang mdor bstan dgos so //
translated: Because this teaching of the perfection of wisdom has not occurred before, the assembly of the retinue is briefly taught as a sign of the teaching of the unprecedented Dharma.

original: 'od zer 'byin cing 'od bkod pa yang ston zhes 'byung bas na chos bshad pa'i ltas bstan pa'i phyir 'od bstan pa mdzad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od zer 'byin cing 'od bkod pa yang ston zhes 'byung bas na chos bshad pa'i ltas bstan pa'i phyir 'od bstan pa mdzad par rig par bya'o //
translated: And it is said that light rays are emitted and an array of light is shown, so it should be understood that the display of light is done to show the sign of the Dharma teaching.

original: ci'i phyir lha'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba mi 'debs par gnas brtan rab 'byor la gsol ba 'debs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lha'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba mi 'debs par gnas brtan rab 'byor la gsol ba 'debs she na /
translated: Why does he not request the Tathāgata, but requests the Elder Subhūti?

original: de'i tshe 'khor rnams nyan thos kyis bshad par 'dul ba'i phyir de ltar de la gsol ba btab pa'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa la yang gsol ba btab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor rnams nyan thos kyis bshad par 'dul ba'i phyir de ltar de la gsol ba btab pa'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa la yang gsol ba btab par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, in order to convert the assembly by means of the Śrāvaka explanation, he requests in that way, and by that means he also requests the Tathāgata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @174a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @174a * //
translated: How should a Bodhisattva Mahāsattva abide in the perfection of wisdom?

original: chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the perfection of wisdom of a Bodhisattva Mahāsattva?🔽How should a Bodhisattva Mahāsattva train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar bslab par bya zhes dris pa 'di gsum gyi lan ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar bslab par bya zhes dris pa 'di gsum gyi lan ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: The answers to these three questions are taught below.

original: de la sngar ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la sngar ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nas brtsams te /
translated: There, previously, starting from omniscience,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzung nas 'bring du bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzung nas 'bring du bshad pa bstan to //
translated: Having taken up the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom, the medium explanation is taught.

original: 'dir ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dir ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid nas brtsams te /
translated: Here, beginning with the knowledge of path aspects,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: the perfection of conceptual and nonconceptual practice of the bodhisattvas is taught.🔽Those who have entered the faultless state do not have the power to generate the mind set on unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: gang dag skyon med pa la zhugs pa de dag ni zla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med de zhes bya ba ni gang dag log pa nyid du nges pa de dag ni re zhig skal ba med pa zhes
analyzed: gang dag skyon med pa la zhugs pa de dag ni zla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med de zhes bya ba ni gang dag log pa nyid du nges pa de dag ni re zhig skal ba med pa zhes
translated: Those who are destined for error are, for the time being, without fortune.

original: bya'o // 'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de dag la yang rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba ni bshad pa 'di de dag gi rna bar thos na yang don med par mi 'gyur bas
analyzed: bya'o // 'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de dag la yang rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba ni bshad pa 'di de dag gi rna bar thos na yang don med par mi 'gyur bas
translated: This is because, if they hear this explanation, it will not be meaningless.

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med grangs med pa'i pha rol du /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med grangs med pa'i pha rol du /
translated: In the scriptures it is said that after an immeasurable, countless eons,

original: de dag sangs rgyas nyid pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes lung las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas nyid pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes lung las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: they will enter into buddhahood.🔽Kauśika, what is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings?🔽This is the middle teaching from among the three questions.

original: koo shi ka de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dris pa rnam pa gsum las bar ma bstan pa yin yang dang por bstan pa ni de ltar bstan
analyzed: koo shi ka de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dris pa rnam pa gsum las bar ma bstan pa yin yang dang por bstan pa ni de ltar bstan
translated: But the first teaching is taught like that

original: na go sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na go sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is easy to understand.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sal lam gyi rnam pa shes pa'i phyogs yin mod kyi gnyi ga yang 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pa la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sal lam gyi rnam pa shes pa'i phyogs yin mod kyi gnyi ga yang 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pa la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the side of the knowledge of all aspects for the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and it is the side of the knowledge of path aspects for the bodhisattvas. However, both of them should be taught the knowledge of path aspects to the bodhisattvas who wish to attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs ni /
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs ni /
translated: Here, the side of the knowledge of all aspects is as follows.

original: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas gzugs mi rtag par yid la @174b bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas gzugs mi rtag par yid la @174b bya'o //
translated: Kauśika, here the bodhisattva mahāsattva should mentally attend to form as impermanent, endowed with the thought that is conjoined with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa bco lnga bstan pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa bdun bstan pas bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa bco lnga bstan pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa bdun bstan pas bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the fifteen mental attentions such as to suffering, to selflessness, to emptiness, to disease, to an abscess, and so on, and the seven mental attentions observing the cessation of dependent origination should be understood as explained above.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas ma 'dres pa'i mtha'i bar du mi dmigs par yid la byed pa rnams dang / chos dang chos rnams sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas ma 'dres pa'i mtha'i bar du mi dmigs par yid la byed pa rnams dang / chos dang chos rnams sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The aspect of the knowledge of the path is indicated by the mental attentions from the perfections up to the end of nonmixture, and by the phrases “the connection of phenomena with phenomena” and so on.

original: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i tshul gyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i tshul gyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, the meaning of the words impermanence and so on should be explained according to the methods of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: ma byung ba las 'byung ba dang byung nas kyang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma byung ba las 'byung ba dang byung nas kyang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of arising from what was nonexistent and then ceasing to exist,

original: mi rtag par yid la byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag par yid la byed do //
translated: one should attend to them as impermanent.

original: bdag nyid sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan pa dang / gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan pa dang / gzhan dag gi sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is associated with the three kinds of suffering and is the cause of others’ suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: It is suffering because it is associated with the three kinds of suffering and because it is the cause of the suffering of others.

original: dbang sgyur ba med pa la sogs pas bdag rang la bdag gi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: dbang sgyur ba med pa la sogs pas bdag rang la bdag gi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o //
translated: It is selfless because the self is not found to have the characteristics of a self.

original: chu shing gi sdong bo ltar nang gi snying po med pas nang bdag gis stong pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: chu shing gi sdong bo ltar nang gi snying po med pas nang bdag gis stong pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty because it is empty of an inner self, like the pith of a plantain tree.

original: rkyen du pas gso dgos pa dang / lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir nad dang 'dra bas nad do //
analyzed: rkyen du pas gso dgos pa dang / lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir nad dang 'dra bas nad do //
translated: It is like a disease because it is the root of physical and mental suffering, and because it must be cured by the application of the antidotes.

original: zhen pa'i gnod pa dang ldan pa dang nyon mongs pa'i mi gtsang ba zag pa dang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'jig pas rim bzhin du skrangs pa dang smin pa dang / rdol ba'i phyir 'bras dang 'dra bas na 'bras so //
analyzed: zhen pa'i gnod pa dang ldan pa dang nyon mongs pa'i mi gtsang ba zag pa dang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'jig pas rim bzhin du skrangs pa dang smin pa dang / rdol ba'i phyir 'bras dang 'dra bas na 'bras so //
translated: It is like an abscess because it is associated with the pain of attachment, and because it is infected with the impurities of the defilements, and because it is swollen with birth, ripe with old age, and burst with death.

original: phyi nang gi gnod pas zug par byed cing bcos dka' bas zug rdu dang 'dra ba'i phyir zug rngu'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi gnod pas zug par byed cing bcos dka' bas zug rdu dang 'dra ba'i phyir zug rngu'o //
translated: It is a dart because it is difficult to cure, since it is pierced by inner and outer harms.

original: smad par bya ba yin pa dang / gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir sdig to dang 'dra bas na sdig pa'o //🔽rkyen gyi khar las pa dang / las bdag gir bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: smad par bya ba yin pa dang / gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir sdig to dang 'dra bas na sdig pa'o // rkyen gyi khar las pa dang / las bdag gir bya ba yin pas /
translated: It is a sin because it is like a sin, since it is to be despised and is harmful.
