original: gzhan las dbang bsgyur ba med pa'i phyir gzhan la rag las pa'o //🔽nad dang rga ba dang / 'chi ba rnams kyis rab tu 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /🔽'jig pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: gzhan las dbang bsgyur ba med pa'i phyir gzhan la rag las pa'o // nad dang rga ba dang / 'chi ba rnams kyis rab tu 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir / 'jig pa'i chos can no //
translated: It is dependent on another because it is not independent of another, since it is dependent on conditions and is appropriated by karma.🔽It is impermanent because it has the three characteristics of the conditioned and the eight worldly dharmas.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan zhing 'jig rten gyi chos mi brtan pa brgyad dang ldan pa'i phyir mi brtan pa'o //🔽rang @175a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan zhing 'jig rten gyi chos mi brtan pa brgyad dang ldan pa'i phyir mi brtan pa'o // rang @175a * //
translated: It is unstable because it is unstable by nature.

original: gi ngang dang / gnod pas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gi ngang dang / gnod pas kyang 'jig par 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is perishable because it is perishable by nature, since it perishes by itself and by harm.🔽It is suffering because it is suffering by nature.

original: rab tu 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa'o //
translated: It is empty because it is empty by nature.🔽It is insubstantial because it is insubstantial by nature.

original: mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba nye bar zhi ba bde ba'i gnyen po yin pa dang / 'jigs pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba nye bar zhi ba bde ba'i gnyen po yin pa dang / 'jigs pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Fearlessness is fear because it is the antidote to the bliss of tranquility and because it is the cause of all fears.

original: ma tshor bzhin du gnod pa sna tshogs kyis 'tshe ba'o //🔽gnod pa rnam pa mang po dang / 'dre ba dang / 'go ba'i nad dang 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma tshor bzhin du gnod pa sna tshogs kyis 'tshe ba'o // gnod pa rnam pa mang po dang / 'dre ba dang / 'go ba'i nad dang 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: It is harmful because it harms in various ways without being noticed.🔽It is disease because it is like a disease that spreads and becomes chronic.

original: 'go ba'i nad do //
analyzed: 'go ba'i nad do //
translated: It is chronic because it is like a disease that is difficult to cure.

original: bdag med pa dang / zhi bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / zhi bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: One should attend to it as selfless, peaceful, etc.

original: ngag gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir bdag med pa'o //
translated: It is selfless because it is devoid of the characteristics of speech.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peaceful because all suffering is pacified.

original: nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dben pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dben pa'o //
translated: It is isolated because it is not associated with afflictions.

original: bdag dang bdag gi bas stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi bas stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is empty because it is associated with emptiness, which is the emptiness of self and what belongs to self.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: It is signless because it is devoid of all signs of the conditioned.

original: khams gsum du mi smon pas smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum du mi smon pas smon pa med pa'o //
translated: It is wishless because it does not wish for the three realms.

original: phyis las mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyis las mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is non-performance because it does not perform actions later.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is non-performance, thus it is said.

original: chos dang chos rnams sbyor ba byed ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: chos dang chos rnams sbyor ba byed ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the phrase “joining phenomena with phenomena,” and so on,

original: byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems rnams phan tshun du 'grogs par yid la byed pa ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems rnams phan tshun du 'grogs par yid la byed pa ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: joining is the mental activity of considering the thought of enlightenment, the thought of the roots of virtue, and the thought of the dedication as mutually accompanying.

original: gsum char yang bdag gi ngo bo dang / gzhan gyi ngo bo la yod pa ma yin par yid la byed pa ni dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsum char yang bdag gi ngo bo dang / gzhan gyi ngo bo la yod pa ma yin par yid la byed pa ni dpyod par byed pa'o //
translated: Analysis is the mental activity of considering that all three are not in the nature of self or other.

original: gsum char yang sems ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: gsum char yang sems ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable because all three are not mind.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir sems ma yin pa'o zhes yid la byed pa bshad zin pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir sems ma yin pa'o zhes yid la byed pa bshad zin pa'i don yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is not mind because it is inconceivable. The meaning of the explanation is complete.

original: de ltar chos thams cad la yang so sor rtog la chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad la yang so sor rtog la chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du rgyas pa ste /
translated: Thus, one should investigate all phenomena, but without fixating on any phenomenon at all. This is the expansion of the investigation of selflessness.

original: 'di ni bdag med par so sor brtags pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag med par so sor brtags pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth investigation of selflessness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught by the statement “The mind of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s roots of virtue is not accompanied by the mind of awakening”?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sngar kun rdzob kyi yid la byed pas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di bla na med @175b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o zhes spyir yongs su bsngo bar byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sngar kun rdzob kyi yid la byed pas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di bla na med @175b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o zhes spyir yongs su bsngo bar byas nas /
translated: The bodhisattva previously dedicates these roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening with a conventional mental attention, as stated in the general dedication.

original: don dam pa'i tshul du so sor brtags nas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang / byang chub kyi sems dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems rnams phan tshun du 'grogs pa med de /
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul du so sor brtags nas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang / byang chub kyi sems dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems rnams phan tshun du 'grogs pa med de /
translated: Then, having investigated in the manner of the ultimate, the mind of the roots of virtue, the mind of awakening, and the mind of dedication are not mutually accompanied.

original: de ltar 'grogs pa med pas yongs su bsngo ba yod dam med ces so sor rtog go //
analyzed: de ltar 'grogs pa med pas yongs su bsngo ba yod dam med ces so sor rtog go //
translated: Thus, since there is no association, one should discern whether there is a dedication or not.

original: 'dir dga' zhig gal te sems rnam par 'grogs pa med kyang 'on kyang sems snga ma'i dbang gis bskyed pa'i 'du byed kyi bye brag ni sems phyi ma dang lhan cig tu 'grogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir dga' zhig gal te sems rnam par 'grogs pa med kyang 'on kyang sems snga ma'i dbang gis bskyed pa'i 'du byed kyi bye brag ni sems phyi ma dang lhan cig tu 'grogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, someone might say, “Even if the mind is not associated, still, due to the power of the previous mind, the particular formations that are produced are associated with the subsequent mind.

original: thams cad kyi tha ma'i sems la ni 'du byed thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tha ma'i sems la ni 'du byed thams cad rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the final mind of all, all formations are completed.

original: de bas na sgo 'dis sems rnam par 'grogs pa yod do zhes zer te /
analyzed: de bas na sgo 'dis sems rnam par 'grogs pa yod do zhes zer te /
translated: Therefore, by this door, there is association of the mind.”

original: de bas na de bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to refute that,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems la med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems la med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said that “the mind of the root of virtue does not exist in the mind of enlightenment,” and so on.

original: bag chags kyi 'du byed la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems de la sems gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyi 'du byed la sogs pa'i sgo nas sems de la sems gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It means that due to the formations of traces and so on, there is no other mind in that mind.

original: 'di ltar sems nyid med par bstan pas bag chags kyi 'du byed la sogs pa ni ri bong gi rva rno ba dang rtul ba'i dngos po lta bur mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i phyir de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems nyid med par bstan pas bag chags kyi 'du byed la sogs pa ni ri bong gi rva rno ba dang rtul ba'i dngos po lta bur mi snang ngo zhes bya ba'i phyir de skad du bshad do //
translated: Thus, since the mind itself is shown to be nonexistent, the formative forces of habitual tendencies and so on do not appear as entities that are sharp or blunt like the horn of a rabbit.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi ngo bo la med par dpyad nas yang bdag gi ngo bo la dpyod do //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi ngo bo la med par dpyad nas yang bdag gi ngo bo la dpyod do //
translated: Having thus investigated the absence of an extraneous nature, he investigates the absence of a nature of its own.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems la med /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems la med /
translated: The mind of the root of the wholesome does not exist in the mind of the root of the wholesome.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de yang byang chub kyi sems la med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de yang byang chub kyi sems la med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The mind of enlightenment does not exist in the mind of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin nyid tsam du mthong ba la ni de lta bu'i kun tu dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid tsam du mthong ba la ni de lta bu'i kun tu dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no such thorough investigation in the vision of suchness alone.🔽Kausika, the mind of the root of the wholesome is not the mind.

original: koo shi ka dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de bzhin nyid tsam kho nar ston to //
analyzed: koo shi ka dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de bzhin nyid tsam kho nar ston to //
translated: This and the like show that it is suchness alone.

original: sems ni rang gi chos nyid kyi dbang gis sems kun brtags pa dang bral ba'i phyir sems med pa'i ngo bo nyid de chos nyid kyi sems su grag go //
analyzed: sems ni rang gi chos nyid kyi dbang gis sems kun brtags pa dang bral ba'i phyir sems med pa'i ngo bo nyid de chos nyid kyi sems su grag go //
translated: The mind is the nature of non-mind, because of the power of its own reality, due to the mind being free from the imagined mind. It is the mind of reality.

original: sems med pa ni sems med pa dang 'grogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos nyid kyi sems su grag pa las 'grogs pa'am yod pa'am yongs su bsngo ba thams cad kyi thams cad du ma grag go zhes ston to //
analyzed: sems med pa ni sems med pa dang 'grogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos nyid kyi sems su grag pa las 'grogs pa'am yod pa'am yongs su bsngo ba thams cad kyi thams cad du ma grag go zhes ston to //
translated: Non-mind does not associate with non-mind, etc. This shows that all association, existence, or dedication is not heard at all in the mind of reality, which is heard as the mind of reality.

original: de'i tshe @176a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe @176a * //
translated: At that time,

original: ni de so so rang gis rig pa yin pas bsam pa'i lam las 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ni de so so rang gis rig pa yin pas bsam pa'i lam las 'das pa'i phyir /
translated: since it is individually cognized, it is beyond the path of thought.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sems ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sems ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is inconceivable and not mind.

original: koo shi ka 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i shes rab ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i shes rab ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Kauśika, this is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva-mahāsattvas. This means the perfection of non-conceptual wisdom.

original: gang de ltar chos thams cad la so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar chos thams cad la so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: The phrase one should investigate all phenomena refers to the conventional.

original: chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med cing mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //🔽bdag gis byas pa gzo bar bgyi ste /
analyzed: chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med cing mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro // bdag gis byas pa gzo bar bgyi ste /
translated: The phrase one should not apprehend any phenomenon refers to the ultimate.

original: byas pa mi gzo bar mi bgyi'o zhes bya bas ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: byas pa mi gzo bar mi bgyi'o zhes bya bas ci bstan zhe na /
translated: One should repay the kindness of others and not be ungrateful. What does this mean?

original: sngon bdag gi bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'khor na nyan thos chen po rnams kyis gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pas yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa brnyes nas yang dag par sgrub pa la bcug ste /
analyzed: sngon bdag gi bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'khor na nyan thos chen po rnams kyis gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pas yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa brnyes nas yang dag par sgrub pa la bcug ste /
translated: In the past, when the Bhagavān was a bodhisattva, he received the instructions and follow-up teachings of the great śrāvakas in the retinue of the thus-gone ones of the past. He was taught, made to uphold, and engaged in correct practice.

original: de dag gis bstan pa'i rim pas bsgrubs nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag gis bstan pa'i rim pas bsgrubs nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Through the stages of their teachings, he accomplished [the path] and fully awakened to buddhahood.

original: de bas na bdag gis kyang 'khor 'dir byang chub sems dpa' 'di rnams la gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pas yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la dgod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis kyang 'khor 'dir byang chub sems dpa' 'di rnams la gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pas yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la dgod par bgyi'o //
translated: Therefore, we also should establish these bodhisattvas in this assembly in correct practice by means of instruction and demonstration.

original: sngon gyi des bdag cag gis bstan pa'i rim pas bsgrubs na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon gyi des bdag cag gis bstan pa'i rim pas bsgrubs na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If they practice in the order taught by us, they will become perfectly enlightened.

original: de bas na sngon gyi nyan thos rnams kyis byas pa bdag gis shes par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bas na sngon gyi nyan thos rnams kyis byas pa bdag gis shes par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, we should teach what was done by the former śrāvakas.

original: gdams shing rjes su bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams la bye brag ci yod ce na 'di la thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma'i gnas skabs gsum ste //
analyzed: gdams shing rjes su bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams la bye brag ci yod ce na 'di la thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma'i gnas skabs gsum ste //
translated: What is the difference in meaning of the words “instruction,” “demonstration,” and so on? There are three states: initial, intermediate, and final.

original: thog mar ni gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: thog mar ni gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya'o //
translated: At the beginning, there should be instruction and demonstration.

original: bar du ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bar du ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: In the middle, there is practice.

original: tha mar ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: tha mar ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: In the end, there is the result.

original: de la thog ma'i gnas skabs su 'di dag ma byed cig ces bya ba ma yin pa las bzlog pa ni gdams pa'o //
analyzed: de la thog ma'i gnas skabs su 'di dag ma byed cig ces bya ba ma yin pa las bzlog pa ni gdams pa'o //
translated: In the initial state, “Do not do this” is the opposite of what should not be done. This is instruction.

original: 'di dag byos shig ces bya ba la sbyor ba ni rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag byos shig ces bya ba la sbyor ba ni rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: The application of you should do this is instruction.

original: bar du ni mi sgrub pa dang / log par sgrub pa dang / cung zad sgrub pa dang / yang dag par sgrub pa ste gnas skabs bzhi'o //
analyzed: bar du ni mi sgrub pa dang / log par sgrub pa dang / cung zad sgrub pa dang / yang dag par sgrub pa ste gnas skabs bzhi'o //
translated: In the middle, there are four stages: not practicing, practicing wrongly, practicing a little, and practicing correctly.

original: de la mi shes pas mi sgrub pa la sgrub tu 'jug @176b pa ni yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi shes pas mi sgrub pa la sgrub tu 'jug @176b pa ni yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: Among them, engaging those who do not practice due to ignorance in practice is correct teaching.

original: log par shes pas log par zhugs pa dag yang dag par sgrub la sbyor ba ni yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: log par shes pas log par zhugs pa dag yang dag par sgrub la sbyor ba ni yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa'o //
translated: Engaging those who have entered wrongly due to wrong understanding in correct practice is correct encouragement.

original: le lo la sogs pa'i skyon gyis cung zad sgrub pa dag legs par brtson 'grus rtsom du 'jug pa ni yang dag par gzengs stod pa'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pa'i skyon gyis cung zad sgrub pa dag legs par brtson 'grus rtsom du 'jug pa ni yang dag par gzengs stod pa'o //
translated: Engaging those who practice a little due to faults such as laziness in proper effort is correct exhortation.

original: shes rab kyis yang dag par zhugs pa dag legs so zhes rjes su yi rangs nas de nyid la sbyor ba ni yang dag par rab tu dgyes par bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis yang dag par zhugs pa dag legs so zhes rjes su yi rangs nas de nyid la sbyor ba ni yang dag par rab tu dgyes par bgyid pa'o //
translated: Congratulating those who have entered correctly with wisdom with excellent! and engaging them in that itself is correct delight.

original: tha mar ni lam la bcug cing 'bras bu la gzhag ces bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tha mar ni lam la bcug cing 'bras bu la gzhag ces bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the end, one should engage in the path and establish oneself in the result.

original: de'i 'og tu ji ltar gnas par bya zhes dris pa la gnas par mi bya ba yongs su spangs te gnas par bya bas gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ji ltar gnas par bya zhes dris pa la gnas par mi bya ba yongs su spangs te gnas par bya bas gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: After that, the question is asked, “How should one abide?” The answer is, “One should abide by abandoning non-abiding.” Abiding is taught as abiding in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas stong pa nyid rtogs pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas stong pa nyid rtogs pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The realization of emptiness by “form is empty of form” and so on is abiding.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul ni gnas pa ma yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul ni gnas pa ma yin no zhes ston te /
translated: The mode of apprehension is not abiding.

original: des ni 'di skad du gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos 'di dag gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos 'di dag gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin la /
translated: This is saying that because these imputed phenomena such as form do not exist by the nature of form and so on,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyis med pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyis med pa ste /
translated: and because the bodhisattva also does not exist by the nature of a bodhisattva,

original: de dag gi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de tha mi dad de gcig go //
analyzed: de dag gi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de tha mi dad de gcig go //
translated: their emptiness is undifferentiated and one.

original: de bas na chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa ni yongs su grub pa yin la byang chub sems dpa' yang gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa ni yongs su grub pa yin la byang chub sems dpa' yang gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the form of reality and so on are the perfected, and the bodhisattva is nondual,

original: gcig pa'i chos nyid du gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gcig pa'i chos nyid du gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: abiding in the reality of oneness, which is taught to be abiding in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gnas par mi bya ba'i 'gres la yang rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
analyzed: gnas par mi bya ba'i 'gres la yang rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
translated: The three types of nonabiding are also taught.

original: chos la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gcig pa'o //
analyzed: chos la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gcig pa'o //
translated: “Do not abide in the Dharma” is the first.

original: chos nyid la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: “Do not abide in reality” is the second.

original: gang zag rnams la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag rnams la gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: “Do not abide in persons” is the third.

original: de la chos kyi 'gres la yang rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: de la chos kyi 'gres la yang rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
translated: The Dharma is also taught in two ways.

original: chos bstan pa dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa dang / chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught as the teaching of the Dharma and as the teaching of the characteristics of the Dharma.

original: de la gzugs la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la gzugs la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Do not abide in the observation of form” and so on are the teaching of the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos bstan pa'o //🔽@177a * // koo shi ka de ltar na gzugs zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos bstan pa'o // @177a * // koo shi ka de ltar na gzugs zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is from “Kauśika, one should not stand in form” up to “one should not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas nyid ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar ni chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //🔽chos nyid kyi 'gres la yang rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas nyid ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar ni chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o // chos nyid kyi 'gres la yang rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
translated: The teaching of the characteristic of reality is from “Kauśika, one should not stand in ‘form’ ” up to “one should not stand in ‘awakening’ ” in the manner of apprehending something.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the three aspects of reality is the teaching of the reality of the aspect of the knowledge of all aspects, the teaching of the reality of the aspect of the knowledge of the path, and the teaching of the reality of the aspect of the knowledge of entities.

original: gzugs rtag go zhes gnas par mi bya /
analyzed: gzugs rtag go zhes gnas par mi bya /
translated: The teaching of the reality of the aspect of the knowledge of all aspects is from “Kauśika, one should not stand in ‘form is permanent’ ” up to “one should not stand in ‘form is empty’ ” in the manner of apprehending something.

original: mi rtag go zhes kyang gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sbyin gnas so zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thams cad shes
analyzed: mi rtag go zhes kyang gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sbyin gnas so zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thams cad shes
translated: “Do not stand thinking, ‘The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha is the field of merit,’ ” up to “Do not stand thinking, ‘I will establish countless, immeasurable, incalculable sentient beings in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’ ”

original: pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the reality of the aspect of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sa dang po nas sa bcu pa'i bar la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bcu pa'i bar la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the first concentration,’ up to ‘I will enter into the tenth concentration.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the emptiness of the subject,’ up to ‘I will enter into the absorption of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the perfection of wisdom.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the perfection of concentration.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the perfection of perseverance.’

original: sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa🔽nyid kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: “Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the perfection of patience.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the perfection of morality.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the perfection of giving.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the applications of mindfulness.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the right efforts.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the legs of miraculous power.’

original: mig lnga bsgrub par bya ste zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: mig lnga bsgrub par bya ste zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: “Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the faculties.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the powers.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the branches of awakening.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the path.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the ten powers.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the four fearlessnesses.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the four detailed and thorough knowledges.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will enter into the absorption of the knowledge of all aspects.’🔽“Do not stand thinking, ‘I will

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu lus la bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu lus la bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi chos nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching on the reality of the factors of the knowledge of all modes is from “one should not stand in the thought ‘I shall fully know the eighty minor signs on my body’” up to “one should not stand in the thought ‘I shall fully know the eighty minor signs on my body.’”

original: gang zag bstan pa'i 'gres la yang thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag bstan pa'i 'gres la yang thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The three kinds of application in the case of the teaching on the person are to be connected with the knowledge of paths, etc.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la gnas te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la gnas te /
translated: “Standing in the four bases of magic power,

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par zhugs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sa'i phyogs kyi chos so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par zhugs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sa'i phyogs kyi chos so //
translated: entering into this kind of concentration” and so on is the reality of the factors of the knowledge of paths.

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya snyam zhes bya ba gnas brtan rab 'byor ci las sems par gyur ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya snyam zhes bya ba gnas brtan rab 'byor ci las sems par gyur ce na /
translated: “How then, Subhūti, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, stand in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: @177b chos thams cad la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bshad cing stong pa nyid la ni gnas par mi nus la gnas par mi bya'o zhes kyang bshad na de ji ltar rigs par 'gyur snyam du sems par gyur to //🔽de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi gnas par sgrub pa nyid /
analyzed: @177b chos thams cad la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bshad cing stong pa nyid la ni gnas par mi nus la gnas par mi bya'o zhes kyang bshad na de ji ltar rigs par 'gyur snyam du sems par gyur to // de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis mi gnas par sgrub pa nyid /
translated: If it is explained that one should not abide in any dharma, and if it is explained that one should not abide in emptiness, how could that be reasonable?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin par bstan pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin par bstan pa /
translated: Then the elder Subhūti, in order to demonstrate that the very non-abiding is the abiding in the perfection of wisdom,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ni ci la 'ang gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhugs par bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ni ci la 'ang gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhugs par bstan to //
translated: taught that the mind of the Tathāgata does not abide in anything at all, demonstrating that he abides in non-abiding nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar mi gnas pa la gnas pa'i bsgrub pa bshad pas gdul ba las brtsams te bshad pa la brjod du med par bshad pas 'dul ba gang yin pa de dag the tshom zos par gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mi gnas pa la gnas pa'i bsgrub pa bshad pas gdul ba las brtsams te bshad pa la brjod du med par bshad pas 'dul ba gang yin pa de dag the tshom zos par gyur te /
translated: Thus, by explaining the establishment of non-abiding, those who were being guided, having begun with the explanation, became doubtful about what was explained as inexpressible.

original: de bas na de dag la brtsams nas bshad pa gzhan skabs phya ste /
analyzed: de bas na de dag la brtsams nas bshad pa gzhan skabs phya ste /
translated: Therefore, beginning with them, another explanation is given.

original: lha'i bu dag gang smras pa shes par mi rung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang brjod pa de dag ci'i phyir mi shes sam zhes lha'i bu rnams la dris pa dang / de'i phyir de dag gis /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gang smras pa shes par mi rung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang brjod pa de dag ci'i phyir mi shes sam zhes lha'i bu rnams la dris pa dang / de'i phyir de dag gis /
translated: The elder Subhūti asked the gods, Why don't you understand what I said, that 'gods, it is not proper to say that'?

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor shes par mi rung ngo zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor shes par mi rung ngo zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, they said, Noble Subhūti, it is not proper to say that.

original: de nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir gnas brtan gyis yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir gnas brtan gyis yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Then, because the perfection of wisdom is inexpressible, the elder did not utter a single syllable, as it is said.

original: 'di ltar de na bshad par snang ba dang / mnyan par snang ba de ni kun brtags pa yin no zhes sprul pa dang / rmi lam dang / brag ca dang / sgyu ma lta bur bstan pas lha'i bu de rnams dga' bar byas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de na bshad par snang ba dang / mnyan par snang ba de ni kun brtags pa yin no zhes sprul pa dang / rmi lam dang / brag ca dang / sgyu ma lta bur bstan pas lha'i bu de rnams dga' bar byas so //
translated: Thus, what appeared there as explanation and what appeared as listening was taught to be imagined, and the gods were delighted by the teaching that it is like an emanation, a dream, an echo, and an illusion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
translated: A Buddha emanation is an emanation of a Tathāgata.

original: lha'i bu dag gzugs ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gzugs ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no /
translated: The gods, form is not profound, not subtle means that imputed form is not profound, not subtle, because it is not real.

original: yang lha'i bu dag 'di ltar gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos nyid kyi gzugs ni ngo bo nyid kyis mi g-yo ba'i phyir zab pa ma yin /
analyzed: yang lha'i bu dag 'di ltar gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos nyid kyi gzugs ni ngo bo nyid kyis mi g-yo ba'i phyir zab pa ma yin /
translated: Moreover, the gods, the nature of form is not profound, not subtle and so on, indicates that the form of reality is not profound, not subtle, because it is immovable by nature.

original: phra ba ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phra ba ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is not subtle.

original: de bas na 'dir ni 'gres rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir ni 'gres rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, here there are two types of repetition:

original: chos kyi 'gres dang rang bzhin gyi 'gres so //
analyzed: chos kyi 'gres dang rang bzhin gyi 'gres so //
translated: the repetition of phenomena and the repetition of nature.

original: 'o na chos bstan pa 'di la gzugs su brtags pa yang med dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni @178a * //
analyzed: 'o na chos bstan pa 'di la gzugs su brtags pa yang med dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni @178a * //
translated: Now, in this teaching of the Dharma, is there also no imputation of form? and so on.

original: gal te chos thams cad brjod du med na de lta na ni gzugs la sogs pa la ma brtags sam /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad brjod du med na de lta na ni gzugs la sogs pa la ma brtags sam /
translated: If all phenomena are inexpressible, then is form and so on not imputed?

original: ma bshad dam zhes lha'i bu rnams kyis dris pa dang / de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes brtags pa med pa dang / bshad pa med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: ma bshad dam zhes lha'i bu rnams kyis dris pa dang / de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes brtags pa med pa dang / bshad pa med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Then the elder Subhuti taught that it is indeed so, just as it is, without investigation and without explanation.

original: bzod pa 'di la mi brten du mi rung zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i bshad pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: bzod pa 'di la mi brten du mi rung zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i bshad pa 'di la'o //
translated: It is said, It is not suitable to rely on this acceptance, referring to this inexpressible explanation.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor la chos nyan pa rnam pa ji lta bu dag tu 'dod par bya snyam mo zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor la chos nyan pa rnam pa ji lta bu dag tu 'dod par bya snyam mo zhes bya ba ni //
translated: He thought, What kind of Dharma listeners should I wish for the elder Subhuti?

original: gal te don dam par brjod du med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par brjod du med pa yin na /
translated: If it is inexpressible in the ultimate sense,

original: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po med pas /
analyzed: 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po med pas /
translated: there would be no expounder and no listener,

original: chos nyan pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: chos nyan pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: and there would be no Dharma listener.🔽This is what is taught.

original: de na gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu dag bdag la chos nyan pa ni sgyu ma lta bur 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam par 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po med pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de na gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu dag bdag la chos nyan pa ni sgyu ma lta bur 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam par 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po med pa nyid du ston to //
translated: There, the elder Subhūti teaches that ultimately there is no expounder or listener, with the words, “The divine princes should consider that the one who listens to the Dharma from me is like an illusion.”

original: btsun pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is so profound,

original: 'di ltar mthong bar dka' ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong bar dka' ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: so difficult to see.”

original: gting dpag dka' bas na zab pa'o //
analyzed: gting dpag dka' bas na zab pa'o //
translated: It is profound because it is difficult to fathom.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir mthong bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir mthong bar dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to see because it is not the object of the five collections of consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba'o //🔽nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba'o // nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to realize because it is not the object of the mental consciousness.🔽It is peaceful because it pacifies all afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi bar dag nye bar zhi ba'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi bar dag nye bar zhi ba'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
translated: It is sublime because it pacifies all sufferings up to the highest.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir phra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir phra ba'o //
translated: It is subtle because all conceptual elaborations are completely pacified.

original: so so rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa'o //🔽bsam pa'i lam las 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa'o // bsam pa'i lam las 'das pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not other because it is individually cognized.

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the domain of sophists because it transcends the path of thought.

original: chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa la mkhas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa la mkhas pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mkhas pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of skill in realizing all phenomena just as they are.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs pa'i gnas kyi mchog yin pas shin tu 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs pa'i gnas kyi mchog yin pas shin tu 'phags pa'o //
translated: It is exalted because it is the supreme abode for realizing supramundane phenomena.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa rnams nyid kyis rig par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir mkhas pa dang mdzangs pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa rnams nyid kyis rig par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir mkhas pa dang mdzangs pas rig par bya'o //
translated: It is to be known by the wise and the sagacious because it is not the domain of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and is not to be known by those who have not yet reached the stage of irreversibility.

original: @178b len par byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: @178b len par byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: “They will take it up” means they will uphold it.

original: bden pa mthong ba'i gang zag gam /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i gang zag gam /
translated: It is the domain of those who have seen the truth.

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar kun rdzob tu tshol bar byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar kun rdzob tu tshol bar byed pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase the arhat who has exhausted the contaminants and so on indicates the previous investigation in terms of the conventional.

original: de la don dam par na byang chub sems dpa' la bden pa mthong ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la don dam par na byang chub sems dpa' la bden pa mthong ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: In this regard, the phrase ultimately, the bodhisattva indicates the seeing of the truth.

original: byang chub tu 'gyur ba ni dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu 'gyur ba ni dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase in the state of enlightenment indicates the arhat.

original: de ltar kun rdzob tu bstan nas yang don dam par bstan pa de dag ni gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob tu bstan nas yang don dam par bstan pa de dag ni gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having thus indicated the conventional, the phrase they do not conceive of form as empty and so on indicates the ultimate.

original: len par byed pa su yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /🔽'dis ni gang dag de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon sum du byas par gyur pa de dag nyid tshol bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: len par byed pa su yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ste / 'dis ni gang dag de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon sum du byas par gyur pa de dag nyid tshol bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The phrase there is no one who appropriates indicates the ultimate.

original: de dag kyang don dam par btsal bar bya ba med pa'i phyir tshol bar byed pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de dag kyang don dam par btsal bar bya ba med pa'i phyir tshol bar byed pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that those who have realized the perfection of wisdom free from conceptualization are the very ones who investigate, and that they do not investigate because there is nothing to be investigated ultimately.

original: de skad smras pa dang / gnas brtan sha ra dva ti'i bus 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po med par dam bcas pa lung dang 'gal bar bstan pas /
analyzed: de skad smras pa dang / gnas brtan sha ra dva ti'i bus 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po med par dam bcas pa lung dang 'gal bar bstan pas /
translated: Having said that, the elder Śāradvatīputra, by teaching that the assertion of the absence of expounder and listener contradicts scripture,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las theg pa gsum rgya cher ma bstan tam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las theg pa gsum rgya cher ma bstan tam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: says to the venerable Subhūti, “Have you not taught extensively the three vehicles in the perfection of wisdom?” and so on.

original: theg pa gsum bshad pa dang / sa bcu yongs su bzung ba dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse bas gnas pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa gsum bshad pa dang / sa bcu yongs su bzung ba dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse bas gnas pa dang /
translated: He explains the three vehicles, the ten grounds, the bodhisattva path such as the perfections, being born in the family of the tathāgatas, abiding in the play of the superknowledges,

original: chos nyan pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa med pa dang / spobs pa'i yon tan bdun la sogs pa chos 'di rnams bstan te /
analyzed: chos nyan pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa med pa dang / spobs pa'i yon tan bdun la sogs pa chos 'di rnams bstan te /
translated: listening to the dharma, not forgetting, an undistracted mind, the seven qualities of eloquence, and so on.

original: bdag cag gis kyang thos so zhes ston to //
analyzed: bdag cag gis kyang thos so zhes ston to //
translated: He teaches, “We have also heard these dharmas.”

original: de'i 'og tu gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos 'di rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bshad kyi /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos 'di rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bshad kyi /
translated: Then the elder Subhūti explained these dharmas in a way that does not apprehend them.

original: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But ultimately, they do not exist.

original: de bas na bshad pa yang 'khrul pa tsam mo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na bshad pa yang 'khrul pa tsam mo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to show that the explanation is just an error,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, Thus it is, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, thus it is.

original: de dag stong pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs nang stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag stong pa yin pa'i gtan tshigs nang stong pa nyid dang zhes bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The reason why they are empty is stated as because of inner emptiness up to because of the emptiness that is the essential nature of non-existence.

original: @179a * // lha'i bu rnams la ye shes kyi snang ba 'byung ba'i mtshan ma bstan pa'i phyir me tog gi mchod pa bstan te /
analyzed: @179a * // lha'i bu rnams la ye shes kyi snang ba 'byung ba'i mtshan ma bstan pa'i phyir me tog gi mchod pa bstan te /
translated: In order to show the sign of the arising of the light of wisdom to the sons of the gods, the offering of flowers is taught.

original: me tog 'di dag sprul pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsams pa 'og nas bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me tog 'di dag sprul pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsams pa 'og nas bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: These flowers are emanations and so forth is in order to open the section of the thought that will be taught below.

original: koo shi ka me tog 'di dag ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka me tog 'di dag ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ma skyes pa ste /
translated: “Kauśika, these flowers are non-arisen” shows the non-arisen nature of the perfected characteristic.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is the emptiness of inherent nature,

original: me tog gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: me tog gi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: but not the inherent nature of flowers.

original: koo shi ka gzugs kyang ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs kyang ma byung ba ste /
translated: “Kauśika, form is also non-arisen.”

original: gang ma byung ba de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i gzugs la 'dus byas kyi skye ba med pa'i phyir gzugs ma byung ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang ma byung ba de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i gzugs la 'dus byas kyi skye ba med pa'i phyir gzugs ma byung ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “That which is non-arisen is not form” shows that ultimate form is non-arisen because it is not produced.

original: de ltar 'dus ma byas pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'dus ma byas pa /
translated: Thus, it is unconditioned.

original: ma skyes pa la kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “That which is non-arisen is not form” shows that the characteristic of imagined form does not exist in the unconditioned, non-arisen.

original: btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
analyzed: btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
translated: It is not contradictory to the conventional.

original: chos nyid kyang ston te zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam par mi 'gal bar bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: chos nyid kyang ston te zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam par mi 'gal bar bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: It shows reality. This means that it is taught without contradiction in terms of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: // / bam po bco brgyad pa /🔽koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i de ltar chos thams cad brtags pa tsam du rig par byas te /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang sngar rnam pa gsum du zhus pa las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi zhes tha mar zhus
analyzed: // / bam po bco brgyad pa / koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i de ltar chos thams cad brtags pa tsam du rig par byas te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang sngar rnam pa gsum du zhus pa las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi zhes tha mar zhus
translated: Chapter 18🔽Kauśika, having understood that all phenomena are merely conceptualized in this way,🔽the bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in the perfection of wisdom.” This is the answer to the question asked earlier in three parts, “How should the bodhisattva mahāsattva train in the perfection of wisdom?”🔽🔽

original: pa de ston to //🔽gzugs la mi slob ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mi slob pa nyid slob pa ste dper na gnas pa med pa nyid gnas pa'o zhes bya ba lta bur ston to //🔽gzugs la sogs pa dngos po med par mthong bas gzugs la sogs pa la mi slob ces bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa de ston to //🔽gzugs la mi slob ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mi slob pa nyid slob pa ste dper na gnas pa med pa nyid gnas pa'o zhes bya ba lta bur ston to //🔽gzugs la sogs pa dngos po med par mthong bas gzugs la sogs pa la mi slob ces bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is what is being taught.🔽The phrase one does not train with regard to form, etc. teaches that non-training is training, just as non-abiding is abiding.🔽It is said that one does not train with regard to form, etc. because one sees form, etc. as non-existent.🔽

original: 'di ltar gang la bslab par bya ba'i gzugs de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la bslab par bya ba'i gzugs de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, one does not see that form, etc., which is to be trained in.🔽Śatakratu asks, “Why does one not see form, etc.?”

original: gzugs la sogs pa ci'i phyir yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes brgya byin gyis dris pa dang / stong pa yin pas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ci'i phyir yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes brgya byin gyis dris pa dang / stong pa yin pas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is taught:

original: gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs @179b so //
analyzed: gzugs gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs @179b so //
translated: “Form is empty of form.”

original: mi slob pa'i gtan tshigs su /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i gtan tshigs su /
translated: The reason for being a non-learner is stated:

original: koo ka gzugs stong pa nyid ni gzugs stong pa nyid la mi slob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: koo ka gzugs stong pa nyid ni gzugs stong pa nyid la mi slob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Kauśika, the emptiness of form is not trained in the emptiness of form.”

original: slob pa gang yin pa dang gang la slob pa de gnyis ka yang med pa'i phyir slob pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slob pa gang yin pa dang gang la slob pa de gnyis ka yang med pa'i phyir slob pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “there is no training” is that there is no training in either that which is a learner or that which is to be trained in, because both of those do not exist.

original: de'i 'og tu koo shi ka gang gzugs stong pa nyid la mi slob ces bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mi slob pa de ni gnyis su byar med par gzugs stong pa nyid la slob po zhes bya ba
analyzed: de'i 'og tu koo shi ka gang gzugs stong pa nyid la mi slob ces bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mi slob pa de ni gnyis su byar med par gzugs stong pa nyid la slob po zhes bya ba
translated: Then, Kauśika, he who does not train in the emptiness of form, etc., up to he who does not train in the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes, he trains in the emptiness of form, etc., up to he trains in the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes, without making any discrimination.

original: nas gnyis su byar med par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa stong pa nyid la slob po zhes bya ba ni gang mi slob pa de nyid slob pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: nas gnyis su byar med par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa stong pa nyid la slob po zhes bya ba ni gang mi slob pa de nyid slob pa yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that he who does not train is training.

original: gnyis su byar med par zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid du gcig pa'i phyir gcig gi stong pa nyid la bslabs na chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la bslab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med par zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid du gcig pa'i phyir gcig gi stong pa nyid la bslabs na chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la bslab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ Without making any discrimination” means that, because of the sameness of emptiness, when one trains in the emptiness of one thing, one trains in the emptiness of all things.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gcig gi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni kun gyi stong pa nyid cas bshad do //
analyzed: gcig gi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni kun gyi stong pa nyid cas bshad do //
translated: it is said that the emptiness of one thing is the emptiness of all.

original: de'i 'og tu koo shi ka gang gnyis su byar med pa gzugs stong pa nyid la slob pa zhes bya ba nas gnyis su byar med par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos grangs med /🔽dpag tu med pa rnams la bslab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang de ltar chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la bslab pa de pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu koo shi ka gang gnyis su byar med pa gzugs stong pa nyid la slob pa zhes bya ba nas gnyis su byar med par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos grangs med / dpag tu med pa rnams la bslab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang de ltar chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la bslab pa de pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: Then, Kauśika, that which is not divided into two, the training in the emptiness of form, up to the training in the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects that is not divided into two, that is the training in the incalculable,🔽immeasurable buddha qualities.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag la bslab pa yin no zhes ston to //🔽de'i 'og tu de ni gzugs 'phel bar bya ba dang 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi par dag la slob pa de gzugs la sogs pa la 'phel bar
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar dag la bslab pa yin no zhes ston to // de'i 'og tu de ni gzugs 'phel bar bya ba dang 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi par dag la slob pa de gzugs la sogs pa la 'phel bar
translated: This shows that one who trains in the emptiness of all phenomena in that way trains in the perfections and so on up to the buddha qualities.🔽Then, that is not training in the increase or decrease of form, up to that is not training in the increase or decrease of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bya ba'am / 'grib par bya ba med par ston te /
analyzed: bya ba'am / 'grib par bya ba med par ston te /
translated: This shows that one who trains in the perfections and so on up to the buddha qualities does not train in the increase or decrease of form and so on.

original: dkar po'i phyogs 'phel bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs 'phel bar bya ba'am /
translated: or to increase the side of virtue

original: nag po'i phyogs 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: or to diminish the side of evil.

original: de'i 'og tu de ni gzugs yongs su gzung ba dang med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po zhes bya ba ni gang la de ltar 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i chos rnams med pa de la khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams yongs su bzung zhing chos ngan pa rnams @180a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de ni gzugs yongs su gzung ba dang med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po zhes bya ba ni gang la de ltar 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i chos rnams med pa de la khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams yongs su bzung zhing chos ngan pa rnams @180a * //
translated: After that, he does not train in order to grasp or reject form. This shows that where there are no dharmas to be increased or diminished in that way, there is no grasping of superior dharmas or

original: chud gsan par bya ba med par ston to //
analyzed: chud gsan par bya ba med par ston to //
translated: abandoning of bad dharmas.

original: de skad smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir de yongs su 'dzin pa dang med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob ces gsungs pa ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus de la byang chub sems dpa' chos ngan pa rnams yongs su spong zhing khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams
analyzed: de skad smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir de yongs su 'dzin pa dang med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob ces gsungs pa ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus de la byang chub sems dpa' chos ngan pa rnams yongs su spong zhing khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams
translated: When that was said, the Venerable Subhūti said, Why does he not train in order to grasp or reject? This is the Elder Śāriputra's question about how a bodhisattva abandons bad dharmas and🔽grasps superior dharmas.

original: thob par byed na de la ci'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa dang / med par bya ba med ces 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: thob par byed na de la ci'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa dang / med par bya ba med ces 'dri ba'o //
translated: Thus, he asks, “What is not to be removed?”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis gzugs la gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis gzugs la gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The elder Subhūti said, “Form is not grasped at in form.”

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnams med par ston to //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnams med par ston to //
translated: He shows that the grasped and grasper do not exist.

original: de'i gtan tshigs su stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs su stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The reason for that is stated: “Because it is empty.”

original: gzugs kyi skye med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye med do //
translated: There is no arising of form.

original: de bzhin nyid la skye ba med pa'i sngon ma byung ba glo bur la ni skye ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la skye ba med pa'i sngon ma byung ba glo bur la ni skye ba med do //
translated: There is no prior non-arising of suchness, which is adventitious and does not arise.

original: gnas pa ni mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: gnas pa ni mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'gag pa med do //
translated: Since abiding is an unchanging essence, there is no cessation.

original: de bzhin nyid la skye ba med pa'i sngon ma byung ba blang ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la skye ba med pa'i sngon ma byung ba blang ba med do //
translated: There is no prior non-grasping of suchness, which does not arise.

original: 'gag pa med pas bzung ba las dor ba med do //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pas bzung ba las dor ba med do //
translated: Since there is no cessation, there is no discarding of what is grasped.

original: gzung bar bya ba med pas sngon ma byung ba'i rnam par byang ba med do //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba med pas sngon ma byung ba'i rnam par byang ba med do //
translated: Since there is nothing to be grasped, there is no prior non-purification.

original: dor bar bya ba med pas spang bar bya ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
analyzed: dor bar bya ba med pas spang bar bya ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
translated: Since there is nothing to be rejected, there is no affliction to be abandoned.

original: rnam par byang ba med pas 'phel ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pas 'phel ba med do //
translated: Since there is no purification, there is no increase.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas 'grib pa med do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas 'grib pa med do //
translated: Since there is no affliction, there is no decrease.

original: btsun pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang btsal bar bya zhes bya ba ni 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dris so //
analyzed: btsun pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang btsal bar bya zhes bya ba ni 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dris so //
translated: Venerable, the perfection of wisdom that should be sought - here, the perfection of wisdom itself is asked about in order to show the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gyi le'u las zhes bya ba ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'bring du bshad pa de dag thams cad ni rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi le'u las zhes bya ba ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'bring du bshad pa de dag thams cad ni rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya'o //
translated: The chapter of Subhūti - all that is explained as medium in the perfection of wisdom is called the chapter of Subhūti.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the knowledge of all aspects arises from the perfection of wisdom, which is the basis.

original: de bshad pa yang de ni de las gzung bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bshad pa yang de ni de las gzung bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The explanation of that is taught: “That should be understood from that.”

original: chos zab mo bshad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul yin na rab 'byor smos pa lha'i dbang pos ma bzod nas 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di ltar bshad pa'i skabs @180b phye ba de khyod kyi byin gyi rlabs sam /
analyzed: chos zab mo bshad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul yin na rab 'byor smos pa lha'i dbang pos ma bzod nas 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di ltar bshad pa'i skabs @180b phye ba de khyod kyi byin gyi rlabs sam /
translated: The explanation of the profound Dharma is the domain of the Tathāgata. Subhūti said, “Śakra, lord of the gods, could not bear this, and asked, ‘Ārya Subhūti, is this explanation of yours an empowerment of yours?

original: de khyod kyi mthu'am zhes dris so //
analyzed: de khyod kyi mthu'am zhes dris so //
translated: Is it your power?’

original: de skad smras pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de skad smras pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: When this was said, the elder Subhūti

original: dang por kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yin te de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dgra bcom pa dag chos 'chad do zhes bstan to /
analyzed: dang por kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yin te de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dgra bcom pa dag chos 'chad do zhes bstan to /
translated: first taught by way of the conventional, “These are the empowerment of the Tathāgata. By the empowerment of the Tathāgata, the arhats teach the Dharma.”

original: de nas brgya byin gyis de yang ma bzod nas /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyis de yang ma bzod nas /
translated: Then Śakra could not bear that either,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor chos thams cad ni byin gyi rlabs med na ci'i phyir de skad du 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor chos thams cad ni byin gyi rlabs med na ci'i phyir de skad du 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
translated: and said, “Venerable Subhūti, if all dharmas are without empowerment, why do you say, ‘This is the power of the Tathāgata’?

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs so zhes smra zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs so zhes smra zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: This is the blessing of the Tathagata.”

original: de nas gnas brtan gyis tshig de la rjes su yi rang nas /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan gyis tshig de la rjes su yi rang nas /
translated: Then the Elder, having rejoiced in those words,

original: don dam pa'i tshul du na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid la bya ba bstan pa'i phyir byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul du na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid la bya ba bstan pa'i phyir byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang
translated: in order to teach that the so-called Tathagata is suchness in the ultimate sense, said, “In the reality of non-blessing, the Tathagata is not apprehended,” etc.

original: yang med do zhes ston to //🔽chos nyid la kun brtags pa'i chos med pa'i phyir byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa med do //
analyzed: yang med do zhes ston to // chos nyid la kun brtags pa'i chos med pa'i phyir byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos thams cad kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa med do //
translated: He taught that there is no dharma whatsoever called “Tathagata.”🔽Because imagined dharmas do not exist in reality, the Tathagata does not exist in that reality of all dharmas which is non-blessing.

original: chos nyid las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams med pa'i phyir byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos nyid las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams med pa'i phyir byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
translated: Because there are no dharmas apart from reality, the Tathagata is not apprehended apart from the reality of non-blessing.

original: kun brtags pa la chos nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun brtags pa la chos nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: because the imagined does not abide in reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos mi dmigs so //
translated: And also, apart from the Tathāgata, the reality of a dharma that is not empowered is not apprehended.

original: chos las gud na chos nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos las gud na chos nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because reality does not exist apart from a dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las gud na yang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las gud na yang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid mi dmigs so //
translated: And also, apart from the Tathāgata, the reality of a dharma that is not empowered is not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyi 'gres la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyi 'gres la yang sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, the same should be applied to suchness.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi 'gres la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i chos nyid dang / de bzhin nyid kyi 'gres la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the reality of form, etc., up to the knowledge of all aspects, and suchness, should be applied.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyi gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi chos nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyi gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi chos nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: The reality of the Tathāgata is not conjoined with the reality of form,

original: bral ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it disjoined.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not conjoined with anything other than the reality of form,🔽nor is it disjoined.

original: bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med de gcig @181a * //
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa med de gcig @181a * //
translated: Nor is it separated from them.

original: ba'i phyir de skad bstan to //
analyzed: ba'i phyir de skad bstan to //
translated: This is taught because they are not different, because they are one.

original: gnas dang gnas pa'i dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang ldan pa dang bral ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag ni tha dad pa yod na rigs kyi med na mi rigs so //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa'i dngos po dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang ldan pa dang bral ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag ni tha dad pa yod na rigs kyi med na mi rigs so //
translated: The conceptual thoughts of the relation of container to contained and of possession and separation are reasonable when there is difference, but unreasonable when there is no difference.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyi 'gres la yang /🔽koo shi ka 'di ni de ltar gang chos thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyi 'gres la yang / koo shi ka 'di ni de ltar gang chos thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Similarly, the same should be applied to suchness.

original: bral ba yang ma yin pa de'i mthu'o //
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin pa de'i mthu'o //
translated: Kausika, this is the power of that which is neither conjoined with nor separated from all dharmas.

original: 'di ni de'i byin gyi rlabs so zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i byin gyi rlabs so zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This is its blessing.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mthu dang stong pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mthu dang stong pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs te /
translated: This is the power of emptiness and the blessing of emptiness.

original: bshad pa de stong pa nyid las brtsams nas byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bshad pa de stong pa nyid las brtsams nas byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because this explanation arises from emptiness. This is the meaning.

original: gzugs las kyang btsal bar mi bya zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir de skad bstan to /
analyzed: gzugs las kyang btsal bar mi bya zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir de skad bstan to /
translated: “Nor should it be sought in form” means that it is taught in that way because form and so on do not exist.

original: gzugs las gzhan du yang btsal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa med do zhes tha dad pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan du yang btsal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa med do zhes tha dad pa med par bstan to //
translated: “Nor should it be sought apart from form” means that it is taught that there is no difference because the perfection of wisdom does not exist as something separate.

original: de'i phyir yod pa ma yin tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa ma yin tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro // chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, because it is taught that it does not exist and is not different,

original: bral ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bral ba yang ma yin te /
translated: “All those dharmas are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Because they are without defining characteristics.”
