original: gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ka yang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ka yang yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: “Form is not the perfection of wisdom” means that both form and the perfection of wisdom are taught to be nonexistent.

original: gzugs las gud na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad par brjod du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs las gud na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir tha dad par brjod du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not exist apart from form. This is because it does not exist. The meaning is that it is not suitable to be described as different.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: koo shi ka 'di ltar chos 'di dag thams cad ni yod pa ma yin te dmigs su med do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di ltar chos 'di dag thams cad ni yod pa ma yin te dmigs su med do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Kauśika, all these dharmas do not exist and are not apprehended.

original: de nas yang chos bshad pa 'di ngo mtshar du gzung bar bstan pa'i phyir brgya byin gyis tshig rnam pa bzhi bkod de /
analyzed: de nas yang chos bshad pa 'di ngo mtshar du gzung bar bstan pa'i phyir brgya byin gyis tshig rnam pa bzhi bkod de /
translated: Then, in order to show that this Dharma teaching is to be held in wonder, Śatakratu set forth four statements:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni che ba ste zhes bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni tshad med pa ste zhes bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dpag tu med pa ste zhes bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mtha' yas pa ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni che ba ste zhes bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni tshad med pa ste zhes bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dpag tu med pa ste zhes bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mtha' yas pa ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This perfection is great, this perfection is immeasurable, this perfection is infinite, and this perfection is endless.

original: gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe byung ngo zhes bya ba'am ma byung ngo @181b zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe byung ngo zhes bya ba'am ma byung ngo @181b zhes bya bar sbyar ro // phyi ma'i mtha' mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The past limit of form is not apprehended, i.e. it is not apprehended as having arisen or not having arisen at that time.

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ro //🔽dbus mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni yod do zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ro // dbus mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni yod do zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The future limit is not apprehended, i.e. it is not apprehended as arising or not arising at that time.

original: med do zhes bya bar mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: med do zhes bya bar mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The middle is not apprehended, i.e. it is not apprehended as existent or non-existent.

original: de ltar dus gsum du dbyer med pas che ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum du dbyer med pas che ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is great because it is not differentiated in the three times.

original: gzugs kyi tshad ni dmigs su med do zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i gzugs la 'di tsam mo zhes yongs su bcad pa med pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi tshad ni dmigs su med do zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i gzugs la 'di tsam mo zhes yongs su bcad pa med pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid do //
translated: The measure of form is not apprehended, i.e. it is immeasurable because the ultimate form cannot be defined as being just this much.

original: grangs kyis dpag tu med pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: grangs kyis dpag tu med pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is infinite because it cannot be measured by number.

original: skad cig yongs su chad pa med pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig yongs su chad pa med pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: It is unlimited because it is not interrupted by moments.

original: sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i mtha'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i mtha'o //
translated: The past limit is the limit of birth.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The end of the future is the end of cessation.

original: dbus zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: dbus zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa'i gnas so //
translated: The middle is the moment of abiding.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa gcig gis bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas pa gcig gis bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the infinite perfections with one verse,

original: de'i 'og tu mtha' yas pa rnam pa bzhis ston te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mtha' yas pa rnam pa bzhis ston te /
translated: he teaches them with four kinds of infinity in the next verse.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mtha' yas pa dang / chos kyi sku mtha' yas pa dang / de bzhin nyid mtha' yas pa dang / sems can mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mtha' yas pa dang / chos kyi sku mtha' yas pa dang / de bzhin nyid mtha' yas pa dang / sems can mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: The infinity of the knowledge of all modes, the infinity of the Dharma body, the infinity of thusness, and the infinity of sentient beings.

original: de la sems can mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems can mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is meant by the infinity of sentient beings?

original: de mtha' zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis te /
analyzed: de mtha' zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis te /
translated: The end is the two extremes.

original: rtag pa'i mtha' dang chad pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtha' dang chad pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The extreme of eternalism and the extreme of nihilism.

original: mtha' de gnyis med pa ni mtha' yas pa nyid de sems can gyi mtha' med pa ni sems can mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' de gnyis med pa ni mtha' yas pa nyid de sems can gyi mtha' med pa ni sems can mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: The absence of those two extremes is infinity. The infinity of sentient beings is the infinity of the end of sentient beings.

original: gal te sems can yod na ni de ltar gyur na mtha' dang ldan par 'gyur ba zhig na 'di ltar sems can ngo bo nyid kyis med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te sems can yod na ni de ltar gyur na mtha' dang ldan par 'gyur ba zhig na 'di ltar sems can ngo bo nyid kyis med pa kho na ste /
translated: If sentient beings existed, then that would be the case, and there would be an end. But in this way, sentient beings are just non-existent by their very nature.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi sems can mtha' yas pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi sems can mtha' yas pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, sentient beings with an intrinsic nature do not exist infinitely.

original: sems can mtha' yas pa de yang chos bshad pa 'di la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can mtha' yas pa de yang chos bshad pa 'di la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And those sentient beings who are infinite do not exist in this explanation of the Dharma.

original: gal te chos bshad pa 'di la sems can 'ga' zhig bstan na ni de ltar gyur na sems can mtha' yas pa yang bstan par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te chos bshad pa 'di la sems can 'ga' zhig bstan na ni de ltar gyur na sems can mtha' yas pa yang bstan par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If in this explanation of the Dharma some sentient being were to be taught, then in that case sentient beings would be taught to be infinite.

original: 'di ltar sems can ma bstan pas de'i phyir 'di la sems can mtha' yas pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can ma bstan pas de'i phyir 'di la sems can mtha' yas pa yang med do //
translated: But in this way, since no sentient being is taught, therefore here there are no sentient beings who are infinite.

original: de bas na koo shi ka gang la sems can du bshad pa gang yang med pa de sems can mtha' yas pa gang yang med de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na koo shi ka gang la sems can du bshad pa gang yang med pa de sems can mtha' yas pa gang yang med de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, it is said, “wherever there is no explanation of sentient beings at all, there are no sentient beings who are infinite.”

original: @182a * // sems can ma bstan pa'i phyir sems can mtha' yas pa yang ma bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @182a * // sems can ma bstan pa'i phyir sems can mtha' yas pa yang ma bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because sentient beings are not taught, infinite sentient beings are not taught.

original: de'i 'og tu koo shi ka gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bzhugs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu koo shi ka gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bzhugs te /
translated: Then, Kauśika, if the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One were to remain for an eon or for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River,

original: sems can sems can zhes gsung du brjod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems can mtha' yas pa tshig gi kha na las pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can sems can zhes gsung du brjod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems can mtha' yas pa tshig gi kha na las pa ma yin gyi /
translated: and were to speak the word “sentient being,” etc., it shows that infinite sentient beings are not a verbal offense,

original: sems can med pa nyid kyi phyir ngo bo nyid kyis mtha' yas pa'o zhes ston to //🔽gal te sems can mtha' yas pa tshig gi khar las pa zhig yin na ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung las sems can skye ba'am /
analyzed: sems can med pa nyid kyi phyir ngo bo nyid kyis mtha' yas pa'o zhes ston to // gal te sems can mtha' yas pa tshig gi khar las pa zhig yin na ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung las sems can skye ba'am /
translated: but are inherently infinite because of the absence of sentient beings.

original: 'gag par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If infinite sentient beings were a verbal offense, then sentient beings would arise or cease due to the speech of the Tathāgata.

original: 'di ltar de ltar yang ma gyur te de'i phyir sems can mtha' yas pa tshig las gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽koo shi ka rnam grangs des na sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te bshad pa 'di la sems can zhig bstan na ni de na de yod pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis
analyzed: 'di ltar de ltar yang ma gyur te de'i phyir sems can mtha' yas pa tshig las gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // koo shi ka rnam grangs des na sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te bshad pa 'di la sems can zhig bstan na ni de na de yod pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis
translated: Thus, it is not so, and therefore, sentient beings are not finite. This is the meaning.

original: kyang yod par 'gyur na de gnyis kyang ma bstan pas pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyang yod par 'gyur na de gnyis kyang ma bstan pas pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Kauśika, by this approach, you should know that the perfection of wisdom is infinite because sentient beings are infinite. This is saying, if in this explanation a sentient being were to be taught, then because it would exist there, the two extremes would also exist. But since those two are not taught, this perfection is infinite.

original: gang gi phyir sems can ma bstan pa de'i phyir sems can med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can ma bstan pa de'i phyir sems can med do //
translated: Because a sentient being is not taught, therefore, a sentient being does not exist.

original: de med pas mtha' gnyis kyang med do //
analyzed: de med pas mtha' gnyis kyang med do //
translated: Because that does not exist, the two extremes also do not exist.

original: de bas na sems can ma bstan pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na sems can ma bstan pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mtha' yas pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, because a sentient being is not taught, this perfection is said to be infinite. This is the meaning.

original: chos gang la yang dmigs su ma mchis kyang /
analyzed: chos gang la yang dmigs su ma mchis kyang /
translated: Although no phenomena are apprehended,

original: theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa yang mchis te zhes bya ba ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa yang mchis te zhes bya ba ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: the three vehicles are also set forth.🔽Although the Tathāgata is not apprehended apart from the perfection of generosity,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med ces bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid do ;
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na yang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med ces bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid do ;
translated: the Tathāgata is the essence of the Buddha qualities in the dharmakāya.

original: / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang de la slob pa ni don dam par sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa la bye brag med pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do zhes brjod par bya'o
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang de la slob pa ni don dam par sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa la bye brag med pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do zhes brjod par bya'o
translated: The bodhisattvas train in that, and ultimately it is the essence of the Buddha qualities. Therefore, because there is no distinction between the bodhisattva and the Tathāgata, it should be said that they are the Tathāgata.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: byang chub @182b sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la gsar du slob pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang ma bral bar gzigs nas /
analyzed: byang chub @182b sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la gsar du slob pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang ma bral bar gzigs nas /
translated: In order to teach that bodhisattvas who are newly training in the qualities of the Buddha are the essence of the qualities of the Buddha, the Tathagata Dipankara saw that they are not separate from the qualities of the Buddha.🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs par lung bstan to zhes mar me mdzad kyi dpe bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par lung bstan to zhes mar me mdzad kyi dpe bstan to //
translated: The example of Dipankara was taught in order to show that bodhisattvas who are newly training in the qualities of a buddha are the very essence of the qualities of a buddha, since the Tathagata Dipankara saw that he was not separate from the qualities of a buddha.🔽Then those sons of gods said to the Lord:

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba ni mar me mdzad kyis lung bstan pa thob pas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba ni mar me mdzad kyis lung bstan pa thob pas /
translated: Having attained the prophecy of Dipankara, they said,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzugs mi len mi 'dor ba'i tshul dang zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa ni ngo mtshar🔽to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzugs mi len mi 'dor ba'i tshul dang zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa ni ngo mtshar🔽to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “Lord, it is amazing how this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings does not take up or abandon form, and so on up to how it does not take up or abandon the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la khyad par du 'phags pa dang / ngan pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir len pa dang 'dor ba gnyis kyang med do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la khyad par du 'phags pa dang / ngan pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir len pa dang 'dor ba gnyis kyang med do //
translated: Because there are no superior or inferior things in phenomena such as form, there is neither grasping nor rejection.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sngon ma byung ba yongs su 'dzin pa de ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sngon ma byung ba yongs su 'dzin pa de ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: However, it is amazing that one should take up the omniscience of all aspects that has not arisen before. This is the meaning.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor bzhi po dge slong dang dge slong ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor bzhi po dge slong dang dge slong ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: Then the Lord, beginning with the four assemblies of monks and nuns, etc., has set forth the perfection of wisdom that is to be explained.

original: 'di man chad ni don gyi bdag nyid kyi chos bshad pa 'di'i yon tan gyi phan yon tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la 'byung ba dang / bsod nams mang po 'phel ba'i rgyur gyur pa ston to //
analyzed: 'di man chad ni don gyi bdag nyid kyi chos bshad pa 'di'i yon tan gyi phan yon tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la 'byung ba dang / bsod nams mang po 'phel ba'i rgyur gyur pa ston to //
translated: From here on, the qualities and benefits of this Dharma teaching on the nature of reality are shown to arise in this life and the next, and to be the cause for the increase of much merit.

original: stong pa nyid shin tu byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis rgyu mthun pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid shin tu byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis rgyu mthun pa nyid ston te /
translated: The phrase he becomes well-perfumed with emptiness indicates the natural outcome of the perfume of emptiness.

original: de la 'jig rten pa thams cad stong par snang la /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa thams cad stong par snang la /
translated: In this regard, all mundane things appear as empty.

original: bdag kyang stong par snang ngo //
analyzed: bdag kyang stong par snang ngo //
translated: And the self also appears as empty.

original: 'dir ji ltar na stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid la glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ba ston to //
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar na stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid la glags rnyed par mi 'gyur ba ston to //
translated: Here it is shown how emptiness cannot be undermined by emptiness.

original: gang gis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i las kyis so //🔽gang du glags rnyed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sa'i steng ngam /
analyzed: gang gis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i las kyis so // gang du glags rnyed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sa'i steng ngam /
translated: The phrase by which one could be undermined refers to evil actions.

original: lha yul du'o //
analyzed: lha yul du'o //
translated: The phrase where one could be undermined refers to the earth or the heavens.

original: gang la glags rnyed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la ste /
analyzed: gang la glags rnyed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la ste /
translated: The phrase by which one could be undermined refers to the bodhisattva.

original: 'di ltar de dag thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all of these are non-existent.

original: 'dir ni gzhung brda phrad sla bas ma @183a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhung brda phrad sla bas ma @183a * //
translated: Here the text is easy to understand.

original: brgya byin la gtad pa dang / lha dang lha ma yin g-yul sprod pa'i dpe brjod pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi phan yon bstan pa dang / rig sngags chen mo dang / rig sngags bla na med pa dang / rig sngags mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i ming smos pa dang /

translated: The great knowledge mantra, the unsurpassed knowledge mantra, and the knowledge mantra equal to the unequalled are mentioned.

original: de dag gi rgyu ston te /

original: pa'i phyir rig sngags bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir rig sngags bla na med pa'o //
translated: Because there is nothing higher than it, it is the unsurpassed knowledge mantra.

original: bdag dang mnyam pa med pa'i phyir rig sngags mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang mnyam pa med pa'i phyir rig sngags mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dpe brjod pas dkar po'i chos thams cad rab tu 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / thabs mkhas pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / yang tshe 'di'i yon tan rnams dang / dug dang / me dang / mtshon dang / chu dang nad kyi dbang gis 'chi ba'i dus mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dpe brjod pas dkar po'i chos thams cad rab tu 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / thabs mkhas pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / yang tshe 'di'i yon tan rnams dang / dug dang / me dang / mtshon dang / chu dang nad kyi dbang gis 'chi ba'i dus mi byed pa dang /
translated: By the example of the moon-disk, all bright dharmas become the cause of arising, the cause of skillful means, and again the qualities of this life, and not dying by the power of poison, fire, weapons, water, and illness.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor gyi 'tshe ba med pa dang / dkar po'i chos thams cad dang mi 'bral ba dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dags su skye ba dang / dbang po ma tshang ba dang /

translated: There is no harm in the royal palace, not being separated from all bright dharmas, and not being born in the hells, animal realm, or ghost realm, with incomplete faculties,

original: yan lag ma tshang ba dang / rigs dma' bar skye ba med pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byed kyis brgyan pa'i lus su 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang /

translated: The benefits of those qualities are taught: not being born in a place lacking the conditions [for practice], not being born in a low caste, having a body adorned with the major and minor marks, being born in a buddhafield, going to a buddhafield, bringing sentient beings to full maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi phan yon de dag bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi phan yon de dag bstan to //
translated: purifying a buddhafield, and so forth.

original: de nas yang kun tu rgyu ba brgya phyir dong ba dang / de'i rgyu dang / bdud phyir log pa dang / de nas yang lha thams cad kyis mchod cing bsngags pa dang / bsrung zhing bskyab par dam bcas pa dang / 'dzin pa rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ba rnams bstan to //
analyzed: de nas yang kun tu rgyu ba brgya phyir dong ba dang / de'i rgyu dang / bdud phyir log pa dang / de nas yang lha thams cad kyis mchod cing bsngags pa dang / bsrung zhing bskyab par dam bcas pa dang / 'dzin pa rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ba rnams bstan to //
translated: Then, the return of the hundred wandering mendicants, the reason for that, the return of Māra, the praise and worship of all the gods, the promise to guard and protect [the text], and the possession of supreme roots of virtue by those who uphold [the text] are taught.

original: skabs 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par 'byung ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: skabs 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par 'byung ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: Here, the perfection of wisdom is the source of the knowledge of all modes.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa las nges par byung ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu tha dad par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa las nges par byung ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu tha dad par bstan pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of all modes is the source of the perfection of wisdom. This is the teaching of the difference in the conventional.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin /
translated: The knowledge of all modes is not one thing,

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni don dam par tha dad pa med par bstan pa'o // de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nges par byung ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i sa la'o //
translated: and the perfection of wisdom another. This is the teaching of the non-difference in the ultimate.🔽Therein, the knowledge of all modes is the source of the perfection of wisdom is on the stage of the career.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las nges par byung ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol @184b tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i sa la'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the source of the knowledge of all modes is on the stage of the result.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is not one thing,🔽and the perfection of wisdom is not another.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni gnyi gar yang chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni gnyi gar yang chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i 'og tu kun dga' bos zhus pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kun dga' bos zhus pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi thog mar 'gro ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: After that, Ananda asked, and the perfection of wisdom is the forerunner of all the Buddha dharmas.🔽Ananda, it is dedicated to the knowledge of all aspects by way of non-duality.

original: kun dga' bo gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngos pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sbyin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de'i tshe sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /

translated: When generosity is dedicated to the knowledge of all aspects, at that time the perfection of generosity

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bras bu'i sa la tha dad pa med cing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bras bu'i sa la tha dad pa med cing /
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects are undifferentiated on the resultant stage,

original: gnyis su med par so sor brtags te /
analyzed: gnyis su med par so sor brtags te /

original: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs ni len pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs ni len pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The conceptually differentiated form is ungraspable in the sense of being ungraspable.🔽That which is nondual is nonapprehensible.

original: gnyis su med pa gang yin pa de dmigs su med pa'o zhes bya ba la gnyis su med pa ni yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa gang yin pa de dmigs su med pa'o zhes bya ba la gnyis su med pa ni yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: The nondual is the perfected.

original: dmigs shing kun brtags pas mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs shing kun brtags pas mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not apprehended and does not become the object of imagination.

original: gang dmigs su med pa de len pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang dmigs su med pa de len pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is nonapprehensible is ungraspable.

original: gang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ba de rnam par rtog pa'i yid la byed pas nye bar len par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ba de rnam par rtog pa'i yid la byed pas nye bar len par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one does not appropriate by mental construction.🔽Then, the immeasurable qualities of the perfection of wisdom, the cause of the immeasurable aggregates of morality, etc.,

original: de nas yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa tshad med pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa zil gyis gnod pa dang /
analyzed: de nas yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa dang / tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa tshad med pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa zil gyis gnod pa dang /
translated: the surpassing of the aggregates of morality, etc., of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,🔽the vow of Śakra to protect, guard, and shield,

original: brgya byin gyis bsrung zhing bskyab pa dang sba par dam bcas pa dang / lha rnams spobs pa bsgrub pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du sems zhum pa med pa dang / @185a * //
analyzed: brgya byin gyis bsrung zhing bskyab pa dang sba par dam bcas pa dang / lha rnams spobs pa bsgrub pa dang / 'khor gyi nang du sems zhum pa med pa dang / @185a * //
translated: the establishment of eloquence in the gods, the absence of mental lassitude in the assembly,

original: klan ka tshol ba med pa dang / sems zhum pa la sogs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad dga' ba dang / chos nyid rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / lha thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: klan ka tshol ba med pa dang / sems zhum pa la sogs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad dga' ba dang / chos nyid rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / lha thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa dang /
translated: the absence of seeking to find fault, the absence of mental depression and so on, the delight of all worlds, the uninterrupted continuity of reality, all gods upholding the perfection of wisdom,

original: de dag la chos sbyin pa dang / lha de dag rnams kyis bsrung ba dang / lha rnams 'ong ba'i rtags dang / lha ngan pa rnams 'dod pa dang / rgya chen po la mos pa dang / sa phyogs mchod par 'gyur ba dang / lus bde ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: de dag la chos sbyin pa dang / lha de dag rnams kyis bsrung ba dang / lha rnams 'ong ba'i rtags dang / lha ngan pa rnams 'dod pa dang / rgya chen po la mos pa dang / sa phyogs mchod par 'gyur ba dang / lus bde ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dang /
translated: the gift of Dharma to them, the protection of those gods, the signs of the coming of gods, the desire of evil gods, the aspiration for the vast, the worship of the regions, the arising of physical bliss and so on,

original: snyom pa la sogs pa med pa dang // rmi lam bzang po rmi ba dang / lus la gzi mdangs 'jug pa dang / rkyen rnams pa bzhi la ma chags pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su sangs rgyas thams cad la rkyen rnam pa bzhis mchod pa dang /
analyzed: snyom pa la sogs pa med pa dang // rmi lam bzang po rmi ba dang / lus la gzi mdangs 'jug pa dang / rkyen rnams pa bzhi la ma chags pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su sangs rgyas thams cad la rkyen rnam pa bzhis mchod pa dang /
translated: the absence of laziness and so on, the dreaming of good dreams, the infusion of radiance into the body, the non-attachment to the four conditions, and the worship of all buddhas in the world systems of the ten directions by means of the four conditions.

original: rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten byas te mchod pa bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba la sogs pa ma byas par rim gro tsam 'ga' zhig byas pa'i bsod nams che ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis yongs su bkang ba bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa bsod nams che ba dang /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyi mchod rten byas te mchod pa bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzung ba la sogs pa ma byas par rim gro tsam 'ga' zhig byas pa'i bsod nams che ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'dzam bu'i gling de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis yongs su bkang ba bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa bsod nams che ba dang /
translated: The merit of someone who has taken up the perfection of wisdom is greater than the merit of Śakra, Lord of the Gods, who has filled Jambudvīpa with the relics of the Tathāgata.

original: de'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: The cause of that is taught.

original: skabs 'dir / koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gzung du med pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs 'dir / koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gzung du med pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this context, “Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom is ungraspable” is because it is not graspable by the mental consciousness.

original: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gis bstan mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gis bstan mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is invisible” is because it cannot be shown by words.

original: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pas yul gyi thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pas yul gyi thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: “Unimpeded” means that it is not impeded by objects, because it is not an object of sense consciousness.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Having a single characteristic, which is the absence of characteristics” means that it is free from the signs of all imagined characteristics.

original: 'dzin pa'i phyir ram mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yang gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzung bar bya ba dang / gzung bar mi bya bar rnam par brtags pa'i 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'grib pa'i phyir ma yin 'phel ba'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba ni nag po'i phyogs kyi chos spang ba'am /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyir ram mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yang gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzung bar bya ba dang / gzung bar mi bya bar rnam par brtags pa'i 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro // 'grib pa'i phyir ma yin 'phel ba'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba ni nag po'i phyogs kyi chos spang ba'am /
translated: “It does not abide in order to be apprehended or not to be apprehended” means that it is not suitable to be imagined as something to be apprehended or as something not to be apprehended.🔽“It does not abide in order to decrease or increase” means that it does not abide in order to abandon the qualities of the dark side

original: dkar po'i @185b phyogs kyi chos spel ba'i phyir gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i @185b phyogs kyi chos spel ba'i phyir gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: or in order to increase the qualities of the bright side.

original: dbri ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: dbri ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: “It does not abide in order to be diminished or augmented.”

original: bsnan pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i chos bsal ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos bsgrub pa'i phyir gnas pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsnan pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i chos bsal ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos bsgrub pa'i phyir gnas pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not for the purpose of adding anything, that is, it does not stand for the purpose of eliminating the phenomena of cyclic life or establishing the phenomena of nirvana.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de na de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa thams cad med pa'i phyir ste /
analyzed: de na de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa thams cad med pa'i phyir ste /
translated: Because in that state there is no attachment to any conceptualization whatsoever.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to everything else.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su nye bar gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i tshul du gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su nye bar gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i tshul du gnas par gyur na /
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not stand in duality, that is, if it were to stand in the manner of grasping and not grasping,

original: de lta na ni gnyis kyi bdag nyid dang / tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du gnas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na ni gnyis kyi bdag nyid dang / tha dad pa'i bdag nyid du gnas par 'gyur na /
translated: then it would stand in the nature of duality and the nature of difference.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de don dam par gcig cing tha dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de don dam par gcig cing tha dad pa med pa'o //
translated: But in that way, that perfection of wisdom is ultimately one and not different.

original: de bas na de la 'di lta bur spyod pa'i spros pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na de la 'di lta bur spyod pa'i spros pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is no conceptual elaboration of conduct in that way.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa yang don dam pa'i gnas skabs su gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid de tha dad pa med pas gnyis su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa yang don dam pa'i gnas skabs su gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid de tha dad pa med pas gnyis su med do //
translated: Likewise, generosity, morality, and so forth are of one nature in the context of ultimate reality, and since they are not different, they are nondual.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: koo shi ka de bzhin nyid la gnyis su 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin nyid la gnyis su 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Kauśika, it is just that suchness is asserted to be dual.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid du gcig ste gnyis su med par gnas pa'o //🔽chos bzang lha'i 'dun sa'i dpe brjod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad ni de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid du gcig ste gnyis su med par gnas pa'o // chos bzang lha'i 'dun sa'i dpe brjod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba /
translated: All of those, such as the perfection of wisdom, are one in the nature of suchness, abiding without duality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gdung bstan to //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rtags med pa dang ; brjod du med pa la sogs pas spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gdung bstan to // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rtags med pa dang ; brjod du med pa la sogs pas spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: The example of the assembly of the gods in the Good Dharma Heaven, and the relics of all the tathāgatas that arise from the perfection of wisdom are taught.

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is signless because it is free from all elaborations, being without signs, inexpressible, and so forth.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir rtags med pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir rtags med pa'o //
translated: It is without signs because it is free from its own characteristics.

original: tshig gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir brjod du med pa'o //
translated: It is inexpressible because it is not the domain of words.

original: sgra'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir smos su med par ro //
analyzed: sgra'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir smos su med par ro //
translated: It is not to be spoken because it is not the nature of sound.

original: so so rang gis rig pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable because it is individually self-cognized.

original: de'i 'og tu ngan 'gro thams cad dang theg pa dman pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa med pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis yongs su bkang ba bas kyang @186a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ngan 'gro thams cad dang theg pa dman pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa med pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis yongs su bkang ba bas kyang @186a * //
translated: After that, it is superior to the intention of the lower vehicles and so forth, and to filling the trichiliocosm with the relics of the Tathagata.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa bsod nams che ba dang / de'i rgyu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis su med pa dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis chos rnam pa bcu gnyis bshad pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa bsod nams che ba dang / de'i rgyu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis su med pa dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis chos rnam pa bcu gnyis bshad pa dang /
translated: The merit of upholding the perfection of wisdom is greater, and the cause of that, the non-duality of the Tathagata and the perfection of wisdom, and the explanation of the twelve aspects of the Dharma by all the Buddhas of the ten directions.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa klog pa gnyis mtshungs pa dang / phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod pa mtshungs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa klog pa gnyis mtshungs pa dang / phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mchod pa mtshungs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa dang /
translated: the equality of the stage of irreversibility and the stage of a buddha,🔽the example of a man who is the owner of wealth who is frightened by a debtor,🔽the attainment of the nature of complete nirvana, the example of a great precious jewel,

original: skyes bu nor gyi bdag po bu lon pa'i 'jigs skrag pa'i dpe brjod pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos nyid 'thob pa dang / nor bu rin po che chen po'i dpe brjod pa dang / yang 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis yongs su bkang ba bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa bsod nams che ba dang /
analyzed: skyes bu nor gyi bdag po bu lon pa'i 'jigs skrag pa'i dpe brjod pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos nyid 'thob pa dang / nor bu rin po che chen po'i dpe brjod pa dang / yang 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis yongs su bkang ba bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa bsod nams che ba dang /
translated: and again, the great merit of upholding the perfection of wisdom compared to filling with the relics of the tathagatas as many world systems as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river,

original: de'i rgyu dang / chos kyi sku dang gzugs kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku rnams mthong ba ston te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang / chos kyi sku dang gzugs kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku rnams mthong ba ston te /
translated: and the cause of that, the seeing of the dharmakaya, the rupakaya, and the jnanakaya are shown.

original: ye shes kyi sku ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The body of intuition is the collection of intuition.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang / bcas pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang / bcas pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The reality of compounded things is the nature of the intuition that is associated with conceptual discrimination.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni brjod du med pa don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni brjod du med pa don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid do //
translated: The reality of uncompounded things is the inexpressible nature of the ultimate, which is the uncompounded reality.

original: theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan te de dag mtshan ma med pa'i tshul dang skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i tshul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyan thos rnams kyis 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su mya ngan las 'das pa las dgongs te gsungs so //🔽don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol lam /
analyzed: theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan te de dag mtshan ma med pa'i tshul dang skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i tshul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyan thos rnams kyis 'bras bu'i gnas skabs su mya ngan las 'das pa las dgongs te gsungs so // don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol lam /
translated: The three vehicles are extensively taught, and they are taught in terms of the way of signlessness, the way of non-production and non-cessation, and so on.

original: tshu rol ma yin thang ma yin /
analyzed: tshu rol ma yin thang ma yin /
translated: The ultimate perfection of wisdom is neither a far shore nor a near shore, nor a middle.

original: gshong ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa don dam par yang yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs na de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa dang mtshan ma med pa'i phyir de skad bshad do //
analyzed: gshong ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa don dam par yang yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs na de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa dang mtshan ma med pa'i phyir de skad bshad do //
translated: The phrase not a valley, and so on, is explained because in the state of ultimate establishment, there are no such conceptual thoughts and signs.🔽Śakra said, Blessed One, thus this perfection of wisdom is a great perfection.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo ste zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyi @186b pha rol tu phyin pa la bsams te smras pa'o //
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo ste zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyi @186b pha rol tu phyin pa la bsams te smras pa'o //
translated: This is said with the intention of the perfection of the nature of wisdom.

original: de ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa yid la byed pas mi mthong ste yul che bas nam mkha' dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa yid la byed pas mi mthong ste yul che bas nam mkha' dang mtshungs so //
translated: It is not seen by the mental activity of not observing all phenomena, and because its object is great, it is equal to space.

original: shing ljon pa'i dpe la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shing lta bu'o //
analyzed: shing ljon pa'i dpe la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shing lta bu'o //
translated: In the example of the tree, the perfection of wisdom is like the tree.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams ni grib ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams ni grib ma lta bu'o //
translated: The others are like the shade.

original: bdag gis mchod pa bas kyang gzhan la byin pa 'bras bu che ba ston to //
analyzed: bdag gis mchod pa bas kyang gzhan la byin pa 'bras bu che ba ston to //
translated: It shows that giving to others is more fruitful than one's own worship.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i sku bshig ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung du byin gyis brlabs so zhes bya ba 'dis ni bgo bsha' byas pa 'bras bu che ba bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i sku bshig ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung du byin gyis brlabs so zhes bya ba 'dis ni bgo bsha' byas pa 'bras bu che ba bstan to //
translated: This is the great fruit of the distribution.

original: gzhan dag gi drung du song ste bshad ces bya bas ni ston pa'i byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi drung du song ste bshad ces bya bas ni ston pa'i byed pa bstan to //
translated: Having gone to others, he taught, shows the activity of teaching.

original: chos gang zhig la bdag gis rim gro dang bkur sti dang bsti stang dang mchod pa byas te bsten cing gnas par bya snyam na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mchod pa mdzad na /
analyzed: chos gang zhig la bdag gis rim gro dang bkur sti dang bsti stang dang mchod pa byas te bsten cing gnas par bya snyam na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mchod pa mdzad na /
translated: If I should serve, attend, honor, and worship any dharma, and abide in dependence on it, shows that the Tathagata also worships this perfection of wisdom,

original: de las gzhan pa lta ci smos zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa lta ci smos zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: let alone others.

original: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pa'am /
translated: Kausika, a son or daughter of good family who has set out in the vehicle of the Disciples

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pas zhes bya ba'i 'gres 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad kyi rgyu'i gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la yang dag par zhugs pas zhes bya ba'i 'gres 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad kyi rgyu'i gtso bo yin te /
translated: This verse shows that the perfection of wisdom is the principal cause of all, since it is the cause of the three vehicles.

original: de bas na mchod par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //🔽de'i 'og tu 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa bas sems can gcig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gzhag pa bsod nams kyi 'bras bu che bar bstan pa'i 'gres dang / des yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad dgra bcom pa dang rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa glegs bam du byas te byin pa bsod nams che ba'i 'gres kyis bsod nams mang du bstan pa 'phel
analyzed: de bas na mchod par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o // de'i 'og tu 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa bas sems can gcig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gzhag pa bsod nams kyi 'bras bu che bar bstan pa'i 'gres dang / des yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad dgra bcom pa dang rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa glegs bam du byas te byin pa bsod nams che ba'i 'gres kyis bsod nams mang du bstan pa 'phel
translated: Therefore, it is to be worshipped.

original: ba bstan nas /
analyzed: ba bstan nas /
translated: After that, the verse shows the increase of merit by the verse that shows the great fruit of merit of establishing one being in the fruit of stream-enterer, compared to establishing all the beings of Jambudvipa in the ten virtuous actions, and by the verse that shows the great merit of giving the perfection of wisdom written in a book, compared to establishing all the beings of Jambudvipa in the fruit of arhatship and in individual enlightenment.

original: de'i rgyus zag pa med pa'i chos bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i gang zag khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad mngon pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag mngon pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / de nas yang gling bzhi pa dang /
analyzed: de'i rgyus zag pa med pa'i chos bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i gang zag khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad mngon pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag mngon pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / de nas yang gling bzhi pa dang /
translated: Then, the merit of establishing all sentient beings in the four continents,

original: stong gcig dang / stong @187a * //
analyzed: stong gcig dang / stong @187a * //
translated: in a world system of a thousand worlds,

original: gnyis dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dgra bcom pa dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa glegs bam du byas te byin pa bsod nams che ba'i 'gres dang /
analyzed: gnyis dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dgra bcom pa dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa glegs bam du byas te byin pa bsod nams che ba'i 'gres dang /
translated: in a world system of a thousand times a thousand worlds, in a world system of a thousand times a thousand times a thousand worlds, and in the world systems of the ten directions, up to the level of an arhat and a pratyekabuddha, is far surpassed by the merit of giving the perfection of wisdom written out in book form.

original: de'i rgyus zag pa med pa'i chos bstan pa'i 'gres dang / 'jig rten pa'i gang zag khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad mngon pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag mngon pa'i rgyur gyur pa bstan pa'i 'gres dang / de'i 'og tu bsod nams mang du bstan pa dang /
analyzed: de'i rgyus zag pa med pa'i chos bstan pa'i 'gres dang / 'jig rten pa'i gang zag khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad mngon pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag mngon pa'i rgyur gyur pa bstan pa'i 'gres dang / de'i 'og tu bsod nams mang du bstan pa dang /
translated: The repetition of the teaching of the uncontaminated dharmas by that cause, and the repetition of the teaching of the cause of the manifest exalted persons of the world and the cause of the manifest exalted persons, and after that, the teaching of much merit,

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gtso bor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gtso bor bstan pa'o //
translated: and the teaching of proper mental attention as primary.

original: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni 'di yin te /🔽gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med par kun tu spyod pa'i blos 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni 'di yin te / gnyis la spyod pa ma yin pa'i blos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med par kun tu spyod pa'i blos 'jug pa ni /
translated: Among those, this is proper mental attention:

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The statement “with a mind that does not engage in duality, one takes up the perfection of wisdom” is the statement “the engagement with a mind that engages in nonduality is called proper mental attention.”🔽This is the meaning.

original: de'i 'og tu bsod nams mang du 'phel ba'i 'gres dang / don bstan pa gtso bo yin par ston te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsod nams mang du 'phel ba'i 'gres dang / don bstan pa gtso bo yin par ston te /
translated: After that, the repetition of the increase of much merit, and the teaching of the primary teaching of the meaning,

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the perfection of wisdom is as follows.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su blta ba ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su blta ba ma yin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not to be viewed as dual,🔽and it is not to be viewed as nondual.🔽This is the nonconceptual perfection of wisdom, because it is free from conceptualization about all phenomena.

original: gnyis su med par blta ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya bar yang mi rtog
analyzed: gnyis su med par blta ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya bar yang mi rtog
translated: It is not even conceptualized as having the nature of nonduality,

original: na / gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid du lta ci smos te /
analyzed: na / gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid du lta ci smos te /
translated: let alone having the nature of duality.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de gnyis kyi tshul du yang mi blta /
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de gnyis kyi tshul du yang mi blta /
translated: Therefore, that perfection of wisdom is not to be viewed as a method of duality,

original: gnyis su med pa'i tshul du yang mi blta zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i tshul du yang mi blta zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and it is not to be viewed as a method of nonduality.

original: de la mtshan mar ma yin /
analyzed: de la mtshan mar ma yin /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: mtshan ma med par ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas skabs bcu bzhir rnam par rtog pa bcu bzhi med par ston te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med par ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas skabs bcu bzhir rnam par rtog pa bcu bzhi med par ston te /
translated: In the phrase “not as a sign, not as signless,” and so on, the absence of the fourteen conceptualizations in the fourteen situations is taught.

original: dmigs pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / shes bya'i don rab tu dbye ba dang / gnas gyur pa dang / de kho na'i don 'dzin pa dang / sa nas sa gzhan du 'phar ba dang / sa gzhan dang sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / shes bya'i don rab tu dbye ba dang / gnas gyur pa dang / de kho na'i don 'dzin pa dang / sa nas sa gzhan du 'phar ba dang / sa gzhan dang sgrub pa dang /
translated: The object, the maturation of action, the classification of objects of knowledge, the transformation of the basis, the apprehension of the meaning of reality, the leap from one stage to another, the practice of the stages,

original: yid la byed @187b pa dang / spong ba dang / rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa dang / de bzhin nyid sgom pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la ste /🔽de la dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i mtshan ma rnams mi 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid la byed @187b pa dang / spong ba dang / rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa dang / de bzhin nyid sgom pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la ste / de la dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i mtshan ma rnams mi 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: the mental activity, the abandonment, the realization, the manifestation of reality, the meditation on suchness, and nirvana.

original: mtshan mar ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan mar ma yin /
translated: At the time of apprehending the object, there is no apprehension of the imagined characteristics of form and so on, and there is also no conception that thinks, “There is no characteristic” or “There is no absence of characteristic.”🔽Therefore it is said, “It is not a characteristic.”

original: mtshan ma med par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: And it is said, “It is not a non-characteristic.”

original: de bzhin du las kyi dus na yang srid par bya ba'i phyir blang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: de bzhin du las kyi dus na yang srid par bya ba'i phyir blang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: Similarly, at the time of action, there is no conception of adopting something in order to bring about existence.

original: rnam par smin pa'i dus na yang 'gro ba rnams su dor ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir blang bar ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i dus na yang 'gro ba rnams su dor ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir blang bar ma yin /
translated: And at the time of its full maturation, there is no conceptualization of beings to be cast off, so it is not cast off.

original: dor bar ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dor bar ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said that it is not diminished and not augmented.

original: de bzhin du shes par bya ba'i chos rnams rab tu 'byed pa'i tshe yang yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa med pas dbri ba med la med pa'i dngos po la sgro 'dogs pa med pas bsnan pa med pa'i phyir dbri bar ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes par bya ba'i chos rnams rab tu 'byed pa'i tshe yang yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa med pas dbri ba med la med pa'i dngos po la sgro 'dogs pa med pas bsnan pa med pa'i phyir dbri bar ma yin /
translated: Likewise, when the phenomena to be understood are distinguished, there is no diminution because there is no denial of existent things, and there is no augmentation because there is no reification of nonexistent things.

original: bsnan par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bsnan par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said that it is not diminished and not augmented.

original: de bzhin du so so skye bo'i gnas kyi tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so skye bo'i gnas kyi tshe /
translated: Likewise, when one is in the state of an ordinary being,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa med la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir / kun nas nyon mongs pa med la /
translated: the essence of the tathagatas is not defiled because it is naturally pure.

original: gnas gyur pa'i tshe yang nam mkha' bzhin du sngon ma byung ba'i rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i tshe yang nam mkha' bzhin du sngon ma byung ba'i rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: And when it has been transformed, there is no purification that was not there before, just as in the case of space.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par ma yin /
translated: Thus it is said that it is not defiled and not purified.

original: rnam par byang bar ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is not purified.

original: de bzhin du shes bya'i de kho na nyid yongs su brtags pa'i tshe dang / chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa'i phyir chos nyid la skye ba dang / 'gag pa ma mthong bas /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes bya'i de kho na nyid yongs su brtags pa'i tshe dang / chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa'i phyir chos nyid la skye ba dang / 'gag pa ma mthong bas /
translated: Similarly, when the reality of the object of knowledge is investigated, and when all phenomena are seen not to arise and not to cease,

original: skye bar ma yin 'gag par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: skye bar ma yin 'gag par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “It is not arisen and it is not ceased.”

original: sa 'og ma nas sa gong mar 'phar ba'i tshe yang don dam par sa gong mar rtogs pa'i chos khyad par du 'phags pa yang mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: sa 'og ma nas sa gong mar 'phar ba'i tshe yang don dam par sa gong mar rtogs pa'i chos khyad par du 'phags pa yang mi 'dzin la /
translated: When one ascends from a lower to a higher level, ultimately one does not grasp the superior qualities realized on the higher level,

original: sa 'og mar rtogs pa'i chos ngan pa yongs su gtong ba yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa 'og mar rtogs pa'i chos ngan pa yongs su gtong ba yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: and one does not abandon the inferior qualities realized on the lower level.

original: gzung bar ma yin mi gzung bar ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gzung bar ma yin mi gzung bar ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “It is not grasped and it is not ungrasped.”

original: de bzhin du sa gong ma la gnas par bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa gong ma la gnas par bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med cing /
translated: Similarly, there is no thought of abiding on the higher levels,

original: sa 'og ma la gnas par mi bya ba'i rnam par @188a * //
analyzed: sa 'og ma la gnas par mi bya ba'i rnam par @188a * //
translated: and there is no thought of not abiding on the lower levels.

original: rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said,🔽“It is not to be abided in and it is not not to be abided in.”

original: gnas pa dang mi gnas pa gnyi ga yang kun brtags pa tsam du zad pas /
analyzed: gnas pa dang mi gnas pa gnyi ga yang kun brtags pa tsam du zad pas /
translated: Since both abiding and non-abiding are mere conceptual imputations,

original: de'i phyir gnas par ma yin mi gnas par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas par ma yin mi gnas par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: therefore, it is said, “not abiding and not non-abiding.”

original: de bzhin du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgrub pa la sbyor ba na sgrub pa de la 'di ni yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgrub pa la sbyor ba na sgrub pa de la 'di ni yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
translated: Similarly, when one is engaged in accomplishing śamatha and vipaśyanā, because there is no conceptualization that thinks, “This is correct accomplishment,”

original: 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgrub pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgrub pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: and “This is incorrect accomplishment,”

original: yang dag par ma yin log par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag par ma yin log par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “not correct and not incorrect.”

original: de bzhin du de nyid la yang dag pa'i yid la byed pas mngon par brtson pa'i tshe yang 'di ni rigs pas bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid la yang dag pa'i yid la byed pas mngon par brtson pa'i tshe yang 'di ni rigs pas bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, when one is striving with correct mental attention on that very [path], because there is no arising of conceptualization that thinks, “This is mental attention generated by reasoning,”

original: 'di ni mi rigs pas bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir /🔽rigs par ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs pas bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir / rigs par ma yin /
translated: and “This is generated by non-reasoning,”🔽it is said, “not by reasoning

original: mi rigs par ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mi rigs par ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: and not by non-reasoning.”

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len rnams spong ba na nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa phra mo rim gyis spong yang de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len rnams spong ba na nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa phra mo rim gyis spong yang de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, when the negative tendencies of the class of afflictive obstructions and the class of obstructions to omniscience are eliminated, the subtle afflictive thoughts are gradually eliminated, but such thoughts do not occur.

original: bag tsam ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bag tsam ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said, “not a little.”

original: de bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa'i tshe yang don dam pa de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid las sa'i rim kun tu 'gro ba'i don dang mchog gi don dang rgyu mthun pa'i don dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa med pa'i don dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa'i tshe yang don dam pa de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid las sa'i rim kun tu 'gro ba'i don dang mchog gi don dang rgyu mthun pa'i don dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa med pa'i don dang /
translated: Likewise, when thoroughly comprehending, from the perspective of ultimate suchness, the meaning of the stages of the levels, the meaning of omnipresence, the meaning of supremacy, the meaning of natural outcome, the meaning of the absence of affliction and purification,

original: dman pa med pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i don ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pas cha shas kyis rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i tshe yang de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dman pa med pa dang / lhag ma med pa'i don ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rim pas cha shas kyis rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i tshe yang de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: the meaning of the absence of inferiority and the absence of remainder, and so on, when thoroughly comprehending by means of parts, such thoughts do not occur.

original: cha shas su ma yin /
analyzed: cha shas su ma yin /
translated: Therefore it is said, “not in parts.”

original: cha shas med par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: cha shas med par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He says, “Not without parts.”

original: chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i tshe yang chos nyid rab tu rdzogs par byed pa na chos kyi rnam pa dang chos ma yin par rnam par brtags na gtan gyi dngos po'i bdag nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir /🔽chos su ma yin /
analyzed: chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i tshe yang chos nyid rab tu rdzogs par byed pa na chos kyi rnam pa dang chos ma yin par rnam par brtags na gtan gyi dngos po'i bdag nyid du mi snang ba'i phyir / chos su ma yin /
translated: When one makes the reality of things directly evident, when one makes the reality of things completely evident, then, when one examines what is and is not a dharma, one does not see anything that is the essence of a real thing.🔽He says, “Not as a dharma.”

original: chos ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: chos ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: “Not as a non-dharma.”

original: de bzhin nyid sgom pa'i tshe yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'am gzhan no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid sgom pa'i tshe yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'am gzhan no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: When one meditates on reality, one does not think, “It is like this” or “It is like that.”

original: de bzhin nyid du ma @188b yin de bzhin nyid ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du ma @188b yin de bzhin nyid ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He says, “Not as reality” and “Not as unreal.”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe yang yang dag pa'i don gyi mtha'o zhes bya ba de las bzlog pa'o zhes bya bar 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe yang yang dag pa'i don gyi mtha'o zhes bya ba de las bzlog pa'o zhes bya bar 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: When one attains nirvana, one does not grasp it as the limit of real meaning or as the opposite of that.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ma yin yang dag pa'i mtha' ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ma yin yang dag pa'i mtha' ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The limit of reality is not the limit of reality, and is not not the limit of reality.

original: 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i don to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis su med pa'i don to zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the meaning of nonduality.

original: don ces bya ba 'di ni brjod par bya ba'i rnam grangs dang / dmigs pa'i rnam grangs te /
analyzed: don ces bya ba 'di ni brjod par bya ba'i rnam grangs dang / dmigs pa'i rnam grangs te /
translated: Here, the meaning is a synonym for the expressible and a synonym for the object.🔽The nonduality of this is the meaning of the perfection of wisdom that is explained, and the object of the nonconceptual perfection of wisdom.

original: gnyis su med pa 'di ni bshad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni dmigs pa'o
analyzed: gnyis su med pa 'di ni bshad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni dmigs pa'o
translated: When the meaning of the perfection of wisdom is the object,

analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba yang med pa'i phyir te /
