original: sems gang gis rjes su yi rang zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems de ni zad cing 'gags la med de rnam par 'gyur zhes bya bas ni sems gnyis phrad
analyzed: sems gang gis rjes su yi rang zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems de ni zad cing 'gags la med de rnam par 'gyur zhes bya bas ni sems gnyis phrad
translated: The mind by which one rejoices and dedicates those roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is exhausted, ceases, does not exist, and changes.

original: pa med par ston to //
analyzed: pa med par ston to //
translated: This shows that the two minds do not meet.

original: dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams byas pa'i dngos po de yang zad cing 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams byas pa'i dngos po de yang zad cing 'gag pa med de /
translated: Those things, those objects, those wholesome roots, and the merit made by rejoicing and possessing it are not exhausted and do not cease.

original: rnam par gyur pa yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po la sogs pa med par ston to //
analyzed: rnam par gyur pa yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po la sogs pa med par ston to //
translated: If they were to change, etc. shows that things, etc. do not exist.

original: ci sems kyis sems yongs su bsngo'am /
analyzed: ci sems kyis sems yongs su bsngo'am /
translated: Is the mind dedicated by the mind?🔽If the mind were to be dedicated by the mind, the mind would not touch the mind.

original: gal te sems kyis sems yongs su bsngor ni sems phrad par 'gyur ba med de zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba dang / yongs su bsngo bar bya ba gnyis med par ston to ;
analyzed: gal te sems kyis sems yongs su bsngor ni sems phrad par 'gyur ba med de zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba dang / yongs su bsngo bar bya ba gnyis med par ston to ;
translated: This shows that dedication and what is to be dedicated are nondual.🔽The nature of the mind cannot be dedicated.

original: / sems kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya bas ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems med par ston te /
analyzed: / sems kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya bas ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems med par ston te /
translated: This shows that there is no mind that is dedicated.

original: sems de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas brtags pa ste dngos po med pa ni yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya bar ston to /
analyzed: sems de dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas brtags pa ste dngos po med pa ni yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya bar ston to /
translated: This shows that since that mind is the nature of non-entityness, it is imputed, and that which is non-entityness cannot be dedicated.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes bya bar shes na zhes bya bar la sogs pa ni dngos po🔽med pa'i mtshan nyid ston to //🔽de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' byams pas btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pas theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i rjes su yi rang ba dang /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po med pa'o zhes bya bar shes na zhes bya bar la sogs pa ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid ston to // de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' byams pas btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pas theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i rjes su yi rang ba dang /
translated: If, when a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom, he knows the perfection of wisdom is non-entityness, and so on, this shows the characteristic of non-entityness.

original: yongs su bsngo ba nyis kyi ngo bo nyid dris so //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba nyis kyi ngo bo nyid dris so //
translated: Then again, the bodhisattva Maitreya, with Venerable Subhūti, how should a bodhisattva great being who has newly entered the vehicle... and so on, asked about the essence of rejoicing and dedication for one who has newly entered the vehicle.

original: yang byams pa gal te theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab kyis /
analyzed: yang byams pa gal te theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab kyis /
translated: Moreover, Maitreya, if a bodhisattva who has newly entered the vehicle, etc.

original: des kyang bslab pa'i dbang gis mi dmigs pa nyid kyi tshul gyis bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: des kyang bslab pa'i dbang gis mi dmigs pa nyid kyi tshul gyis bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: , teaches that even the beginner should practice by way of the non-apprehension of all things through the power of the precepts.

original: des bdud kyi las de dag thos nas 'grib pa'am 'phel ba med @191a * //
analyzed: des bdud kyi las de dag thos nas 'grib pa'am 'phel ba med @191a * //
translated: Having heard of those deeds of Mara, he will not decrease or increase

original: par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de dag tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de dag tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not conceptualize them.🔽He will take hold of the lineage of the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid yid la byed pa'o //
translated: because he attends to thusness.

original: de'i 'og tu spyir rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam grangs bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu spyir rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam grangs bstan nas /
translated: After that, having taught the general enumeration of the rejoicing,

original: de'i 'og tu byams pa gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lam gyi rgyun bcad pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byams pa gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lam gyi rgyun bcad pa /
translated: then, Maitreya, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has newly entered the vehicle should rejoice in the Blessed Buddhas, the Blessed Ones who have cut off the continuum of the path,

original: spros pa dang srid pa'i tshul gyis rgyun bcad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam par bshad pa'i skabs 'byed do //
analyzed: spros pa dang srid pa'i tshul gyis rgyun bcad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam par bshad pa'i skabs 'byed do //
translated: The chapter is opened by the words: The cessation of the stream of conceptual elaboration and of existence.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' byams pas de la ji ltar phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba dris pa dang / de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis yongs su bsngo ba kha na ma tho ba med pa 'gres rnam pa dgu bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' byams pas de la ji ltar phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba dris pa dang / de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis yongs su bsngo ba kha na ma tho ba med pa 'gres rnam pa dgu bstan te /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Maitreya asks how it is that one does not err in regard to that, and the Elder Subhuti then teaches nine kinds of unerring dedication.

original: de la 'du shes rnam pa drug med pas /
analyzed: de la 'du shes rnam pa drug med pas /
translated: Therein, one does not err by virtue of the absence of six kinds of discriminations.

original: phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur gyi de las gzhan du na phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gres dang po'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur gyi de las gzhan du na phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gres dang po'o //
translated: One does not err in regard to that, but one does err in any other way. This is the first permutation.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa la sems pa'i sems dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyang zad pa dang / byang chub kyang med pa dang / chos rnams kyang ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa la sems pa'i sems dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyang zad pa dang / byang chub kyang med pa dang / chos rnams kyang ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa nyid dang / yongs su bsngo ba yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: The mind that thinks of the Buddha, etc., and the mind that is dedicated are also nonexistent, and enlightenment is also nonexistent, and the dharmas are also empty of intrinsic reality, and the dedication is also nonexistent.🔽 The mind that thinks of the Buddha, etc., and the mind that is dedicated are also nonexistent, and enlightenment is also nonexistent, and the dharmas are also empty of intrinsic reality, and the dedication is also nonexistent.

original: don dam par yongs su bsngo ba med do zhes de ltar sems na mthun par yongs su bsngo ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gres gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par yongs su bsngo ba med do zhes de ltar sems na mthun par yongs su bsngo ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gres gnyis pa'o //
translated: If one thinks, “ultimately there is no dedication,” then that is a concordant dedication. This is the second permutation.

original: de nas yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i nyan thos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / sangs rgyas rnams dang / so so skye bo thams cad kyi bsod nams gang yin pa de dag la rjes su yi rang nas yongs su bsngo ba na /
analyzed: de nas yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i nyan thos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / sangs rgyas rnams dang / so so skye bo thams cad kyi bsod nams gang yin pa de dag la rjes su yi rang nas yongs su bsngo ba na /
translated: Then, when one rejoices in the merit of all śrāvakas, bodhisattvas, buddhas, and ordinary beings of the past, present, and future, and dedicates it,

original: de dag zad par yid la byed pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba med par yid la byed pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin par yid la byed pa na bla na med pa'i yongs su bsngo zhing zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de dag zad par yid la byed pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba med par yid la byed pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin par yid la byed pa na bla na med pa'i yongs su bsngo zhing zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: if one does so while keeping in mind that it is impermanent, that it is not a dedication, and that it is empty of its own essence, then that is called a supreme dedication. This is the third permutation.

original: de nas yang yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa de /
analyzed: de nas yang yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa de /
translated: Then, when one dedicates the merit of that very dedication,

original: chos thams cad kyis dben pa nyid dang chos thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid kyis dben par shes shing mchog nas mi mnyam pa dang / @191b mnyam pa'i bar gyis yongs su bsngo bas yongs su bsngo na zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyis dben pa nyid dang chos thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid kyis dben par shes shing mchog nas mi mnyam pa dang / @191b mnyam pa'i bar gyis yongs su bsngo bas yongs su bsngo na zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: It is the fourth when one dedicates with the thought that all phenomena are void, and that all phenomena are void by their very nature, and that they are dedicated with the highest dedication, up to the dedication that is equal to the unequalled.

original: de nas yang snga ma bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang nas byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba na /
analyzed: de nas yang snga ma bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la rjes su yi rang nas byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba na /
translated: Then, after rejoicing in all the roots of virtue as before, when one dedicates them to enlightenment,

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / yongs su bsngo ba dang / byang chub dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de dag gis ngo bo nyid mtshungs par shes nas yongs su bsngo na zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / yongs su bsngo ba dang / byang chub dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de dag gis ngo bo nyid mtshungs par shes nas yongs su bsngo na zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: it is the fifth when one dedicates with the thought that the Buddhas, the Disciples, the Solitary Sages, the Bodhisattvas, the roots of virtue, the dedication, and the thought of dedication are all of one and the same nature.

original: de'i 'og tu dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la mtshan mar byas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la mtshan mar byas te /
translated: After that, when one makes the roots of virtue into signs,

original: yongs su bsngo zhing 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la yang 'das pa'i yid la byed pas mtshan mar byed cing yul yin par yid la byed na phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo zhing 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la yang 'das pa'i yid la byed pas mtshan mar byed cing yul yin par yid la byed na phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one dedicates by means of a past mental orientation to the past Buddhas, and by means of a sign and a mental orientation to an object, then it is a perversion.

original: gal te dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du byed pa de dag dang / sems bskyed pa de dag shes par mi byed cing tshad mar mi byed na de yang dag par bsngo ba yin no zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: gal te dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du byed pa de dag dang / sems bskyed pa de dag shes par mi byed cing tshad mar mi byed na de yang dag par bsngo ba yin no zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: If one does not know and does not measure those wholesome roots, those formative forces, and those mental orientations, then that is a dedication.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas mtshan mar mi byed pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba gnyis mi 'gal bar ji ltar rung snyam nas dris pa dang / de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de ni byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas mtshan mar mi byed pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba gnyis mi 'gal bar ji ltar rung snyam nas dris pa dang / de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de ni byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Maitreya, thinking that it is not possible for the two, non-apprehension and dedication, to be non-contradictory, asked a question. Then the elder Subhuti taught that it is for the bodhisattvas who are skilled in means.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Maitreya taught this:

original: de la yang dag par yongs su bsngo bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag par yongs su bsngo bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva who wishes to dedicate perfectly should investigate as follows:

original: sangs rgyas de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du bya ba de dag dang / sems de dag kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / mngon par 'du bya ba de dag dang / sems de dag kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: “Those buddhas, those wholesome actions, those activities, and those thoughts do not exist.

original: 'on kyang bdag ni de dag thams cad mtshan mar byas nas rnam par rtog pa lta zhig /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag ni de dag thams cad mtshan mar byas nas rnam par rtog pa lta zhig /
translated: But I have imagined all of them as signs and have conceptualized them.

original: de ltar mtshan mar byas shing rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsngo ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su gnang ba ma mdzad de /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan mar byas shing rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsngo ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su gnang ba ma mdzad de /
translated: The Tathāgata has not approved of a dedication that is made by imagining in this way and by conceptualizing.

original: de ni kha zas zhim po dug dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ni kha zas zhim po dug dang mtshungs so //
translated: It is like delicious food mixed with poison.

original: de bas na de ltar yongs su bsngo bar mi bya zhing de la bslab par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar yongs su bsngo bar mi bya zhing de la bslab par yang mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should not dedicate in this way, nor should you train in it.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas nyid tshad mar byas la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de @192a * //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas nyid tshad mar byas la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de @192a * //
translated: Therefore, take the Buddha as your standard.

original: dag gis de dag thams cad ji ltar mkhyen pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang yongs su bsngo'o zhes yongs su sngo bar byed pa dug med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i 'gres ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: dag gis de dag thams cad ji ltar mkhyen pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang yongs su bsngo'o zhes yongs su sngo bar byed pa dug med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba'i 'gres ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh permutation of the uncontaminated dedication is to dedicate by thinking, “Just as they know all of these, I too dedicate in the same way.”

original: de nas chos thams cad khams gsum dang dus gsum du ma gtogs par yid la byed pas yongs su bsngo ba ni dug med pa'o //
analyzed: de nas chos thams cad khams gsum dang dus gsum du ma gtogs par yid la byed pas yongs su bsngo ba ni dug med pa'o //
translated: The eighth permutation is to dedicate by bringing to mind that all phenomena are included within the three realms and the three times, and to dedicate in this way is uncontaminated.

original: de las gzhan du yongs su bsngo ba ni dug dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan du yongs su bsngo ba ni dug dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: To dedicate in any other way is contaminated.

original: de nas yang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi chos nyid kyis bdag yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi chos nyid kyis bdag yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgu pa'o //
translated: The ninth permutation is to think, “I will dedicate by means of the reality that is the domain of the wisdom of the buddhas.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshig las rnam pa mang du rjes su yi rang bar mdzad nas rnam pa gsum gyis bsod nams mang du 'phel bar bstan pa stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad kyis dge ba bcu'i
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshig las rnam pa mang du rjes su yi rang bar mdzad nas rnam pa gsum gyis bsod nams mang du 'phel bar bstan pa stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad kyis dge ba bcu'i
translated: The merit of all the sentient beings of the great trichiliocosm who have attained the ten virtuous🔽paths of action, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions, and the superknowledges is less than the merit of this unattached dedication.

original: las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa thob pa rnams kyi bsod nams pas chags pa med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba 'di bsod nams ches mang ngo zhes bya ba ni gcig go //
analyzed: las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa thob pa rnams kyi bsod nams pas chags pa med pa'i yongs su bsngo ba 'di bsod nams ches mang ngo zhes bya ba ni gcig go //
translated: This is the first way.

original: de la sems can de dag thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de la sems can de dag thams cad rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: Therein, all those sentient beings are stream-enterers and so forth, up to

original: dgra bcom pa dang / rang byang chub kyi bar du gyur pa rnams la rkyen bzhis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bsnyen bkur byas pa'i bsod nams pas lhag pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //🔽de nyid la sems can de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpar gyur pa rnams la phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyis de dag re re la yang rkyen bzhi dang bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma skyed du bsnyen
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang / rang byang chub kyi bar du gyur pa rnams la rkyen bzhis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bsnyen bkur byas pa'i bsod nams pas lhag pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o // de nyid la sems can de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpar gyur pa rnams la phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyis de dag re re la yang rkyen bzhi dang bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma skyed du bsnyen
translated: The second is that the merit of serving for as long as one lives with the four requirements is exceeded by the merit of serving for one day with the four requirements those from the faithless up to the arhats and pratyekabuddhas.

original: bkur byas pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po de lta bu de dag pas kyang lhag go zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bkur byas pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po de lta bu de dag pas kyang lhag go zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is that the mass of merit of serving each of those bodhisattvas with the four requirements and all the necessities of happiness for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River is exceeded by the merit of serving for one day with the four requirements those sentient beings who are bodhisattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te bsod nams bgyi ba'i dngos po de la gzugs mchis su lags na ni 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du yang mi shong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni der kun mi chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te bsod nams bgyi ba'i dngos po de la gzugs mchis su lags na ni 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du yang mi shong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni der kun mi chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: This is the oath that it would not fit there.

original: go // de'i 'og tu bsod nams snga ma rnams ni mtshan ma'i @192b 'du shes dang / dmigs pa'i 'du shes can yin pas dman pa yin gyi yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po la ni de dag med pa'i phyir de bas lhag go zhes bya ba'i 'gres dang /
analyzed: go // de'i 'og tu bsod nams snga ma rnams ni mtshan ma'i @192b 'du shes dang / dmigs pa'i 'du shes can yin pas dman pa yin gyi yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po la ni de dag med pa'i phyir de bas lhag go zhes bya ba'i 'gres dang /
translated: After that, the previous merits are inferior because they have the perception of signs and the perception of objects, but the mass of merit of the dedication is superior because it is free of those.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa lha'i bdag po thams cad dang / lha rnams dang / tshangs pa thams cad kyis mchod pa byas pa dang / rab tu bsngags pa brjod pa'i 'gres gnyis dang / de'i 'og tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad byang chub sems par gyur pa rnams kyi dmigs pa dang bcas par yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po bas byang chub sems dpa' gcig gi mi dmigs par yongs
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa na spyod pa lha'i bdag po thams cad dang / lha rnams dang / tshangs pa thams cad kyis mchod pa byas pa dang / rab tu bsngags pa brjod pa'i 'gres gnyis dang / de'i 'og tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad byang chub sems par gyur pa rnams kyi dmigs pa dang bcas par yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po bas byang chub sems dpa' gcig gi mi dmigs par yongs
translated: The mental object is threefold:🔽the universal vehicle texts,🔽the spirit of enlightenment, and

original: su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po lhag par che ba bstan pa'i 'gres so //
analyzed: su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po lhag par che ba bstan pa'i 'gres so //
translated: the welfare of beings.🔽The method is threefold:

original: mi len mi gtong /
analyzed: mi len mi gtong /
translated: nonapprehending,🔽nondifferentiating, and🔽nonreifying.

original: mi rlom mi brnyas shing dmigs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas de rnams dang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams de bzhin nyid du dman pa dang lhag pa med pa'i don gyi dbang gis mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi rlom mi brnyas shing dmigs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas de rnams dang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams de bzhin nyid du dman pa dang lhag pa med pa'i don gyi dbang gis mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: Not conceited, not contemptuous, and not objectifying means that those Buddhas and those wholesome roots are taught to be the same in suchness, because there is no inferiority or superiority in meaning.

original: de bzhin du skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang /
translated: Similarly, just as the Buddhas, the Hearers, the Solitary Realizers, the Bodhisattvas,🔽and those ordinary beings, and those wholesome roots, and the mind of dedication are not born, do not cease, are not defiled, are not purified, and so on,

original: so so'i skye bo de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa la gnas pa de bzhin du bdag kyang rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang ba gcig pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa la gnas pa de bzhin du bdag kyang rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang ba gcig pa'o //
translated: in the same way, I rejoice in suchness and so on. This is the single rejoicing.

original: de nas yang chos thams cad ni rnam par grol bar mtshungs te /
analyzed: de nas yang chos thams cad ni rnam par grol bar mtshungs te /
translated: Then, all phenomena are the same in liberation,

original: de dang mtshungs pas chos thams cad mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pas chos thams cad mnyam pa'o //
translated: All things are equal, because they are the same as that.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir sngon so so'i skye bo'i tshe ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir sngon so so'i skye bo'i tshe ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: All things are neither bound nor liberated, because they are essentially isolated.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / phyis rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / phyis rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
translated: All things are neither previously defiled nor later purified, because they are essentially pure.

original: chos thams cad gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir sngar rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis skye ba med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir sngar rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis skye ba med do //
translated: All things are not produced earlier by the power of causes and conditions, because they are primordially peaceful.

original: ngo bo nyid med pas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pas 'byung ba med do //
translated: They do not arise, because they are essentially insubstantial.

original: phyis 'gag pa med cing 'pho ba med pa dang @193a * //
analyzed: phyis 'gag pa med cing 'pho ba med pa dang @193a * //
translated: They do not cease later, nor do they transfer,

original: 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig pa med do //
translated: nor do they perish.

original: de ltar bcings pa dang grol ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / skye ba dang 'byung ba dang 'gag pa med pa dang / 'pho ba dang 'jig pa med pas chos thams cad mnyam mo zhes so sor rtog cing rjes su yi rang ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bcings pa dang grol ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / skye ba dang 'byung ba dang 'gag pa med pa dang / 'pho ba dang 'jig pa med pas chos thams cad mnyam mo zhes so sor rtog cing rjes su yi rang ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is to rejoice in the realization that all things are the same, because they are neither bound nor liberated, because they are neither defiled nor purified, because they neither arise nor occur, neither cease nor perish.

original: de nas yang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad la bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsod nams bsags pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa spyad pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams che bar bstan pa'i 'gres te /
analyzed: de nas yang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad la bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsod nams bsags pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa spyad pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams che bar bstan pa'i 'gres te /
translated: Then, having served all the Buddhas of the ten directions with all the articles of offering, and having accumulated merit by means of the six perfections with reference points, the merit of practicing the perfections without reference points is dedicated. The merit of this is shown to be greater than the previous.

original: 'di dag ni rjes su yi rang ba'i 'gres so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rjes su yi rang ba'i 'gres so //
translated: These are the verses on rejoicing.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchod pa dang bklags pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams rgya chen po thos nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu dad pa skyes te 'khor gzhan rnams dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i slad du snang bar bgyid
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchod pa dang bklags pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams rgya chen po thos nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu dad pa skyes te 'khor gzhan rnams dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i slad du snang bar bgyid
translated: Thus, having heard of the great merit of worshipping the perfection of wisdom, reading it, giving it away, and so on, and rejoicing in it and dedicating it, the elder Shariputra gave rise to faith and in order to generate faith in the other retinue members, he said to the Bhagavan, The perfection of wisdom illuminates because it is utterly pure.

original: pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bcu bdun gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstod pa la brtsams so //
analyzed: pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bcu bdun gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstod pa la brtsams so //
translated: Thus, having heard the great merit of worshipping the perfection of wisdom, reading it, giving it away, etc., and rejoicing in it, and having dedicated it, the elder Shariputra, in order to generate faith in the other retinue, began to praise this perfection of wisdom with seventeen statements beginning with The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, illuminates because of its utter purity.

original: lan gsum du bzlas te chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba'o zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas te chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba'o zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor zhes bya'o //
translated: The wheel of Dharma was turned three times and has twelve aspects means that the Blessed One turned the wheel of Dharma of the four noble truths three times and has twelve aspects.

original: de la 'di ni lan gsum du bzlas nas bskor ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni lan gsum du bzlas nas bskor ba ste /
translated: This is the third turning.🔽This is the four noble truths.

original: 'di ni bden pa bzhi'o zhes bya bar bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyi le'u tshig ni gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni bden pa bzhi'o zhes bya bar bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyi le'u tshig ni gcig go //
translated: This is the chapter on the nature of the four noble truths.🔽The four noble truths themselves are to be fully understood, abandoned, realized, and cultivated.

original: bden pa bzhi po de dag nyid yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i le'u tshig ni bskor ba gnyis so //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po de dag nyid yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i le'u tshig ni bskor ba gnyis so //
translated: This is the chapter on the four noble truths.

original: bden pa bzhi po de dag nyid bdag gis yongs su shes so //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po de dag nyid bdag gis yongs su shes so //
translated: The four noble truths themselves are fully understood by me,🔽abandoned, realized,

original: spangs so // mngon sum du byas so //🔽bsgoms so zhes bya ba'i le'u tshig ni bskor ba gsum ste /
analyzed: spangs so // mngon sum du byas so // bsgoms so zhes bya ba'i le'u tshig ni bskor ba gsum ste /
translated: and cultivated.🔽This is the chapter on the four noble truths.

original: de dag ni lan gsum du bzlas te bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni lan gsum du bzlas te bskor ba'o //
translated: This is the third turning.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi @193b bden pa la sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid dang yongs su shes par bya ba dang / yongs su shes so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi @193b bden pa la sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid dang yongs su shes par bya ba dang / yongs su shes so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Here, the truth of suffering has three aspects: the nature of suffering, what is to be fully understood, and what is fully understood.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la yang kun 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / spang bar bya ba dang spangs so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //🔽'gog pa'i bden pa la yang 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la yang kun 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / spang bar bya ba dang spangs so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum mo // 'gog pa'i bden pa la yang 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The truth of origination also has three aspects: the nature of origination, what is to be abandoned, and what has been abandoned.🔽The truth of cessation also has three aspects: the nature of cessation, what is to be realized, and what has been realized.

original: lam gyi bden pa la yang lam gyi ngo bo nyid dang / bsgom par bya ba dang / bsgoms so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la yang lam gyi ngo bo nyid dang / bsgom par bya ba dang / bsgoms so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The truth of the path also has three aspects: the nature of the path, what is to be cultivated, and what has been cultivated.

original: de ltar na rnam pa bcu gnyis so //🔽bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i thabs sngar brgya byin gyis dris zin la /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa bcu gnyis so // bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i thabs sngar brgya byin gyis dris zin la /
translated: Thus, there are twelve aspects.🔽As for the question Blessed One, how should one abide in the perfection of wisdom?

original: bshad kyang zin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i thabs dris pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bshad kyang zin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i thabs dris pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This method of abiding in the perfection of wisdom was already asked by Śakra and has already been explained, so it is not a question about the method of abiding in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir ni ji ltar gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba ji ltar gus shing 'jar bas gnas par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir ni ji ltar gnas par bgyi zhes bya ba ji ltar gus shing 'jar bas gnas par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, how should one stand? It means how should one stand with respect and humility.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ston pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ston pa /
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself is the teacher.

original: ston pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir tha dad pa med par brtags te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir tha dad pa med par brtags te bstan pa'o //
translated: The teacher himself is the perfection of wisdom. This is taught by considering that there is no difference because he performs the activities of a Buddha.

original: sh'a ri'i bus dris pa 'di ci las byung gleng gzhi gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus dris pa 'di ci las byung gleng gzhi gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of this question asked by Śāriputra? What is the source?

original: dgos pa de tsam gyis ma mgu nas rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: dgos pa de tsam gyis ma mgu nas rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Not being satisfied with just that purpose, he has a thought:

original: de bas sh'a ri'i bus 'og nas koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung ba rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de gtso bo yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de bas sh'a ri'i bus 'og nas koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung ba rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas de gtso bo yin par bstan te /
translated: Therefore, Śāriputra, below, says Kauśika, those who are taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom... and so on, teaching that it is the principal one.

original: de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur gyur pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang gis gyur te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur gyur pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang gis gyur te /
translated: All the other perfections, which are causes for the supreme enlightenment, are due to the power of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na 'di la rab tu gus par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la rab tu gus par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one should have great respect for this.

original: de dag thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bas na zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang bas so //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa lnga rnams sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung na /
analyzed: de dag thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bas na zhes bya ba ni rjes su yi rang bas so // pha rol tu phyin pa lnga rnams sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung na /
translated: All of them are dedicated to the knowledge of all modes means by rejoicing.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob po zhes bya ba ni pha @194a * //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob po zhes bya ba ni pha @194a * //
translated: The five perfections, when taken hold of by the perfection of giving, do not get the name perfection.

original: rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gcig la gcig gnas shing gcig gi rgyu gcig yin par sngar bstan pa'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gcig la gcig gnas shing gcig gi rgyu gcig yin par sngar bstan pa'i phyir smos so //
translated: This is said because it has been shown that the six perfections are mutually based and are the cause of one another.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te koo shi ka de ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag las gcig yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe yang drug car yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te koo shi ka de ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag las gcig yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe yang drug car yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas /
translated: This shows that when one of the six perfections is completed, all six are completed.

original: phan tshun gcig gi rgyur gcig 'gyur ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: phan tshun gcig gi rgyur gcig 'gyur ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: They are merely causes of each other, one for the other,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ltar thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du rgyur 'gyur ba ni ma yin par ston to //🔽bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba 'dir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i rnam pa dris pa ni ma yin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ltar thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du rgyur 'gyur ba ni ma yin par ston to // bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba 'dir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i rnam pa dris pa ni ma yin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: but not like the perfection of wisdom, which is the cause in every way and in every respect.🔽How is that perfection of wisdom to be accomplished?

original: pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu dris pa'o //
analyzed: pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu dris pa'o //
translated: Here, too, it is not the aspect of the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom that is asked about, but the result of the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs mngon par bsgrub pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because form is not accomplished means because form is non-existent.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar gzugs mngon par bsgrub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba ni zhus pa gnyis pa ste /

translated: Blessed One, how should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished because form is not accomplished? This is the second question.

translated: In this way, the perfection of wisdom does not cause the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects, and it does not cause the attainment of any dharma at all.

original: dmigs par byed pa'i dngos po mnyam pas mnyam par gyur pa na chos gang yang bdag gis gzung bar bya bar mi dmigs pa dang / bdag rang 'dzin pa po'i bdag nyid du mi len pa dang / mig la sogs pa ltar gnas kyi dngos por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba dang /
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa'i dngos po mnyam pas mnyam par gyur pa na chos gang yang bdag gis gzung bar bya bar mi dmigs pa dang / bdag rang 'dzin pa po'i bdag nyid du mi len pa dang / mig la sogs pa ltar gnas kyi dngos por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba dang /
translated: When this wisdom is equalized by the equality of the entity that is the object of observation and the observer, then any dharma is not observed to be apprehended by oneself, and oneself is not taken to be the nature of the apprehender, and it is not seen to be the entity of a location, like the eyes, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dor bar bya ba gang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba @195a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dor bar bya ba gang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba @195a * //

translated: And, since he does not at all conceive of the nature of the truths as “this is the truth,” and since he does not see the white and black sides as objects to be grasped and rejected, he does not grasp and does not reject. At that time, because he abides in the nature of the knowledge of all aspects,

translated: “This perfection of wisdom, O Lord, is most wonderful” means that at that time, because all phenomena of that [perfection of wisdom] do not exist, they are described by the names “non-arising,” “non-ceasing,” “non-production,” “non-apprehension,” and “indestructibility.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad thob par bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad thob par bgyid pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom causes the attainment of all dharmas.🔽The perfection of wisdom does not cause the attainment of all dharmas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad thob par mi bgyid pa'o zhes de lta bu'i 'du shes su gyur na zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang / dngos po med pa gnyi gar rnam par rtog pa'i phyir de skad bshad do //

translated: If the perfection of wisdom were something that could be made,

translated: Because of the non-production of sentient beings. Because of the characteristic of the non-production of sentient beings, the perfection of wisdom should be seen as without characteristic.
