translated: Then, in order to demonstrate that it is difficult to have conviction in that, Subhūti asks the question, “How deep is that perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, which is so difficult to have conviction in?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bcings ma grol bar bshad pa dang / rnam par dag pa bshad pa dang / kun du mtha' yas pa bshad pa dang / chags pa dang ma chags pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bcings ma grol bar bshad pa dang / rnam par dag pa bshad pa dang / kun du mtha' yas pa bshad pa dang / chags pa dang ma chags pa bshad pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One explains it as unfettered and unfreed, as pure, as infinite, and as attached and unattached.

original: bshad pa rnam pa bzhi'i skabs phye'o //
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa bzhi'i skabs phye'o //
translated: Thus, four kinds of explanation are opened up.

original: de la rab 'byor gzugs ma bcings ma grol zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas skabs gang yongs su grub pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs su snang ba de 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor gzugs ma bcings ma grol zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas skabs gang yongs su grub pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs su snang ba de 'khor ba'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Therein, “form is unfettered and unfreed” is the situation of the perfection of wisdom of non-conceptuality, where the appearance of form as the reality of the consummate nature is, in the situation of saṃsāra,

original: dus de srid du las dang nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i bcing ba thams cad kyis ma bcings pas ma bcings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus de srid du las dang nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i bcing ba thams cad kyis ma bcings pas ma bcings zhes bya'o //
translated: For that long, it is not bound by any of the bonds of karma, afflictions, or ripening, and so it is called “unbound.”

original: phyis kyang yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs na grol ba med pa'i phyir ma grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyis kyang yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs na grol ba med pa'i phyir ma grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And later, in the state of complete accomplishment, it is called “unliberated” because there is no liberation.

original: kun brtags pa nyid la ni bcings pa dang grol ba zhes brjod kyi nam mkha' bzhin du cis kyang ma gos pa 'gyur ba med pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa nyid la ni bcings pa dang grol ba zhes brjod kyi nam mkha' bzhin du cis kyang ma gos pa 'gyur ba med pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs la ni ma yin no //
translated: “Bound” and “liberated” are said in terms of the imagined, not in terms of form that is the nature of phenomena, which is unstained by anything and unchanging like space.

original: de bas na gzugs dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The nature of the nonexistence of form is form.”

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The nature of the nonexistence of imagined form is the same as the nature of phenomena form.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all phenomena, up to and including omniscience.

original: yang ma bcings ma grol ba 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dus gsum dang sbyar te bstan pa /
analyzed: yang ma bcings ma grol ba 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dus gsum dang sbyar te bstan pa /
translated: In order to clarify this very non-binding and non-liberating, it is taught in connection with the three times.

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' ma bcings ma grol ba zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs 'khor ba na dri ma dang bcas pa ma dag pa'i gnas skabs la sngon gyi @196b mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' ma bcings ma grol ba zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs 'khor ba na dri ma dang bcas pa ma dag pa'i gnas skabs la sngon gyi @196b mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, the past limit of form is not bound, not liberated. The reality of form in saṃsāra, in the impure state with stains, is called the past limit.

original: da ltar dag pa dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs la da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar dag pa dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs la da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The present state of purity and impurity is called the present.

original: phyis dag pa'i gnas skabs la phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyis dag pa'i gnas skabs la phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: The future state of purity is called the future limit.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs so zhes bya bas ni dus gsum char du yang mi 'gyur bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ni de bzhin nyid yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni gzugs so zhes bya bas ni dus gsum char du yang mi 'gyur bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ni de bzhin nyid yin no zhes ston te /
translated: The nature of the past limit is non-existent, it is form. This teaches that the characteristic of abiding unchanging in all three times is suchness.

original: chos nyid ni dus las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: chos nyid ni dus las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan to //
translated: It teaches that reality is not characterized by being liberated from time.

original: de ltar ma bcings ma grol bar bshad pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med par bstan nas yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med par bstan pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa bshad par brtsams pa /
analyzed: de ltar ma bcings ma grol bar bshad pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med par bstan nas yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med par bstan pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa bshad par brtsams pa /
translated: Thus, having taught that cyclic existence and nirvana are not things by explaining that they are not bound and not liberated, in order to teach that there is no affliction and no purification, he begins the explanation of purity.

original: gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The purity of form is the purity of effect.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i chos rnams la bcings pa med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i chos rnams la bcings pa med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
translated: Therein, since form and so on, up to and including the dharmas that are the culmination of the knowledge of all aspects, are not bound, they are not afflicted.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Because they are not afflicted, they are naturally pure.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyang med de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyang med de /
translated: Because they are naturally pure, the purified dharmas do not exist.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la ni don dam par rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams ci yang mi byed do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la ni don dam par rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams ci yang mi byed do //
translated: In the naturally pure, ultimately nothing at all is done by the factors of purification.

original: de bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par mi rtog pa yang byis pa rnams kyis brtags pa nyid de yongs su grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par mi rtog pa yang byis pa rnams kyis brtags pa nyid de yongs su grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified are only imagined by the childish, and are not fully present.

original: de ltar rnam pa gcig gis mos par dka' ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gcig gis mos par dka' ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the difficulty of belief in one aspect,

original: yang rnam par dag pa'i phyir mos par dka' ba bstan pa /
analyzed: yang rnam par dag pa'i phyir mos par dka' ba bstan pa /
translated: he teaches the difficulty of belief in terms of purity.🔽Therein, whatever purity of form is, that is the purity of the effect. There is nothing else whatsoever that is called the purity of the effect of the factors of purification such as the perfections and the factors of enlightenment.

original: de la gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bur gyur pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba gud na gang yang med kyi gang chos nyid kyi gzugs yongs su grub pa ngo bo nyid du gyur pa rtag tu gnas pa rnam
analyzed: de la gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bur gyur pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba gud na gang yang med kyi gang chos nyid kyi gzugs yongs su grub pa ngo bo nyid du gyur pa rtag tu gnas pa rnam
translated: The fully present nature of form, which is reality, is always present as the essence.

original: par dag pa de nyid 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: par dag pa de nyid 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That very purity of form is the purity of the result. This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And so it is with all phenomena.

original: de ltar @197a * //
analyzed: de ltar @197a * //
translated: Thus,

original: rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan nas /
translated: having taught the nature of purity,

original: de'i 'og tu chos thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa yang gcig pa'i bdag nyid de tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa yang gcig pa'i bdag nyid de tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa /
translated: then, in order to teach that the purity of all phenomena is of the same nature and not different,

original: gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: it is said: “Whatever purity of form, that is the purity of the result.

original: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Whatever purity of the result, that is the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de gzugs rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de gzugs rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Whatever purity of the perfection of wisdom, that is the purity of form.

original: de la gzugs kyi chos nyid kyi gnas skabs la ni gzugs rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi chos nyid kyi gnas skabs la ni gzugs rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, the state of the reality of form is called the purity of form.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yang dag pa'i gnas skabs la ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yang dag pa'i gnas skabs la ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The state of nirvana is called the “purification of the result.”

original: chos kyi sku'i gnas skabs la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i gnas skabs la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The state of the Dharma body is called the “purification of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de la gzugs rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de 'bras bu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de 'bras bu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The suchness of the purification of form is the purification of the result.

original: rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
translated: That liberation is the purification of the perfection of wisdom, which is the Dharma body.

original: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de nyid gzugs rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de nyid gzugs rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: That Dharma body is the purification of form.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is a synonym for suchness.

original: de bas na de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par grol ba dang chos kyi sku ni don dam par tha dad pa med de gcig go //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par grol ba dang chos kyi sku ni don dam par tha dad pa med de gcig go //
translated: Therefore, suchness, liberation, and the Dharma body are ultimately undifferentiated; they are one.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa'i bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa'i bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied up to the purity of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar chos thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa gcig go zhes mjug bsdus te bstan pa /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa gcig go zhes mjug bsdus te bstan pa /
translated: Thus, the purity of all phenomena is one.

original: de ltar na gzugs rnam par dag pa dang / 'bras bu rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par dag pa 'di dag ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs rnam par dag pa dang / 'bras bu rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par dag pa 'di dag ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, the purity of form, the purity of the fruit, the purity of the perfection of wisdom, up to the purity of the knowledge of all aspects, these purities are non-dual, not divided, not broken apart, not cut apart.

original: gcig pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'o //🔽tha dad du dbye mi nus pa'i phyir gnyis su byar med pa'o //🔽bye brag med pa'i phyir so so ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'o // tha dad du dbye mi nus pa'i phyir gnyis su byar med pa'o // bye brag med pa'i phyir so so ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because they are one, they are non-dual.🔽Because they cannot be divided, they are not divided.🔽Because there is no distinction, they are not broken apart.

original: bar chad med pa'i phyir ram rtag pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i phyir ram rtag pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Because there is no interruption or because they are permanent, they are not cut apart.

original: de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang @197b thun mong ba'i 'bras bu rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams dang @197b thun mong ba'i 'bras bu rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the pure result that is shared with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas has been taught.

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa thun mong ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa thun mong ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the purity that is not shared with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa bor te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa bor te /
translated: the purity of the result is set aside.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa 'ga' zhig bzung nas bstan te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa 'ga' zhig bzung nas bstan te /
translated: Having taken up the purity of the perfection of wisdom, it is taught.

original: de ltar 'gres 'di gnyis kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa gcig go zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'gres 'di gnyis kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa gcig go zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these two sets of two teach that the purity of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and the purity of the tathāgatas are the same.

original: da ni rnam par dag pa de gang zag la bdag med pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dngos po med pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i rnam par dag pa gsum gyis de dag rim bzhin du bstan te /
analyzed: da ni rnam par dag pa de gang zag la bdag med pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dngos po med pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / chos la bdag med pa'i rnam par dag pa gsum gyis de dag rim bzhin du bstan te /
translated: Now, that purity is taught in three ways: the purity of the selflessness of persons, the purity of the nonexistence of the secondary afflictions, and the purity of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: bdag rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dngos po med par shes pa nyid bdag rnam par dag pa'o //🔽de la 'gres kyi rim pa bzhin du bstan par bya ste /🔽bdag rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa gzugs rnam par dag pas bdag rnam par dag pa ste /🔽de ltar na bdag rnam par dag pa dang gzugs rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de /
analyzed: bdag rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dngos po med par shes pa nyid bdag rnam par dag pa'o // de la 'gres kyi rim pa bzhin du bstan par bya ste / bdag rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa gzugs rnam par dag pas bdag rnam par dag pa ste / de ltar na bdag rnam par dag pa dang gzugs rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de /
translated: The purity of the self is the purity of form.

original: gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do //
translated: Thus, the purity of the self and the purity of form are not two nor divided, not broken apart, not otherwise.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnam par dag pa dang bdag rnam par dag pas rnam par shes pa dag pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnam par dag pa dang bdag rnam par dag pas rnam par shes pa dag pa /
translated: The purity of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness is the purity of the self.🔽The purity of the self is the purity of consciousness.🔽Thus, the purity of the self and the purity of consciousness are not two nor divided, not broken apart, not otherwise.

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pas bdag rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams kyi rnam par dag pa yang gnyis su med par bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pas bdag rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams kyi rnam par dag pa yang gnyis su med par bstan to //
translated: The purity of the self and so on up to the purity of all aspects of omniscience are taught to be nondual by the purity of consciousness, the purity of the self, and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa dngos po med pa rnam par dag pa'i 'gres la yang 'dod chags rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa dngos po med pa rnam par dag pa'i 'gres la yang 'dod chags rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa /
translated: After that, in the sequence of the purity of the non-entity of the afflictions, the purity of form is the purity of desire,

original: gzugs rnam par dag pas 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ste /🔽de ltar na 'dod chags rnam par dag pa dang gzugs rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams kyi rnam par dag pa dang /🔽'dod chags @198a * //
analyzed: gzugs rnam par dag pas 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ste / de ltar na 'dod chags rnam par dag pa dang gzugs rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams kyi rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod chags @198a * //
translated: the purity of desire is the purity of form.

original: rnam par dag pa gnyis su med par bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa gnyis su med par bshad do //
translated: Thus, the purity of desire and the purity of form are nondual in this way, and so on up to the purity of all aspects of omniscience, explaining the purity of phenomena up to the purity of omniscience and the purity of desire as nondual.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug dag la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug dag la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to hatred and ignorance.

original: de'i 'og tu chos bdag med pa rnam par dag pa'i 'gres la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos bdag med pa rnam par dag pa'i 'gres la /
translated: After that, in the order of the purity of the selflessness of phenomena,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bzung nas chos gnyis kyi rnam par dag pa gnyis su med pa bshad pa'i 'gres ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bzung nas chos gnyis kyi rnam par dag pa gnyis su med pa bshad pa'i 'gres ni /
translated: having taken the purity of all aspects of dependent origination and so on up to the end of omniscience, the order of explaining the nondual purity of the two phenomena is as follows.🔽As it is said:

original: ji ltar ma rig pa rnam par dag pas 'du byed rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: ji ltar ma rig pa rnam par dag pas 'du byed rnam par dag pa /
translated: “Through the purity of ignorance, the formations are purified.

original: 'du byed rnam par dag pas ma rig pa rnam par dag pa ste de ltar na ma rig pa rnam par dag pa dang / 'du byed rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par
analyzed: 'du byed rnam par dag pas ma rig pa rnam par dag pa ste de ltar na ma rig pa rnam par dag pa dang / 'du byed rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par
translated: In the same way, in the perfections, the purity of the perfection of morality is due to the purity of the perfection of generosity;

original: dag pa / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: dag pa / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: the purity of the perfection of generosity is due to the purity of the perfection of morality.🔽Thus, there is no duality in the purity of the perfection of generosity and the purity of the perfection of morality.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med ces bya ba dang de bzhin du thams cad la'ang sbyar ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med ces bya ba dang de bzhin du thams cad la'ang sbyar ste /
translated: And so on for all.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of the knowledge of path aspects is due to the purity of the knowledge of all aspects. The purity of the knowledge of all aspects is due to the purity of the knowledge of path aspects.

original: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med ces bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med ces bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, there is no duality in the purity of the knowledge of all aspects and the purity of the knowledge of path aspects.

original: de nas yang chos thams cad rnam par dag pa bsdus pa'i 'gres la yang thog mar pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams la /
analyzed: de nas yang chos thams cad rnam par dag pa bsdus pa'i 'gres la yang thog mar pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams la /
translated: Next, in the summary of the purity of all phenomena, the first is the six perfections.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / phung po la sogs pa tshor ba'i tshogs drug po rnams kyi mthar thug pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa bzung nas de dag gnyis su med par bstan pa'i 'gres te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / phung po la sogs pa tshor ba'i tshogs drug po rnams kyi mthar thug pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa bzung nas de dag gnyis su med par bstan pa'i 'gres te /
translated: Having taken up the purity of the perfection of wisdom, the purity of the aggregates and so forth, the purity of the six collections of feelings, and the purity of omniscience, they are taught to be nondual.

original: ji ltar rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam @198b par dag pa gang yin pa de gzugs rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam @198b par dag pa gang yin pa de gzugs rnam par dag pa /
translated: Just as it says, “Furthermore, Subhūti, the purity of the perfection of wisdom is the purity of form.

original: gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of form is the purity of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba de bzhin du tshor ba rnams dang /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba de bzhin du tshor ba rnams dang /
translated: Similarly, the purity of feelings,

original: 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de /
translated: perceptions, mental formations, and consciousness, up to the purity of the perfection of wisdom,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par dag pa yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par dag pa yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: the purity of the feeling that arises from the condition of sensory contact that is mentally compounded, and the purity of the feeling that arises from the condition of sensory contact that is mentally compounded are the purity of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med ces bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med ces bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom, the purity of the sense-faculty of the mind, the purity of the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the mind, and the purity of the knowledge of all aspects should be known as non-dual, and so on.

original: de nas yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa nas /
analyzed: de nas yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa nas /
translated: Then, starting from the purity of the perfection of concentration,

original: phung po la sogs pa tshor ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams kyi rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa bzung nas de dag gnyis su med pa bstan pa dang / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa tshor ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams kyi rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa bzung nas de dag gnyis su med pa bstan pa dang / de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang /
translated: up to the purity of the aggregates and so on, up to the purity of feeling, and taking up the purity of the knowledge of all aspects, the non-duality is taught, and likewise for all the perfections,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / tshor ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams kyi rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med par bstan pa dang / de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i chos rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa tshor ba'i tshogs drug gi mthar thug pa'i chos rnams dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / tshor ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams kyi rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med par bstan pa dang / de bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i chos rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa tshor ba'i tshogs drug gi mthar thug pa'i chos rnams dang /
translated: And similarly, all phenomena from the applications of mindfulness up to omniscience, and phenomena from form up to the six collections of feelings,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa de dag gcig tu bshad par sbyar bar bya'o //🔽de nas yang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnam par dag pa'i 'gres dang / dus gsum @199a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa de dag gcig tu bshad par sbyar bar bya'o // de nas yang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnam par dag pa'i 'gres dang / dus gsum @199a * //
translated: and the purity of omniscience are explained as being one.🔽Then, the purity of the conditioned and the purity of the unconditioned are taught,

original: rnam par dag pa'i 'gres bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i 'gres bstan te /
translated: and the purity of the three times is taught.

original: 'di man chad gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus rnam par dag pa bshad pa thos nas spobs pa skyes te 'khor bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di man chad gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus rnam par dag pa bshad pa thos nas spobs pa skyes te 'khor bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: From here on, the elder Shariputra, having heard the explanation of purity, gained confidence and, in order to gather the assembly,

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa 'di ni zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par dag pa'i tshig bcu gsum rim gyis bstan par brtsams so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa 'di ni zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par dag pa'i tshig bcu gsum rim gyis bstan par brtsams so //
translated: he began to teach the thirteen terms of purity in sequence, beginning with “Bhagavan, this purity is profound.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zab po zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa du ma'i dri mas brtsams pa 'khor ba'i chos de dag dang tha dad par ma gyur pa'i chos nyid ni
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zab po zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa du ma'i dri mas brtsams pa 'khor ba'i chos de dag dang tha dad par ma gyur pa'i chos nyid ni
translated: “Shariputra, it is profound because of utter purity” means that the dharmata, which is not different from the phenomena of samsara, which are created by the stains of the many afflictions, branch afflictions, and conceptuality,

original: dri ma de dag gis dri ma can du ma gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dri ma de dag gis dri ma can du ma gyur pa ste /
translated: is not stained by those stains.

original: dus thams cad du shin tu rnam par dag pa yin par byis pa rnams kyi yid ches par dka' bas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zab ces bya'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du shin tu rnam par dag pa yin par byis pa rnams kyi yid ches par dka' bas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zab ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is utterly pure at all times, it is difficult for the minds of childish beings to believe it, and therefore it is called “profound because of utter purity.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa ni snang ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste dper na sprin dang / na bun dang khug rna la sogs pa med na nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa ni snang ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste dper na sprin dang / na bun dang khug rna la sogs pa med na nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The statement Śāriputra, purity is illumination because of utter purity is as follows: For example, when there are no clouds, fog, or mist, the sun and moon, etc. are utterly pure,

original: rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and they shine.

original: de bzhin du chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir snang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the dharmatā of form, etc. is called illumination because of utter purity.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gzugs shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa snang ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa snang ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, Form is illumination because of utter purity.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i dri ma rnams spangs pa ni slar nying mtshams mi sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i dri ma rnams spangs pa ni slar nying mtshams mi sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: The statement Blessed One, purity is non-connection is as follows: The abandonment of the stains of afflictions and conceptualized proliferation is because of not connecting again.

original: dri ma med cing rnam par dag pas na nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dri ma med cing rnam par dag pas na nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is stainless and pure, it is called “without reentry.”🔽Śāriputra, the purity of form, since it does not migrate, is without reentry.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gzugs la 'pho ba med pas nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa rnams ni yang 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gzugs la 'pho ba med pas nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa rnams ni yang 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that those forms, etc., which are abandoned by the process of thorough understanding, do not migrate again.🔽The Blessed One, purity is the absence of defilement.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni sprin dang na bun dang khug rna la sogs pa yod du zin kyang nam mkha' ltar rnam pa thams cad du rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o @199b zhes
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni sprin dang na bun dang khug rna la sogs pa yod du zin kyang nam mkha' ltar rnam pa thams cad du rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o @199b zhes
translated: This means that, like space, it is pure by nature in every way, even though such things as clouds, fog, and mist exist.🔽The Blessed One, purity is the absence of attainment and realization.

original: bshad pa'o // bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni 'thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa'i chos gnyis yod na /
analyzed: bshad pa'o // bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni 'thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa'i chos gnyis yod na /
translated: This means that, if there were two things, an object of attainment and an agent of attainment,

original: 'thob pa yang yod par 'gyur la /🔽mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / mngon par rtogs par byed pa gnyis yod na mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba yod par 'gyur na de la kun rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa rnams med pa tsam la yongs su grub pa'i chos nyid rnam par dag pa zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa de la 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: 'thob pa yang yod par 'gyur la / mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / mngon par rtogs par byed pa gnyis yod na mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba yod par 'gyur na de la kun rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa rnams med pa tsam la yongs su grub pa'i chos nyid rnam par dag pa zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa de la 'thob pa'am /
translated: And there would be attainment.

original: mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba gang yang med do //
translated: If there were both that which is to be realized and that which realizes, then there would be what is called “realization.” But in that complete purity which is the pure reality of the nonexistence of imagination and conceptualization, there is no attainment or realization at all, because it is established as the complete purity of the nonexistence of imagination and conceptualization.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mngon par grub pa med pa la rnam par dag pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir mngon par grub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mngon par grub pa med pa la rnam par dag pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir mngon par grub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: “Blessed One, complete purity is non-establishment” means that the non-establishment of imagined and conceptually differentiated phenomena such as form is established as complete purity. Therefore, it is called the characteristic of non-establishment.

original: rnam par dag pa ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba ma lags so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba ma lags so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams kun brtags pa ste /
translated: The desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm are imagined.

original: gang gi tshe de rnams su mi skye zhing mi 'byung ba de la rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de rnams su mi skye zhing mi 'byung ba de la rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one is not born in them, not arising, that is called purity.

original: de bas 'dod pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas 'dod pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “because the nature of the desire realm is not perceived.”🔽Blessed One, purity is not known.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni 'tshal ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag rang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni 'tshal ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag rang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means it is not the essence of self-awareness.🔽Because phenomena are foolish.

original: chos blun pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos blun pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos blun pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos blun pa zhes bshad do //
translated: This explains that phenomena are called foolish because they are free from conceptualization.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pas gzugs ma 'tshal to zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pas gzugs ma 'tshal to zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Blessed One does not see form, etc. means that he does not see any phenomena such as form, etc.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of the emptiness of intrinsic identity means that phenomena such as form, etc. are without identity.

original: 'tshal ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par dag pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan /🔽rnam par dag pas @200a * //
analyzed: 'tshal ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par dag pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan / rnam par dag pas @200a * //
translated: The phrase “he does not know” indicates the pure, nonconceptual characteristic.🔽The phrase “the Blessed One does not see form, etc.”

original: gzugs mi shes so zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos rnams dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan te /
analyzed: gzugs mi shes so zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos rnams dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan te /
translated: indicates the characteristic of the unreality of phenomena.

original: gnyis kyis ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The two phrases together indicate the characteristic of the unreality of the objective and subjective realms.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sman par mi bgyid gnod par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir de gnyis ka yang de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis shin tu rnam par dag
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sman par mi bgyid gnod par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir de gnyis ka yang de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis shin tu rnam par dag
translated: The Bhagavat said, “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom does not benefit or harm the knowledge of all aspects.”🔽🔽This is because both of those are completely pure by the character of suchness.

original: pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Lord: Because of the nonduality of the dharmadhatu.🔽Subhuti: Is then the perfection of wisdom not helpful to the knowledge of all modes?🔽The Lord: It is not helpful, nor is it harmful.🔽Subhuti: How then can it be called a perfection?🔽The Lord: It is called a perfection because it does not make either of the two extremes its objective support.

original: de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid la phan pa'am gnod par mi byed de /🔽nam mkha' la nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid la phan pa'am gnod par mi byed de / nam mkha' la nam mkha' bzhin no //

analyzed: de bas na chos kyi dbyings 'dug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba bshad de /

original: chos kyi sku ni dus thams cad du gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin na de la su zhig phan pa dang / gnod pa byed pa yod ces bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni dus thams cad du gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin na de la su zhig phan pa dang / gnod pa byed pa yod ces bstan pa'o //
translated: Subhuti: How then can it be called a perfection?🔽The Lord

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ni chos gang yongs su len pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu rnam par dag pa yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad med pa'i
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ni chos gang yongs su len pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu rnam par dag pa yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad med pa'i
translated: The Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is pure in that it does not appropriate any dharma.

original: mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is the characteristic of the extreme purity of the perfection of wisdom, which is the non-existence of all appropriations.

original: gal te chos 'ga' zhig yongs su 'dzin na rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos 'ga' zhig yongs su 'dzin na rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to appropriate any dharma, it would not be pure.

original: de'i 'og tu gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das bdag rnam par dag pa'i slad du gzugs rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni bdag dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das bdag rnam par dag pa'i slad du gzugs rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni bdag dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Then the elder Subhūti said, Blessed One, form is pure because of the purity of the self, and so on. This means that because the self is non-existent,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: form and so on are also non-existent.

original: 'dir ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba dngos po med pa la bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba dngos po med pa la bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, purity refers to non-existence.

original: de bas na rab 'byor bdag med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na rab 'byor bdag med pa'i phyir gzugs med pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, because of the nonexistence of a self, form is utterly pure.

original: sngar ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: sngar ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams par dag pa bstan to //
translated: Previously, the purity of the perfection of wisdom was taught.

original: da ni bdag med pa rnam par dag pa bstan te /
analyzed: da ni bdag med pa rnam par dag pa bstan te /
translated: Now, the purity of selflessness is taught.🔽Subhūti, because of the non-finding and non-losing of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor shes pa ma rnyed ma stor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngon ma byung ba'i ye shes thob cing rnyed pa med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes pa ma rnyed ma stor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngon ma byung ba'i ye shes thob cing rnyed pa med la /
translated: There is no obtaining and finding of wisdom that did not exist before.

original: ye shes rnyed pa yang chud zos pa med de /
analyzed: ye shes rnyed pa yang chud zos pa med de /
translated: And the found wisdom is not lost.

original: de ltar gnyis ka med pas byang chub kyang med do //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis ka med pas byang chub kyang med do //
translated: Since neither exists, enlightenment also does not exist.

original: byang chub ces bya ba yang kun brtags pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba yang kun brtags pa nyid do //
translated: What is called enlightenment is also just an imputation.

original: gnyis su ma mchis shing rnam @200b par dag pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis med pa'i phyir sngon gyi tshe yang ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pas nam mkha' bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
analyzed: gnyis su ma mchis shing rnam @200b par dag pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis med pa'i phyir sngon gyi tshe yang ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pas nam mkha' bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
translated: Non-duality and purity means that, because there is no duality of defilement and purification, it is like space, which is primordially pure by nature and without defilement.

original: yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs na yang nam mkha' bzhin du sngon ma byung ba'i rnam par byang ba med do /🔽// / bam po nyi shu pa /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs na yang nam mkha' bzhin du sngon ma byung ba'i rnam par byang ba med do / // / bam po nyi shu pa /
translated: And, like space, there is no prior purification that did not exist before.

original: de ltar rnam par dag pa bshad pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dag pa bshad pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Thus, having completed the explanation of purity,

original: de'i 'og tu zab par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir kun du mtha' yas pa bshad par brtsams pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zab par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir kun du mtha' yas pa bshad par brtsams pa /
translated: in order to generate conviction in its profundity, he begins the explanation of its universality:

original: gzugs kun tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste rtag pa dang chad pa med pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang dbus kyi mtha' med pa'i phyir kun tu mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kun tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste rtag pa dang chad pa med pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang dbus kyi mtha' med pa'i phyir kun tu mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: Because form is infinite, it is without beginning or end, and without middle or end.

original: de bas na rab 'byor mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na rab 'byor mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, it is because of the emptiness of the transcendence of extremes and the emptiness of no beginning or end.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:🔽Blessed One, why is it that those who think in this way are bodhisattvas with regard to this perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du de ltar rtog pa gang lags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa' lags zhes bya ba gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis ci'i phyir zhus she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du de ltar rtog pa gang lags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa' lags zhes bya ba gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis ci'i phyir zhus she na /
translated: Why did the elder Subhūti ask this?

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yul don zab pa de ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi lags sangs rgyas rnams kyi ma lags zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yul don zab pa de ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi lags sangs rgyas rnams kyi ma lags zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: Why is it that the object and meaning of the perfection of wisdom is profound, and is only for bodhisattvas, and not for the buddhas?

original: rab 'byor lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mthar phyin cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mthar phyin cing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because of the knowledge of the aspects of the path. This means that this perfection of wisdom is perfected,

original: bya ba byas pa ma yin gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa ma yin gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: It is not the performance of action, but the aspect of the path to omniscience.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyis zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “the bodhisattva’s.”🔽Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshu rol gyi 'gram mam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshu rol gyi 'gram mam /
translated: is not apprehended on this side of the river,

original: pha rol 'gram mam /
analyzed: pha rol 'gram mam /
translated: on the other side of the river,🔽or in between.

original: gnyis ka ma mchis pa la yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na pha rol tu son pa'am /🔽pha rol gyi mthar phyin pa'am /
analyzed: gnyis ka ma mchis pa la yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na pha rol tu son pa'am / pha rol gyi mthar phyin pa'am /
translated: What is the intention behind the statement that “it is not apprehended on this side of the river, on the other side of the river, or in between”?🔽Is it that it is a perfection because it has gone to the other side,🔽has reached the end of the other side,

original: pha rol gyi ngo bo nyid la pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya grang na /
analyzed: pha rol gyi ngo bo nyid la pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya grang na /
translated: or has the nature of the other side?🔽Even though it is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin @201a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin @201a * //
translated: it is not apprehended on this side of the river,🔽on the other side of the river,

original: du zin kyang /
analyzed: du zin kyang /
translated: or in between.

original: tshu rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas pha rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas 'gram 'di gnyis las ma gtogs pa gzhan du 'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: tshu rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas pha rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas 'gram 'di gnyis las ma gtogs pa gzhan du 'ang mi dmigs pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te /
translated: It does not exist on this side or on the other side, nor is it apprehended apart from these two sides.

original: tshu rol gyi 'gram zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshu rol gyi 'gram zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas su gtogs pa'o //
translated: This side is the conditioned,

original: pha rol gyi 'gram zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'gram zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas su gtogs pa'o //
translated: and the other side is the unconditioned.

original: de skad gsol pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad gsol pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Lord said, “Because of complete purity.”

original: gal te 'gram 'ga' zhig dmigs na de lta na ni rnam par dag pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'gram 'ga' zhig dmigs na de lta na ni rnam par dag pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If any side were apprehended, then it would not be complete purity.

original: gang gi phyir gang yang med pa de'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang yang med pa de'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: But because there is nothing at all, therefore it is completely pure.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir 'gram gnyis dang / gzhan na yang mi gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir 'gram gnyis dang / gzhan na yang mi gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of complete purity, it does not exist on either side or in between.

original: rab 'byor dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi phyir dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du yongs su shes pas tshu rol gyi 'du shes sam pha rol gyi 'du shes med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi phyir dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du yongs su shes pas tshu rol gyi 'du shes sam pha rol gyi 'du shes med de /
translated: The three times are the same because of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.

original: de bas na tshu rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas pha rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na tshu rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas pha rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, he does not stand on this shore or on the other shore.

original: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs par spyod pa'i dbang gis zab par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de'i 'og tu chags pa dang / ma chags pa bshad pa'i skabs phye ba yang ming du yang chags pa yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs par spyod pa'i dbang gis zab par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir / de'i 'og tu chags pa dang / ma chags pa bshad pa'i skabs phye ba yang ming du yang chags pa yin /
translated: In order to show that the profound is to be believed in by the power of the practice of the nonapprehension of an objective referent,🔽after that, the section on the explanation of attachment and nonattachment is opened up, beginning with the words,

original: mtshan mar yang chags pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar yang chags pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Attachment is also a name, a sign, a conceptualization, a designation, a conventional expression.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ming du 'dzin pa ni kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ming du 'dzin pa ni kun brtags pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of dharmas such as form as names is the imagined.

original: brda la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni rnam par brtags pa ste /
analyzed: brda la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni rnam par brtags pa ste /
translated: The apprehension of signs in conventional expressions is the discriminated.

original: gnyi ga yang sgrib pa'i bdag nyid yin pas chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang sgrib pa'i bdag nyid yin pas chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Both are called “attachment” because they have the nature of obscuration.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are signless,🔽and they are also nameless.

original: ming med pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ming med pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the domain of the perfection of wisdom.🔽Blessed One, it is amazing how well this perfection of wisdom has been taught to the bodhisattvas, and how well it has been brought to completion.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar legs par bshad cing legs par mthar gtugs pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar legs par bshad cing legs par mthar gtugs pa ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the knowledge of the aspects of the path.🔽If one perceives form as empty, that is attachment.

original: gzugs stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni @201b dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ltar sems pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni @201b dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ltar sems pa'o //
translated: This is thinking in terms of an object.🔽Form is not perceived as form.

original: gzugs la gzugs zhes bya bar 'du shes med do zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la gzugs zhes bya bar 'du shes med do zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: chos rnams la chos zhes bya bar 'du shes 'du shes med do zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la chos zhes bya bar 'du shes 'du shes med do zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'o //
translated: “The idea that phenomena are not phenomena” is non-appearance.

original: koo shi ka gzugs kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni chos rnams gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba med pas dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni chos rnams gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba med pas dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: “Kauśika, the nature of form cannot be dedicated” is the absence of dedication to awakening by way of apprehending, because the nature of phenomena is the characteristic of the abiding of phenomena.

original: go // rab 'byor khyod la chags pa'i rnam pa de bas kyang phra ba gzhan dag kyang bstan par bya zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la sgrib par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: go // rab 'byor khyod la chags pa'i rnam pa de bas kyang phra ba gzhan dag kyang bstan par bya zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la sgrib par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Subhūti, I will teach you other subtle aspects of attachment” is an obscuration to the aspect of the path that is knowledge of path aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab po zhes bya ba ni sngar gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa dang / mos par dka' bar yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa'i skabs phye bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab po zhes bya ba ni sngar gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa dang / mos par dka' bar yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa'i skabs phye bas /
translated: This is the section that explains the profundity of the perfection of wisdom and the difficulty of believing in it, which was opened up by the elder Śāriputra.

original: da ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bdag nyid kyis zab mo khong du chud pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bdag nyid kyis zab mo khong du chud pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate his own understanding of the profound, the elder Subhūti

original: bcom ldan 'das zab po zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zab po zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: says, “The Lord has said, ‘It is deep.’”🔽Subhūti, it is because all phenomena are naturally isolated.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dus thams cad du chags pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ni dus thams cad du chags pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa /
translated: Thus, all phenomena, at all times, are free from all attachments,

original: rang bzhin yongs su spangs pa rang bzhin gyis dben pa yin na /
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su spangs pa rang bzhin gyis dben pa yin na /
translated: free from the abandonment of their nature, and naturally isolated.

original: 'on kyang kun brtags pa'i chags pa yang dmigs la kun brtags pa'i chags pa dmigs kyang chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis gos pa med pa ste dben pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang kun brtags pa'i chags pa yang dmigs la kun brtags pa'i chags pa dmigs kyang chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis gos pa med pa ste dben pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: But it is also the case that imagined attachment is perceived, and that all phenomena are profound because they are essentially unstained and isolated.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma byas pa mngon par 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma byas pa mngon par 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not made, not brought about.

original: chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de la bsgrub par bya ba'am mngon par 'du bya ba med do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de la bsgrub par bya ba'am mngon par 'du bya ba med do //
translated: Because it is the essence of the Dharma Body, there is nothing to be accomplished or brought about in it.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin ni gnyis ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin ni gnyis ma yin te /
translated: The nature of phenomena is not dual,🔽it is just one.

original: gcig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du chos thams cad ngo bo nyid gcig na 'on kyang bdag nyid tha dad par snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du chos thams cad ngo bo nyid gcig na 'on kyang bdag nyid tha dad par snang ba'i phyir /
translated: All phenomena are of one essence in suchness, but because they appear as if they were different,

original: mngon par rtogs par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par dka' ba'o //
translated: it is difficult to realize.

original: de bzhin nyid chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin @202a * //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin @202a * //
translated: Suchness is the essence of phenomena, and so it is their nature.

original: zhes bya'o // de bzhin nyid de yang chos nyid gzhan gang gi rgyu yang ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de bzhin nyid de yang chos nyid gzhan gang gi rgyu yang ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: That thusness is not a nature because it is not the cause of any other reality.

original: de bzhin nyid de 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir sus kyang ma byas pas ma byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir sus kyang ma byas pas ma byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That thusness is not made by anyone because it is unconditioned.

original: de nyid bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa mngon par 'du byed pa gang gis kyang mngon par 'du ma byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa mngon par 'du byed pa gang gis kyang mngon par 'du ma byas pa'i phyir /
translated: That thusness is not conditioned by any conditioning of merit or demerit.

original: mngon par 'du ma byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du ma byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is unconditioned.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sus kyang ma mthong ma thos ma rtogs rnam par ma shes zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dmigs pa dang / dmigs par bya ba mnyam pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa de lta bu dag gi spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba ni du bas me mtshon pa ltar /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sus kyang ma mthong ma thos ma rtogs rnam par ma shes zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dmigs pa dang / dmigs par bya ba mnyam pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa de lta bu dag gi spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba ni du bas me mtshon pa ltar /
translated: The perfection of wisdom has not been seen, heard, discerned, or known by anyone. This is because the perfection of wisdom is the very essence of the sameness of the objective support and the supported, and therefore is not the domain of any such consciousnesses as seeing, etc., which are conceptual.

original: chos gzhan gyis bsam du mi nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos gzhan gyis bsam du mi nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is inconceivable. This means that it cannot be conceived by any other dharma, just as fire can be inferred from smoke, but not conceived.

original: de bas na gzugs kyis ma shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs kyis ma shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the perfection of wisdom is not known by form, etc.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i mtshan nyid du shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i mtshan nyid du shes par byed pa'o //
translated: It makes all dharmas unapprehendable. It makes them known to be unapprehendable in their essential nature.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyad par bgyi zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyad par bgyi zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la'o //
translated: How should one practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: rang bzhin shes pas chos thams cad la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin shes pas chos thams cad la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that one does not practice the perfection of wisdom if one practices all dharmas through knowing their nature,

original: gzugs la mi spyod na zhes bya ba'i 'gres so //
analyzed: gzugs la mi spyod na zhes bya ba'i 'gres so //
translated: [the Lord] says, If one does not practice form, etc.

original: lhag mthong gi shes pas chos kyi mtshan nyid la spyod na spyod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir 'gres gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi shes pas chos kyi mtshan nyid la spyod na spyod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir 'gres gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second [verse] shows that one does not practice if one practices the characteristics of dharmas through the knowledge of insight.

original: gzugs yongs su rdzogs pa'am yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa las dgongs te gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs yongs su rdzogs pa'am yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa las dgongs te gsungs pa'o //
translated: The completion or incompletion of form is said with reference to the completion of cultivation.

original: gzugs ma chags pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs sgrib pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ma chags pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs sgrib pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-attachment of form is the unobstructed form of reality.

original: de ltar spyod na gzugs chags pa med pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i tshe de ltar zhugs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid khong du chud pa'i tshe de ltar rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: de ltar spyod na gzugs chags pa med pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i tshe de ltar zhugs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid khong du chud pa'i tshe de ltar rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: Thus, if one practices, one is said to be “without the notion of form,” i.e., when one has entered into this practice, when one has penetrated the knowledge of all modes, one is said to have “fully understood.”

original: go // rab 'byor @202b ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i tshig dang / dge slong zhig gi tshig dang / brgya byin gyi tshig dang / bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dang / sba ba dang / mi nus pa'i tshig rnams ni thams cad kyang 'dra'o //
analyzed: go // rab 'byor @202b ngo mtshar du gyur pa'i tshig dang / dge slong zhig gi tshig dang / brgya byin gyi tshig dang / bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dang / sba ba dang / mi nus pa'i tshig rnams ni thams cad kyang 'dra'o //
translated: Subhuti: “Wondrous,” “monk,” “Indra,” “protection,” “safeguard,” “defense,” “inability” — all these words are the same.

original: gzugs rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni byed pa dang / mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i dngos por ro //
analyzed: gzugs rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni byed pa dang / mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i dngos por ro //
translated: “He does not build up form,” i.e., as an agent, as a characteristic, etc.

original: gzugs bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed do zhes bya ba ni rje khol gyi dngos por ro //
analyzed: gzugs bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed do zhes bya ba ni rje khol gyi dngos por ro //
translated: “He does not build up form as ‘mine,’” i.e., as a master or a servant.

original: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni gnas dang rten pa'i dngos por ro //
analyzed: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni gnas dang rten pa'i dngos por ro //
translated: “He does not build up form,” i.e., as a basis or as something based on a basis.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan mar yang rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni brdar btags pa'i dngos por ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan mar yang rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni brdar btags pa'i dngos por ro //
translated: The phrase one should not falsely project the signs of form refers to the entity that is a conventional symbol.

original: sangs rgyas stong bstan pa ni de dag de la dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas stong bstan pa ni de dag de la dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one thousand buddhas refers to the fact that they are the objects of that faith.

original: byams pas chos bshad pa zhus pa'i dus gsum char du yun 'di nyid bshad par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pas chos bshad pa zhus pa'i dus gsum char du yun 'di nyid bshad par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the time when Maitreya will teach the Dharma refers to the fact that the duration of all three times should be understood to be explained in this very context.

original: de'i 'og tu rab 'byor gzugs yongs su dag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos dmigs par gyur pa rnams dri ma med par gyur pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid de🔽yang rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rab 'byor gzugs yongs su dag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos dmigs par gyur pa rnams dri ma med par gyur pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid de🔽yang rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, the passage that begins with the words Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is pure because form is pure explains that the aspect of the path that is the knowledge of paths becomes even purer due to the stainlessness of the objects of observation that are the dharmas of form and so on.

original: rab 'byor gzugs la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du gnas gyur nas skye ba dang 'gag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs chos nyid kyi rang bzhin du gnas gyur nas skye ba dang 'gag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, the non-arising, non-ceasing, non-affliction, and non-purification of form is called its complete purity.

original: rnam par byang bar mi snang ba de'i tshe gzugs de yongs su dag pa zhes bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi snang ba de'i tshe gzugs de yongs su dag pa zhes bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: When form abides in the nature of reality, arising, ceasing, affliction, and purification do not appear. At that time, that form is called completely pure, not otherwise.

original: nam mkha' yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' la glo bur gyi sprin dang khug rna yod kyang de rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam mkha' yongs su dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' la glo bur gyi sprin dang khug rna yod kyang de rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because space is completely pure. Just as space, although having adventitious clouds and mist, is not impure because of its natural purity,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is also like that.

original: yongs su dag pa dang gos pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / smra ba med pa dang / rab tu brjod pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa'i phyir rnam pa drug gis nam mkha' dang mtshungs par bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang gos pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / smra ba med pa dang / rab tu brjod pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa'i phyir rnam pa drug gis nam mkha' dang mtshungs par bstan to //
