translated: It is shown to be like space in six ways: because of complete purity, because of non-attachment, because of non-grasping, because of non-utterance, because of non-expression, and because of non-apprehension.

original: nam mkha' smra ba med pa'i phyir zhes byang @203a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' smra ba med pa'i phyir zhes byang @203a * //
translated: Because space is non-utterance.

original: ni nam mkha' la de las gzhan pa rnams sna yang /🔽nam mkha' la ni smra ba'am /
analyzed: ni nam mkha' la de las gzhan pa rnams sna yang / nam mkha' la ni smra ba'am /
translated: In space, there is no utterance or expression of anything other than that.

original: mngon par brjod pa med do //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa med do //
translated: In space, there is no utterance or expression.

original: dper na nam mkha' la brag ca gnyis kyi sgra grag kyang /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la brag ca gnyis kyi sgra grag kyang /
translated: For example, even though the sound of two echoes occurs in space,

original: nam mkha' ni smra ba dang bcas pa'o zhes brjod du mi rung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni smra ba dang bcas pa'o zhes brjod du mi rung ba lta bu'o //
translated: it is not correct to say that space has utterance.

original: nam mkha' rab tu brjod pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu brjod pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nam mkha' rab tu brjod pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu brjod pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because space is non-expression. This means that by nature, there is no expression in space.

original: yang sgra tsam ni smra ba'o //
analyzed: yang sgra tsam ni smra ba'o //
translated: Moreover, mere sound is utterance.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i rab tu brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i rab tu brjod pa'o //
translated: The expression of expression is expression.

original: rab 'byor gzugs shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis chos thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis chos thams cad mthong ste /
translated: When one sees all phenomena with this perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i kun brtags pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa spros pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i kun brtags pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa spros pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: because of the absence of the stains of the imagined afflictions and conceptual thoughts of form and so forth,🔽it is the aspect of purity.

original: rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is free from all objects,🔽it is not apprehended.

original: dmigs su med pa'i rnam pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i phyir skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i rnam pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i rnam par mthong ba de'i tshe bdag nyid yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i ming du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i rnam pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i phyir skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i rnam pa dang / rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i rnam par mthong ba de'i tshe bdag nyid yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i ming du 'gyur ro //
translated: When one sees the aspect of non-apprehension, the aspect of non-production because of being fully accomplished, the aspect of non-cessation, the aspect of non-affliction because of being naturally isolated, and the aspect of non-purification, at that time one is called 'one who has attained purity'.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu yongs su dag par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu yongs su dag par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the perfection of wisdom as being utterly pure,

original: de'i 'og tu 'di la dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir de la mig gi nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshe 'di dang tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la 'byung ba'i phan yon rnams bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'di la dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir de la mig gi nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshe 'di dang tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la 'byung ba'i phan yon rnams bstan to //
translated: subsequently, in order to generate faith in it, the benefits that arise in this life and in future lives are taught by 'eye-disease will not occur' and so forth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni skye ba'am 'gag pa'am kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni skye ba'am 'gag pa'am kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: In the perfection of wisdom, there is no arising, no cessation, no affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'am /
translated: no purification,

original: yongs su bzung ba'am dor ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi snang ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba'am dor ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi snang ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that origination, cessation, and so on do not appear in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar 'du shes par yang mi byed la de ltar mi rtog cing zhes bya ba ni de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rin po che yon @203b tan mang po dang ldan pa yin no snyam du yang mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes par yang mi byed la de ltar mi rtog cing zhes bya ba ni de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rin po che yon @203b tan mang po dang ldan pa yin no snyam du yang mi rtog pa'o //
translated: One should not even form the notion that “this perfection is a jewel endowed with many good qualities.”

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang yang sgrub pa'am rnam par ston pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi 'gyur bar yongs su 'grub pas yongs su grub pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos gang yang sgrub pa'am rnam par ston pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi 'gyur bar yongs su 'grub pas yongs su grub pa de'i tshe /
translated: This perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, does not establish or reveal any dharma at all.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar snang ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar snang ste /
translated: This perfection of wisdom appears in that way when the perfection of wisdom is fully accomplished without change.

original: chos khyad par can gang yang bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
analyzed: chos khyad par can gang yang bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
translated: There is no conceit that thinks, “I will establish any special dharma.”

original: chos khyad par can rnams kyang bzung ngo snyam mam /
analyzed: chos khyad par can rnams kyang bzung ngo snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that you have grasped any special attributes?

original: sbyin no snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
analyzed: sbyin no snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
translated: Do you think, ‘I will give’?

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams bskyed do snyam mam chos ngan pa rnams dag go snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /🔽'khor ba'i chos rnams rgyun bcad do snyam mam /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams bskyed do snyam mam chos ngan pa rnams dag go snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med / 'khor ba'i chos rnams rgyun bcad do snyam mam /
translated: Do you think, ‘I will generate the uncontaminated dharmas’? Do you think, ‘I will purify the bad dharmas’?🔽Do you think, ‘I will cut the continuity of the dharmas of saṃsāra’?

original: rnam par byang ba rnams brtag par bya'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba rnams brtag par bya'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
translated: Do you think, ‘I will investigate the purified dharmas’?

original: bdag ni gcig go snyam pa'am tha dad do snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
analyzed: bdag ni gcig go snyam pa'am tha dad do snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
translated: Do you think, ‘I am one’ or ‘I am separate’?

original: bdag ni sngon ma byung ba las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i stobs kyis byung ba ste /
analyzed: bdag ni sngon ma byung ba las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i stobs kyis byung ba ste /
translated: Do you think, ‘I have arisen through the power of bodhisattva conduct from what was previously non-arisen’?

original: sgrib pa thams cad bral ba'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad bral ba'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
translated: Do you think, ‘I am free from all obscurations’?

original: sngon nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa las /
analyzed: sngon nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa las /
translated: Do you think, ‘Previously I was afflicted by the afflictions, the secondary afflictions, and so on,

original: phyis rnam par dag go snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
analyzed: phyis rnam par dag go snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
translated: and later I was purified’?

original: nag po'i chos rnams 'grib par bya zhing dkar po'i chos rnams rnam par 'phel bar bya'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
analyzed: nag po'i chos rnams 'grib par bya zhing dkar po'i chos rnams rnam par 'phel bar bya'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
translated: and the thought “I will diminish the black dharmas and increase the white dharmas.”

original: dus gsum du gtogs so snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
analyzed: dus gsum du gtogs so snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /
translated: There is no conceit that thinks “I am in the three times.”🔽There is no conceit that thinks “I will establish the three realms,”

original: khams gsum du dgod do snyam pa'am /🔽yang dag par bzla bar bya'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med /🔽bdag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: khams gsum du dgod do snyam pa'am / yang dag par bzla bar bya'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med / bdag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sbyin par byed pa'am /
translated: or “I will transcend them.”🔽There is no conceit that thinks “I am practicing the perfection of generosity, etc.,”

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa spong bar byed pa'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med do //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa spong bar byed pa'o snyam pa'i rlom sems kyang med do //
translated: or “I am abandoning the opposing side of stinginess, etc.”

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Subhūti, whether the Tathāgatas have arisen or not, the nature of dharmas is just this,

original: gang yang ci yang mi byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang ci yang mi byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and it is taught that nothing is done at all.

original: chos gnas pa 'di nyid mkhyen pas /
analyzed: chos gnas pa 'di nyid mkhyen pas /
translated: The Tathāgatas know this very nature of dharmas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba dag 'jig rten na snang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba dag 'jig rten na snang ste /
translated: The Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones appear in the world.

original: 'di nyid de dag gi mngon par @204a * //
analyzed: 'di nyid de dag gi mngon par @204a * //
translated: This is their realization,

original: rtogs pa dang / 'di nyid chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang / 'di nyid chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and this is the turning of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis su bskor ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni chos kyi 'khor lo gnyis su bskor ba yang ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, this is not a turning of the wheel of the Dharma that is twofold,🔽nor is it a turning of the wheel of the Dharma that is single.

original: gcig tu bskor ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad grangs las 'das pa'i phyir de skad bstan to //🔽chos gang yang bskor ba'am mi bskor bar bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro zhes bya ba'i 'du shes sam /
analyzed: gcig tu bskor ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad grangs las 'das pa'i phyir de skad bstan to // chos gang yang bskor ba'am mi bskor bar bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro zhes bya ba'i 'du shes sam /
translated: This is taught because ultimately all phenomena are beyond enumeration.🔽No phenomenon whatsoever is present in order to turn or not turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: rnam par rtog pa sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: This is the removal of the notion or concept that the wheel of the Dharma is turned.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of things. This means that the perfection of wisdom is the apprehension of the characteristic of the nonexistence of things in all dharmas.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chen mo ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig dgu bcu rtsa lngas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos thams cad la 'jug pa rgya cher ston te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chen mo ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig dgu bcu rtsa lngas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos thams cad la 'jug pa rgya cher ston te /
translated: With the ninety-five phrases beginning with “This perfection is great,” the elder Subhūti extensively teaches the engagement of the perfection of wisdom in all dharmas.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chen po zhes bya ba ni yul che ba dang / gsang ba chen po yul du gyur pa ston te /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chen po zhes bya ba ni yul che ba dang / gsang ba chen po yul du gyur pa ston te /
translated: Therein, “This perfection is great” teaches the greatness of the object and the greatness of the secret.

original: 'di ltar gsang ba ni gsum ste chos 'jug pa gsang ba dang / mngon par byang chub pa gsang ba dang / chos nyid kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gsang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsang ba ni gsum ste chos 'jug pa gsang ba dang / mngon par byang chub pa gsang ba dang / chos nyid kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gsang ba'o //
translated: Thus, the secret is threefold: the secret of engaging the Dharma, the secret of manifest enlightenment, and the secret of turning the wheel of Dharma.

original: de la chos rnams la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbang gis chos su 'du shes pa yang 'jug chos ma yin par 'du shes pa yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la chos rnams la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbang gis chos su 'du shes pa yang 'jug chos ma yin par 'du shes pa yang 'jug ste /
translated: In this regard, the perception of phenomena as phenomena by way of the conventional and the ultimate is engaged, and the perception of phenomena as not being phenomena is also engaged.

original: de bas na chos thams cad kyang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis yongs su stong zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad kyang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis yongs su stong zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “All phenomena are empty of the intrinsic nature of all phenomena.”

original: mngon par byang chub pa yang ston la mngon par byang chub pa med par yang mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa yang ston la mngon par byang chub pa med par yang mthong ste /
translated: The manifestation of manifest enlightenment is also shown, and the non-existence of manifest enlightenment is also seen.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya yang /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya yang /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The bodhisattva mahāsattvas, abiding in the perfection of wisdom, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par mtshang rgya ba ma mchis zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par mtshang rgya ba ma mchis zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: but do not fully awaken to any phenomenon at all.”

original: chos kyi 'khor lo yang bskor la chos gang yang bskor ba'am mi bskor bar bgyid pa @204b yang ma mchis te zhes bya bas ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gsang ba bstan to //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo yang bskor la chos gang yang bskor ba'am mi bskor bar bgyid pa @204b yang ma mchis te zhes bya bas ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gsang ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the secret of turning the wheel of Dharma.

original: de'i 'og tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba rnam pa brgyad kyis 'grel te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba rnam pa brgyad kyis 'grel te /
translated: Then, it is explained by the eight aspects of turning the wheel of Dharma:

original: chos med pa dang 'khor lo med pa dang / bskor ba med pa dang bshad pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa dang / 'chad pa po med pa dang nyan pa po med pa dang rtog pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos med pa dang 'khor lo med pa dang / bskor ba med pa dang bshad pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa dang / 'chad pa po med pa dang nyan pa po med pa dang rtog pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag med pa'o //
translated: The absence of Dharma, the absence of a wheel, the absence of turning, the absence of an essence of explanation, the absence of an expounder, the absence of a listener, the absence of conceptualization, and the absence of an ārya person.

original: de la chos med pa ni chos gang yang yongs su mthong ba yang ma mchis la chos gang yang yongs su ma mthong ba yang ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos med pa ni chos gang yang yongs su mthong ba yang ma mchis la chos gang yang yongs su ma mthong ba yang ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: Among those, the absence of Dharma is stated as “There is no Dharma whatsoever that is seen, and there is no Dharma whatsoever that is not seen.”

original: 'khor lo med pa ni 'di ltar gang bskor bar bgyi'am mi bskor bar bgyi ba'i chos de lta bu dmigs pa ma mchis te zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo med pa ni 'di ltar gang bskor bar bgyi'am mi bskor bar bgyi ba'i chos de lta bu dmigs pa ma mchis te zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: The absence of a wheel is stated in the passage beginning with: “That dharma which would be turned or not turned is not apprehended.”

original: bskor ba med pa ni stong pa nyid ni bskor bar bgyid pa'am mi bskor bar bgyid pa ma lags so //
analyzed: bskor ba med pa ni stong pa nyid ni bskor bar bgyid pa'am mi bskor bar bgyid pa ma lags so //
translated: The absence of turning is stated in the passage beginning with: “Emptiness does not turn or not turn.”

original: mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang smon pa ma mchis pa ni bskor bar bgyid pa'am mi bskor bar bgyid pa ma lags so zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang smon pa ma mchis pa ni bskor bar bgyid pa'am mi bskor bar bgyid pa ma lags so zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: The absence of a sign and the absence of a wish are stated in the passage beginning with: “The signless does not turn or not turn.”

original: bshad pa med pa ni de ltar na gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang / rab tu bstan pa dang zhes bya ba nas 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa med pa ni de ltar na gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang / rab tu bstan pa dang zhes bya ba nas 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The absence of explanation is stated in the passage beginning with: “Thus, the teaching of the perfection of wisdom, the demonstration of the perfection of wisdom,” and so on, up to: “This is the pure teaching of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: 'chad pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa de yang sus kyang ma bstan zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa de yang sus kyang ma bstan zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: The absence of explanation is stated in the passage beginning with: “Moreover, that teaching of the perfection of wisdom is not taught by anyone.”

original: nyan pa med pa ni sus kyang ma bzung ngo zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan pa med pa ni sus kyang ma bzung ngo zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: “No one hears” means no one apprehends.

original: rtogs pa med pa de ni sus kyang mngon sum du ma bgyis so zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa med pa de ni sus kyang mngon sum du ma bgyis so zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: “No one realizes” means no one makes it manifest.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag med pa ni de la ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa su yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag med pa ni de la ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa su yang ma mchis te /
translated: “There are no noble persons” means that no one passes into complete nirvāṇa in it.

original: chos bstan pa 'di la su 'ang sbyin gnas su 'gyur ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di la su 'ang sbyin gnas su 'gyur ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: “No one becomes a holy field of merit” means that no one becomes a recipient of gifts in this teaching of the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor nam mkha' med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ltar dmigs pa'i bdag nyid du med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ltar dmigs pa'i bdag nyid du med pa yin gyi /
translated: “Because space does not exist” means that it does not exist in the manner of being an object of perception, like space.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i bdag nyid du med pa ma yin no //🔽chos thams cad dmigs pa med par mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni kun brtags @205a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i bdag nyid du med pa ma yin no // chos thams cad dmigs pa med par mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni kun brtags @205a * //
translated: But it is not that it does not exist in the manner of being an objectless.

original: pa ste dmigs su med pa'i bdag nyid du mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: pa ste dmigs su med pa'i bdag nyid du mnyam pa'o //
translated: “Because all phenomena are the same in being objects of no perception” means that all phenomena are the same in being imagined, in being objects of no perception.

original: ming med pa dang lus med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i chos dang / gzugs kyi chos rnams tshig tu gyur pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ming med pa dang lus med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i chos dang / gzugs kyi chos rnams tshig tu gyur pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is nameless and bodiless. This means that formless dharmas and the words of form dharmas do not exist.

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar lus stong pa nam mkha' lta bu la dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba yang med do zhes so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar lus stong pa nam mkha' lta bu la dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba yang med do zhes so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the in-and-out breath is not apprehended. This means that in this way, the in-and-out breath does not exist in the body which is empty like space.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa gnyis tshig mngon par 'du byed pa yin pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te sngar rnam par brtags rnam par dpyad nas phyis
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa gnyis tshig mngon par 'du byed pa yin pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te sngar rnam par brtags rnam par dpyad nas phyis
translated: Because discursive thought and investigation are not apprehended. This is said because discursive thought and investigation are the verbal formative forces. It is said that after discursive thought and investigation,

original: tshig 'byin to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig 'byin to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: one then utters words.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gzugs med pas ming gi tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gzugs med pas ming gi tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregates of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not apprehended.

original: chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad 'gro ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad 'gro ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are without going.

original: chos thams cad gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la chos rnams ni chos rnams mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la chos rnams ni chos rnams mi 'dzin te /
translated: Because all phenomena are ungraspable. Phenomena do not grasp phenomena.

original: de bas na mi 'phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi 'phrogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not carried off.

original: chos thams cad shin tu byang zhing zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad shin tu byang bas skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyis zad par snang ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad shin tu byang zhing zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad shin tu byang bas skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyis zad par snang ba'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are utterly pure and extinguished. All phenomena appear to be extinguished by the nature of non-arising and non-cessation due to their utter purity.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa ste skye ba yang med 'gag pa yang med par snang ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa ste skye ba yang med 'gag pa yang med par snang ba'o //
translated: This means that all phenomena are empty, appearing without arising or ceasing.🔽Because death and rebirth are not perceived.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dag kun brtags pa'i dbang gis snang gi /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dag kun brtags pa'i dbang gis snang gi /
translated: This means that at that time, death and rebirth appear through the power of imagination,

original: don dam par ni ma yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin par shes pa'o //
translated: but not ultimately.🔽Because all phenomena are essentially indestructible.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid de //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid de //
translated: This means that the nature of all phenomena is thusness,

original: de yang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir mi 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir mi 'jig pa'o //
translated: and that is indestructible because it is unchanging.

original: rmi lam mthong ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi mthong ba'i mi'i rmi @205b lam gyi dngos po gang yin pa de mi dmigs shing med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang dngos po med par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam mthong ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi mthong ba'i mi'i rmi @205b lam gyi dngos po gang yin pa de mi dmigs shing med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang dngos po med par gnas pa'o //
translated: Just as the things of a dream are not apprehended and do not exist for the person who is awake, so all things are non-existent, being essentially pure.

original: 'di ni rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of non-purification,🔽because the existence of defilement is not apprehended.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa yod par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yod na ni rnam par byang zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur na 'di ltar chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa yod par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yod na ni rnam par byang zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur na 'di ltar chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: If there were defilement, there would be purification and complete clearing. But all things are essentially pure.

original: de bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med /
analyzed: de bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med /
translated: Therefore, there is no defilement,

original: rnam par byang ba yang med do //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang med do //
translated: and no purification.

original: 'di ni gnas ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gnas ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of non-abiding,🔽because all things are essentially non-abiding.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad dmigs su med pa de'i phyir gang na yang gnas par mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad dmigs su med pa de'i phyir gang na yang gnas par mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Because all dharmas are non-apprehensible. Because all dharmas are non-apprehensible, they are not apprehended anywhere.

original: chos thams cad ma nor ba de bzhin nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de ma nor ba'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i
analyzed: chos thams cad ma nor ba de bzhin nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de ma nor ba'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i
translated: Because all dharmas are to be fully awakened to as non-erroneous suchness. All dharmas are the nature of non-erroneous suchness. Because they are to be fully awakened to as the nature of non-erroneous suchness,

original: phyir chos thams cad zhi ba'o zhes shes rab nye bar gnas so //🔽'dod chags kyi mtshan ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chags par bya ba'i dngos po'i mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: phyir chos thams cad zhi ba'o zhes shes rab nye bar gnas so // 'dod chags kyi mtshan ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chags par bya ba'i dngos po'i mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: wisdom is present as the pacification of all dharmas.🔽Because the signs of attachment are non-apprehensible. Because there are no signs of things that are to be attached to.

original: zhe sdang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi rgyur gyur pa'i mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi rgyur gyur pa'i mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Because there is no hatred. Because there are no signs that become the cause of hatred.

original: 'di ni tshad ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of the immeasurable,🔽because all dharmas are without rising.🔽All dharmas are raised up by the power of the valid cognitions.

original: chos thams cad kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la chos thams cad ni tshad ma'i dbang gis kun nas bslang ba yin na 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi tshad kun du 'byung ba'i gzhi
analyzed: chos thams cad kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la chos thams cad ni tshad ma'i dbang gis kun nas bslang ba yin na 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi tshad kun du 'byung ba'i gzhi
translated: But this perfection of wisdom is the ground of the arising of the measure of all dharmas,

original: mi mthong ste de bas na tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthong ste de bas na tshad med pa'o //
translated: and it is not seen. Therefore it is immeasurable.🔽Because all dharmas are unmixed.

original: chos thams cad 'dres pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dres pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all dharmas are isolated.🔽Because the measure of all dharmas is not apprehended.

original: chos thams cad tshad ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya yod na tshad ma yang yod na gzhal bya yang yod par 'gyur na 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi tshad ma mi dmigs shing med pas de bas na gzhal bya med do
analyzed: chos thams cad tshad ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya yod na tshad ma yang yod na gzhal bya yang yod par 'gyur na 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi tshad ma mi dmigs shing med pas de bas na gzhal bya med do
translated: If the object of measure exists, then the valid cognition also exists. But in this way, the measure of all dharmas is not apprehended and does not exist. Therefore the object of measure does not exist.

original: // chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni @206a * //
analyzed: // chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni @206a * //
translated: Because all dharmas are unattached like space.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar chags pa med pa'o //
translated: All dharmas are unattached like space.

original: 'di ni mi rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of impermanence,🔽because all dharmas are indestructible.

original: chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir mi 'jig pa ste de bas na med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir mi 'jig pa ste de bas na med do //
translated: Thus, all dharmas are indestructible because they are unborn like the horns of a rabbit, etc. Therefore, they do not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ste med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ste med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist, they are impermanent, because the meaning of non-existence is the meaning of impermanence.🔽Because all dharmas are not fit to be clung to.

original: chos thams cad lhag par zhen par bya ba'i 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad lhag par zhen par bya ba'am /🔽gnas par bya ba'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad lhag par zhen par bya ba'i 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad lhag par zhen par bya ba'am / gnas par bya ba'am /
translated: Thus, all dharmas are not fit to be clung to,

original: nye bar spyad par bya ba'i 'os ma yin te de bas na sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar spyad par bya ba'i 'os ma yin te de bas na sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: to be abided in, or to be enjoyed. Therefore, they are suffering.

original: 'di ni stong pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of emptiness,🔽because the nature of all phenomena is not perceived.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of phenomena, which is to be suitable as form, to be the nature of experience, and so on, does not exist ultimately.

original: de bas na chos de dag ngo bo nyid des stong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na chos de dag ngo bo nyid des stong ngo //
translated: Therefore, those phenomena are empty of that nature.

original: 'di ni bdag ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of selflessness,🔽because all phenomena are free from attachment.

original: chos thams cad mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med do //
translated: Thus, phenomena such as form do not exist.

original: de'i phyir de dag mngon par zhen par bya ba'i 'os ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag mngon par zhen par bya ba'i 'os ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are not suitable to be objects of attachment.

original: de ltar na chos thams cad med pa ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad med pa ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: In this way, the nonexistence of all phenomena is selflessness.

original: stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa gnyis la don tha dad pa med du zin kyang brtags pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa yod do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa gnyis la don tha dad pa med du zin kyang brtags pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa yod do //
translated: Although emptiness and selflessness are not different in meaning, they are different in terms of their conceptual categories.

original: stong pa ni gzhan bral ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa ni gzhan bral ba ste /
translated: Emptiness is the absence of something else.

original: dper na chu dang bral ba'i phyir bum pa stong pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu dang bral ba'i phyir bum pa stong pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a pot is said to be empty when it is devoid of water.

original: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir chos de dag nyid la stong pa zhes kun tu rtog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir chos de dag nyid la stong pa zhes kun tu rtog go //
translated: In the same way, those very phenomena are imagined to be empty because they are devoid of the nature of their own characteristics and so on.

original: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams med pa nyid de /
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams med pa nyid de /
translated: Selflessness is the nonexistence of phenomena.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like an illusory elephant and so on.

original: chos de dag nyid /
analyzed: chos de dag nyid /
translated: Those very phenomena

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa dang bral bar brjod par 'dod pa la stong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa dang bral bar brjod par 'dod pa la stong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to be empty when they are devoid of their own characteristics and so on.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes dngos po med par brjod par 'dod pa la ni bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes dngos po med par brjod par 'dod pa la ni bdag med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But when it is intended to express their nonexistence as entities, it is said to be selflessness.

original: chos thams cad @206b mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la mtshan ma ni mtshan nyid yin na 'di ltar mtshan ma med pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad @206b mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la mtshan ma ni mtshan nyid yin na 'di ltar mtshan ma med pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are signless. A sign is a characteristic. Since they are thus signless, they are therefore without characteristics.

original: stong pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid gnyis pa med pa tsam la /
analyzed: stong pa stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid gnyis pa med pa tsam la /
translated: Because emptiness is not apprehended as emptiness.

original: stong pa stong pa nyid ces bya'i /
analyzed: stong pa stong pa nyid ces bya'i /
translated: This is the emptiness of emptiness.

original: stong pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not that there is any other dharma called “emptiness of emptiness.”🔽Because the emptiness of the great is not apprehended.

original: chen po stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs thams cad na yang gzugs rnams med pa tsam gyi che ba la chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs thams cad na yang gzugs rnams med pa tsam gyi che ba la chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The great is the non-existence of form in all directions. The emptiness of that is the emptiness of the great.

original: chen po stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not that there is any other dharma called “emptiness of the great.”

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of the emptiness of nature.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams dmigs su yod na ni de dag gi rang bzhin stong pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams dmigs su yod na ni de dag gi rang bzhin stong pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If conditioned and unconditioned phenomena were apprehended, they would not be empty of intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa ste /
translated: But all phenomena are empty.

original: de bas na de dag gi rang bzhin stong pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi rang bzhin stong pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, their intrinsic nature is empty. This is the meaning.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of generosity,🔽because stinginess is not apprehended.

original: ser sna dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ser sna dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de yang sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ser sna dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ser sna dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de yang sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The non-apprehension of stinginess in the perfection of wisdom is also the characteristic of generosity.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to the others.

original: 'di ni stobs bcu'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni stobs bcu'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the perfection of the ten powers,

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa ye shes bcu'i spyod yul yin na de dag gi spyod yul
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa ye shes bcu'i spyod yul yin na de dag gi spyod yul
translated: All aspects of all phenomena are the domain of the ten knowledges, such as the power of knowledge of bases and nonbases, and so on.

original: du ma gyur pa ni rnam pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma gyur pa ni rnam pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Those that are not their domain do not exist as aspects.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa de dag don dam par med pas de'i phyir stobs bcu'i yul du gyur pa rnam pa rnams med par mthong ba'i phyir stobs bcu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa de dag don dam par med pas de'i phyir stobs bcu'i yul du gyur pa rnam pa rnams med par mthong ba'i phyir stobs bcu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Thus, because those aspects do not exist ultimately, the ten powers see the nonexistence of aspects that are the domain of the ten powers.🔽Because the knowledge of path aspects is not discouraged.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid zhum pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni chos @207a * //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid zhum pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni chos @207a * //
translated: The knowledge of path aspects of bodhisattvas is not discouraged by the sufferings of samsara.

original: gang yang zhum pa med de de bas na thams cad du zhum pa med pa'i rang bzhin lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang zhum pa med de de bas na thams cad du zhum pa med pa'i rang bzhin lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there is no discouragement at all, therefore the nature of being without discouragement in all situations is called the perfection of fearlessness in knowing the aspects of the path.🔽Because there is no attachment or obstruction to knowledge in all situations.

original: thams cad du ye shes chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes ni thams cad du chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad du ye shes chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes ni thams cad du chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva’s knowledge is without attachment and without obstruction in all situations.

original: de bas na de so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of correct understanding.🔽Because it transcends all the dharmas of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyan thos la sogs pa la med pas de'i phyir de sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes🔽bya bar bgrang ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyan thos la sogs pa la med pas de'i phyir de sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes🔽bya bar bgrang ngo //
translated: Thus, since that perfection of wisdom does not exist for the śrāvakas, etc., therefore it is counted as an unshared quality of the Buddha.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the transcendent perfection of the Tathagata,🔽because it is the Tathagata himself who is the teaching of all the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gis ni de bzhin du gsung ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gis ni de bzhin du gsung ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the verbal definition: he is called the Tathagata because he speaks the truth.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa thams cad la de bzhin du dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa thams cad la de bzhin du dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The transcendent perfection of wisdom, which is the object of the same perception in all the teachings of the Buddha, is called the transcendent perfection of the Tathagata.

original: 'di ni rang byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rang byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: This is the transcendent perfection of self-originated gnosis,🔽because it is the mastery over all things.

original: chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad de'i dbang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad de'i dbang du 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, all things are subject to it,

original: de'i phyir rang gis chos thams cad zil gyi gnon pas rang byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis chos thams cad zil gyi gnon pas rang byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and therefore it is called the transcendent perfection of self-originated gnosis, because it is self-originated and dominates all things.

original: brgya byin gyis bsngags pa'i tshig dang / gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i tshig dang / bcom ldan 'das rjes su yi rang ba'i tshig rnams ni brda phrad par sla bas mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: brgya byin gyis bsngags pa'i tshig dang / gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i tshig dang / bcom ldan 'das rjes su yi rang ba'i tshig rnams ni brda phrad par sla bas mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The words of praise by Śakra, the words of the elder Śāriputra, and the words of the Blessed One’s approval are easy to understand, so they are as they appear in the sūtra.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gzugs la mi gnas pa de'i tshe gzugs la brtson par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems pa'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes ni chos gang la yang mi gnas
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gzugs la mi gnas pa de'i tshe gzugs la brtson par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems pa'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes ni chos gang la yang mi gnas
translated: When practicing the perfection of wisdom, if you do not dwell on form, at that time you are making effort with regard to form. This is the knowledge of the aspects of the path of the bodhisattva. The wisdom of the knowledge of the aspects of the path does not dwell on any phenomenon.

original: te / de bas na mi gnas pa nyid de'i brtson par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: te / de bas na mi gnas pa nyid de'i brtson par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, not dwelling is called “making effort.”

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs la brtson par mi byed de 'di ltar @207b gzugs la brtson par mi byed pa 'di lta bu ni gzugs la brtson par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la 'gres snga mar ni gnas pa bkag go //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs la brtson par mi byed de 'di ltar @207b gzugs la brtson par mi byed pa 'di lta bu ni gzugs la brtson par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la 'gres snga mar ni gnas pa bkag go //
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, a bodhisattva does not strive in form, and so on.

original: 'dir ni bsgrub pa bkag go //
analyzed: 'dir ni bsgrub pa bkag go //
translated: Here, the establishment is negated.

original: gzugs sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas dus gsum char du yang mi dmigs par ston to //
analyzed: gzugs sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas dus gsum char du yang mi dmigs par ston to //
translated: By saying “form is not apprehended in the past,” and so on, it shows that it is not apprehended in any of the three times.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar gzugs kyi zab pa gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zab pa zhes bya ba kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir don dam par gzugs nyid med pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar gzugs kyi zab pa gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zab pa zhes bya ba kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir don dam par gzugs nyid med pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra, it is like this: the profundity of form is not form. This is said because ultimately form itself does not exist, since what is called “profundity” is an imputation.

original: zab pa'i 'gres dang / gting dpag dka' ba'i 'gres dang / tshad med pa'i 'gres dang / brgya byin gyi tshig dang / lung bstan pa thob pa dang / 'brog dgon pa'i dpe dang / rgya mtsho chen po'i dpe dang / dpyid kyi dpe dang /
analyzed: zab pa'i 'gres dang / gting dpag dka' ba'i 'gres dang / tshad med pa'i 'gres dang / brgya byin gyi tshig dang / lung bstan pa thob pa dang / 'brog dgon pa'i dpe dang / rgya mtsho chen po'i dpe dang / dpyid kyi dpe dang /
translated: The repetition of “profound,” “difficult to fathom,” “immeasurable,” “Śakra,” “receiving a prophecy,” “the example of a wilderness,” “the example of the great ocean,” “the example of spring,”

original: sbrum ma'i dpe dang / rjes su bzung zhing yongs su bstan pa'i tshig 'di rnams ni brda phrad par sla'o //
analyzed: sbrum ma'i dpe dang / rjes su bzung zhing yongs su bstan pa'i tshig 'di rnams ni brda phrad par sla'o //
translated: “the example of a pregnant woman,” and “being accepted and taught” are easy to understand.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rtags rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rtags rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two signs of the perfection of the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom:

original: chos thams cad 'phel ba dang / 'grib par mi mthong ba dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'phel ba dang / 'grib par mi mthong ba dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid mthong ba'o //
translated: not seeing any increase or decrease in any phenomena and seeing the characteristics of phenomena.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa la rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba yang /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa la rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba yang /
translated: The teaching on the inconceivable and the non-occurrence of conceptualization in regard to the inconceivable

original: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rtags so //
translated: are also signs of the perfection of cultivation.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i rtags ni gzugs su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go //🔽gzugs kyi mtshan mar mi rtog /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i rtags ni gzugs su mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go // gzugs kyi mtshan mar mi rtog /
translated: The sign of practicing the six perfections is:

original: rnam par mi rtog go //🔽gzugs kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog go // gzugs kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog /
translated: One does not conceptualize form, does not conceptualize about form.🔽One does not conceptualize the sign of form, does not conceptualize about the sign of form.

original: rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog go zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One does not conceptualize the intrinsic nature of form, does not conceptualize about the intrinsic nature of form.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis chos rnams su mi rtog go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis chos rnams su mi rtog go //
translated: One does not conceptualize phenomena through the concentration on emptiness.

original: tshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mtshan mar mi rtog go //
analyzed: tshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mtshan mar mi rtog go //
translated: One does not conceptualize signs through the concentration on signlessness.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rang bzhin du mi rtog go //🔽kun brtags pa la rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rang bzhin du mi rtog go // kun brtags pa la rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: One does not conceptualize intrinsic natures through the concentration on wishlessness.🔽One does not conceptualize the imputed.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: One does not conceptualize the dependent.

original: sngar ni de bzhin nyid zab pas zab pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: sngar ni de bzhin nyid zab pas zab pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Previously, the profound was taught as the profundity of suchness.

original: da ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa la sgro btags nas zab pa bshad pa ni gdul ba'i bsam pa sna tshogs kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa la sgro btags nas zab pa bshad pa ni gdul ba'i bsam pa sna tshogs kyi phyir ro //
translated: Now, the profundity of suchness is explained by superimposing the characteristics of suchness onto form and so on because of the various inclinations of those to be tamed.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi dag @208a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi dag @208a * //
translated: Blessed One, all phenomena are pure.🔽

original: pa'i phung po zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi phung po dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa'i phung po zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi phung po dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Blessed One, the phrase “aggregate of purity of all phenomena” means “aggregate of all pure phenomena.”🔽Blessed One, it is amazing that there are not many obstacles.

original: bcom ldan 'das bar chad mang du mi 'byung ba ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni legs par 'gyur ba la bgegs mang ngo snyam du bsams nas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bar chad mang du mi 'byung ba ni ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni legs par 'gyur ba la bgegs mang ngo snyam du bsams nas gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is said because it is thought that there are many obstacles to what is good.

original: de'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos klog pa'i bsod nams bstan pa ni brda phrad sla'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos klog pa'i bsod nams bstan pa ni brda phrad sla'o //
translated: After that, the merit of reading the holy Dharma is taught, which is easy to understand.

original: lnga brgya tha ma zhes bya ba ni brgya phrag lnga bsdus pa la lnga brgya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lnga brgya tha ma zhes bya ba ni brgya phrag lnga bsdus pa la lnga brgya zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase “in the final five hundred years” means that five hundred years is a collection of five hundred groups of one hundred.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus ni lo lnga stong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus ni lo lnga stong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the time when the holy Dharma of the Tathāgata remains is five thousand years.

original: lo lnga stong la lo lnga brgya lnga brgya'i dbang du byas la phyed phyed du bcad na lnga brgya phrag bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo lnga stong la lo lnga brgya lnga brgya'i dbang du byas la phyed phyed du bcad na lnga brgya phrag bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: In five thousand years, if five hundred years are taken as a unit and divided in half, there are ten groups of five hundred.

original: de la le'u bcu ste thog mar khong du chud pa'i le'u dang / sgrub pa'i le'u dang / lung gi le'u ste /
analyzed: de la le'u bcu ste thog mar khong du chud pa'i le'u dang / sgrub pa'i le'u dang / lung gi le'u ste /
translated: It has ten chapters: the chapter on initial understanding, the chapter on practice, and the chapter on transmission.

original: le'u gsum mo //
analyzed: le'u gsum mo //
translated: There are ten chapters in the Abhidharmakośa. The first three chapters are the chapter on the comprehended, the chapter on practice and the chapter on scriptural transmission.

original: de la khong du chud pa'i le'u la yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: de la khong du chud pa'i le'u la yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: There are three divisions in the chapter on the comprehended.

original: dgra bcom pa'i le'u dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i le'u dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i le'u dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i le'u dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i le'u'o //
translated: They are the chapter on arhats, the chapter on nonreturners and the chapter on stream enterers.

original: bsgrub pa'i le'u la yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i le'u la yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: There are three divisions in the chapter on practice.

original: lhag mthong gi le'u dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u dang / tshul khrims kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi le'u dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u dang / tshul khrims kyi le'u'o //
translated: They are the chapter on insight, the chapter on concentration and the chapter on ethics.

original: lung gi le'u yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: lung gi le'u yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: There are three divisions in the chapter on scriptural transmission.

original: chos mngon pa'i sde snod dang / mdo sde'i sde snod dang / 'dul ba'i sde snod de le'u dgu dang / rtags tsam 'jigs pa'i le'u dang bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i sde snod dang / mdo sde'i sde snod dang / 'dul ba'i sde snod de le'u dgu dang / rtags tsam 'jigs pa'i le'u dang bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: They are the Abhidharma Piṭaka, the Sūtra Piṭaka and the Vinaya Piṭaka. Thus there are nine chapters and the tenth chapter is the mere enumeration of the signs.

original: de la le'u re re la yang lo lnga brgya lnga brgya thogs te /
analyzed: de la le'u re re la yang lo lnga brgya lnga brgya thogs te /
translated: Each chapter lasts for five hundred years.

original: de ltar le'u bcu po dag gis lnga brgya phrag bcu la lo lnga stong du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar le'u bcu po dag gis lnga brgya phrag bcu la lo lnga stong du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the ten chapters make up ten periods of five hundred years, which make up five thousand years.

original: de la lnga brgya thams cad kyi dang po la dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: de la lnga brgya thams cad kyi dang po la dgra bcom pa /
translated: In the first period of five hundred years, the Arhats

original: lnga brgya gnyis pa la phyir mi 'ong ba /
analyzed: lnga brgya gnyis pa la phyir mi 'ong ba /
translated: In the second period of five hundred years, the Anāgāmins

original: lnga brgya gsum pa la rgyun tu zhugs pa /🔽lnga brgya bzhi pa la lhag mthong /
analyzed: lnga brgya gsum pa la rgyun tu zhugs pa / lnga brgya bzhi pa la lhag mthong /
translated: In the third period of five hundred years, the Srotāpannas🔽In the fourth period of five hundred years, the practice of insight

original: lnga pa la ting nge 'dzin /
analyzed: lnga pa la ting nge 'dzin /
translated: In the fifth period of five hundred years, the practice of concentration

original: drug pa la tshul khrims /
analyzed: drug pa la tshul khrims /
translated: In the sixth period of five hundred years, the practice of morality

original: bdun pa la chos mngon pa ;
analyzed: bdun pa la chos mngon pa ;
translated: In the seventh period of five hundred years, the Abhidharma

original: brgyad pa la mdo sde /
analyzed: brgyad pa la mdo sde /
translated: In the eighth period of five hundred years, the Sutras

original: dgu pa la 'dul ba /
analyzed: dgu pa la 'dul ba /
translated: In the ninth period of five hundred years, the Vinaya

original: lnga brgya bcu pa la rtags tsam ste /
analyzed: lnga brgya bcu pa la rtags tsam ste /
translated: In the tenth period of five hundred years, only the outward marks of the religious life remain.

original: 'di nyid la brgya pa tha ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la brgya pa tha ma zhes bya'o //
translated: This period is called the last period of five hundred years.🔽According to another opinion, the period of five hundred years is counted from the Parinirvāṇa and not from the nirvana without a remainder of clinging.

original: kha cig na re mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad mi lo lnga brgya thub ste de la lo lnga bcu pa snga ma la ni mi rnams kha dog dang gzugs dang stobs dang / @208b shes rab la sogs pa mngon par 'phel ba yin la lnga bcu pa phyi ma la ni 'grib pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig na re mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad mi lo lnga brgya thub ste de la lo lnga bcu pa snga ma la ni mi rnams kha dog dang gzugs dang stobs dang / @208b shes rab la sogs pa mngon par 'phel ba yin la lnga bcu pa phyi ma la ni 'grib pa yin no //
translated: In the first period of five hundred years, the human life expectancy is five hundred years; in the second period, it is two hundred and fifty years.

original: de bzhin du dus kyi mtha' bstan pa 'grib pa'i dus kyang lnga bcu pa phyi ma dang 'dra bas lnga brgya pa tha ma zhes gdags so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus kyi mtha' bstan pa 'grib pa'i dus kyang lnga bcu pa phyi ma dang 'dra bas lnga brgya pa tha ma zhes gdags so zhes zer ro //
translated: Likewise, the period of decline of the teaching is the same as the latter half of the five hundred year period, and so is designated as the final five hundred years.

original: yon tan gyi phan yon thams cad bstan pa ni brda phrad sla'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi phan yon thams cad bstan pa ni brda phrad sla'o //
translated: The benefits of the virtues are easy to understand.

original: bdud kyi las rnams ni spobs pa phyis te skyes na thogs par 'gyur ba dang / spobs pa ha cang myur bar skyes na nga rgyal can du 'gyur ba dang / ma gus par byed pa dang / glal ba dang / dregs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las rnams ni spobs pa phyis te skyes na thogs par 'gyur ba dang / spobs pa ha cang myur bar skyes na nga rgyal can du 'gyur ba dang / ma gus par byed pa dang / glal ba dang / dregs pa'o //
translated: The works of Mara are as follows: if eloquence arises later, it will be impeded; if eloquence arises too quickly, one will become proud; one will be disrespectful; one will yawn; and one will be arrogant.

original: rgod ces bya ba ni chos 'chad pa'i tshe rgod pa'am phan tshun kyal ka byed pa'o ;
analyzed: rgod ces bya ba ni chos 'chad pa'i tshe rgod pa'am phan tshun kyal ka byed pa'o ;
translated: Levity is when one is frivolous or plays jokes on others while expounding the Dharma.

original: / phan tshun steg cing zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig dgod bro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: / phan tshun steg cing zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig dgod bro bar byed pa'o //
translated: Mutual flattery is when one makes jokes with others.

original: phan tshun bshes gnyen pa la chags zhes bya ba ni phan tshun sems bsrung ba'i phyir byed kyi dad pas byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun bshes gnyen pa la chags zhes bya ba ni phan tshun sems bsrung ba'i phyir byed kyi dad pas byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Mutual attachment to friendship is when one acts out of concern for the other's feelings, not out of faith.

original: yi ge gzhan la chags shing tshig gi don mi shes pa zhes kyang 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: yi ge gzhan la chags shing tshig gi don mi shes pa zhes kyang 'byung ngo ;
translated: And also, “attached to other letters, not knowing the meaning of the words.”

original: / glal zhing 'dzin na zhes bya ba la glal ba la sogs pa 'di lnga las snga ma ni yi ger 'bri ba'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: / glal zhing 'dzin na zhes bya ba la glal ba la sogs pa 'di lnga las snga ma ni yi ger 'bri ba'i tshe na'o //
translated: “ Yawning and holding” means that from among these five, yawning, etc., the former is when writing the letters,

original: 'dir ni 'dzin pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'dzin pa'i tshe'o //
translated: and this is when holding.

original: 'gro ba'i sems bskyed pa ji snyed byung ba /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sems bskyed pa ji snyed byung ba /
translated: “ As many times as the mind of going arises,🔽for that many eons one will hold” means that one must strive at this perfection of wisdom for eons equal to the number of times the mind of going arises, because it is wayward wisdom.

original: de snyed kyi bskal pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni slar 'gro ba'i sems bskyed pa snyed kyi bskal par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtson par bya dgos te 'chal ba'i shes rab yin pas de snyed kyi bskal pas yongs🔽su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de snyed kyi bskal pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni slar 'gro ba'i sems bskyed pa snyed kyi bskal par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtson par bya dgos te 'chal ba'i shes rab yin pas de snyed kyi bskal pas yongs🔽su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: For that many eons one will be fully ripened.

original: de dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shing gi rtsa ba sbangs te zhes bya ba ni dper na shing gi rtsa ba spangs te yal ga dang 'dab ma dang / lo ma la sgrub pa dag don ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'grub pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shing gi rtsa ba sbangs te zhes bya ba ni dper na shing gi rtsa ba spangs te yal ga dang 'dab ma dang / lo ma la sgrub pa dag don ji lta ba bzhin du mi 'grub pa de bzhin du /
translated: Those are the root of the tree of the knowledge of all aspects is watered, which is to say, for example, that if the root of a tree is watered, then its branches, leaves, and foliage are established, and the purpose is accomplished.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shing ljon pa med par nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yal ga dang lo ma la sogs pa lta bu yang thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shing ljon pa med par nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yal ga dang lo ma la sogs pa lta bu yang thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the same way, without the tree of the knowledge of all aspects, one will not attain the branches, leaves, and so on of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: ji ltar khyi rje bo'i zan zhim po rnyed sla ba bor te mi'i zan btsal na mi rnyed pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar khyi rje bo'i zan zhim po rnyed sla ba bor te mi'i zan btsal na mi rnyed pa'am /
translated: Just as a dog, having found the delicious food of its master, abandons it, and seeks human food, but does not find it,

original: cung zad cig rnyed par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: cung zad cig rnyed par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: or finds a little bit, in the same way, here also, it should be applied.

original: ji ltar la la zhig glang po che rnyed kyang bor te /
analyzed: ji ltar la la zhig glang po che rnyed kyang bor te /
translated: Just as someone, having found an elephant, abandons it,

original: bdag ni glang po che'i rjes 'dod kyi glang po che ni mi 'dod do zhes zer ba @209a * //
analyzed: bdag ni glang po che'i rjes 'dod kyi glang po che ni mi 'dod do zhes zer ba @209a * //
translated: I want the elephant's footprint, not the elephant.

original: de dpyas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dpyas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is how the analogy should be applied.

original: ba lang gi rjes kyi dpe dang shing mkhan rnam par rgyal ba'i khang pa dbub par 'dod pa nyi ma dang zla ba'i gzhal med khang gi dkyil 'khor tshol zhing rnam par rgyal ba'i khang pa yang 'di tsam mo zhes bya ba'i dpe yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi rjes kyi dpe dang shing mkhan rnam par rgyal ba'i khang pa dbub par 'dod pa nyi ma dang zla ba'i gzhal med khang gi dkyil 'khor tshol zhing rnam par rgyal ba'i khang pa yang 'di tsam mo zhes bya ba'i dpe yang de bzhin no //
translated: The analogy of the cow's footprint, and the analogy of the carpenter who, wanting to build a palace like Indra's palace, searches for the site of the palace of the sun and moon, thinking, The palace will be this big, are also like that.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni spobs pa med pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni spobs pa med pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is without eloquence means that it is non-conceptual.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba ni rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba ni rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inconceivable means that it transcends the domain of speculation.

original: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur bar yongs su 'grub par yongs su grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur bar yongs su 'grub par yongs su grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unborn and unceasing means that it is established as unchanging.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing /
translated: It is without defilement and

original: rnam par byang ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: without purification, because it is pure by nature.

original: 'khrugs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without disturbance, because it is always in meditative equipoise.

original: brjod du med pa ni so so rang gis rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni so so rang gis rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inexpressible, because it is known personally.

original: smrar med pa ni /
analyzed: smrar med pa ni /
translated: It is beyond speech,

original: sgra las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is beyond sound.

original: rab tu brjod du med pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu brjod du med pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is utterly inexpressible, because it is beyond thought and investigation.

original: dmigs su med pa ni dngos por dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa ni dngos por dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without reference point, because it is free from all reference points related to entities.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di dngos po med ces bya bar 'du shes na de yang bdud kyi las so zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i 'du shes kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa la rim gror mi
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di dngos po med ces bya bar 'du shes na de yang bdud kyi las so zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i 'du shes kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa la rim gror mi
translated: If they think, ‘This profound perfection of wisdom is non-entity,’ that too is the work of Māra.”

original: byed pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The fault of action.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yi ge ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa dang / mnyan du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yi ge ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa dang / mnyan du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is without letters. This is because it is inexpressible and cannot be heard.

original: bdud kyi las lhag ma rnams ni brda phrad par sla'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las lhag ma rnams ni brda phrad par sla'o //
translated: The remaining works of Mara are easy to understand.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bskyed pa'i phyir don dam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bskyed pa'i phyir don dam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed pa yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Subhuti, this perfection of wisdom generates the ten powers of the Tathagata. This shows that the ultimate Tathagata is generated because it generates the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'jig rten ston pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu gcig gis 'jig rten ston par bshad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten ston pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu gcig gis 'jig rten ston par bshad de /
translated: Showing the world means showing the world in eleven ways.

original: phung po'i 'jig rten ston pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin brtags pa dmigs su med @209b par ston pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang / dbye ba la sogs pa ston pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ston pa dang /
