analyzed: phung po'i 'jig rten ston pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin brtags pa dmigs su med @209b par ston pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang / dbye ba la sogs pa ston pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ston pa dang /
translated: the world of the aggregates, the nature of all phenomena, the absence of reference points, the conduct of the minds of all sentient beings, their classifications, and so forth, the suchness of all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid du ston pa dang / byas pa gzo zhing byas pa tshor ba'i dbang dang / chos thams cad shes pa po med cing /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid du ston pa dang / byas pa gzo zhing byas pa tshor ba'i dbang dang / chos thams cad shes pa po med cing /
translated: the characteristic of all phenomena being without characteristics, the power of being grateful and appreciative, and the absence of a knower and a seer of all phenomena.

original: mthong ba po med par ston pa dang / ma mthong ba'i chos thams cad ston pa dang / 'jig rten stong pa nyid du brjod pa rig par byed shes par byed /
analyzed: mthong ba po med par ston pa dang / ma mthong ba'i chos thams cad ston pa dang / 'jig rten stong pa nyid du brjod pa rig par byed shes par byed /
translated: It is the power of teaching the unseen phenomena, of teaching the world to be empty, of making it known, of making it understood, and of revealing it.

original: rnam par shes par byed ston par byed pa'i dbang dang / 'jig rten 'di bsam gyis mi khyab cing dben la /
analyzed: rnam par shes par byed ston par byed pa'i dbang dang / 'jig rten 'di bsam gyis mi khyab cing dben la /
translated: It is the power of teaching that this world is inconceivable, secluded,

original: nang la sogs pa stong zhing zhi bar ston pa dang / 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol po'i 'du shes med pas so //
analyzed: nang la sogs pa stong zhing zhi bar ston pa dang / 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol po'i 'du shes med pas so //
translated: and the inner, etc., are empty and peaceful.

original: de la rab 'byor phung po lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten du gsungs so //
analyzed: de la rab 'byor phung po lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten du gsungs so //
translated: Therein, Subhūti, the Tathāgata has declared the five aggregates to be the world.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phung po lnga po 'di dag 'jig par ston pa ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phung po lnga po 'di dag 'jig par ston pa ma yin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not teach the destruction of these five aggregates,🔽nor does it teach their utter destruction.

original: rab tu 'jig par ston pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phung po'i de bzhin nyid 'ba' zhig mthong gi kun brtags pa'i phung po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu 'jig par ston pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni phung po'i de bzhin nyid 'ba' zhig mthong gi kun brtags pa'i phung po ni ma yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom sees only the reality of the aggregates, not the imagined aggregates.

original: 'jig pa dang rab tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni chud za ba dang ma rung bar 'gyur ba la bya'o ;
analyzed: 'jig pa dang rab tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni chud za ba dang ma rung bar 'gyur ba la bya'o ;
translated: “Destruction” and “utter destruction” refer to loss and ruin.

original: / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang /
analyzed: / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang /
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid la med cing mi dmigs na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs yod pa'am dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pas mnyam pas mnyam par gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid la med cing mi dmigs na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs yod pa'am dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pas mnyam pas mnyam par gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: This is the equality of the object of apprehension and the apprehender.🔽When one has become equalized,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la /
translated: in the non-conceptual perfection of wisdom,🔽even the perfection of wisdom itself does not appear, let alone form, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi snang na gzugs la sogs pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi snang na gzugs la sogs pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa ni chos nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba ni sems kyi chos nyid gzugs pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa ni chos nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba ni sems kyi chos nyid gzugs pas /
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata, by the true nature of things, knows the minds of those beings, whether they are contracted or distracted.

original: sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin zhing med par mkhyen pa la sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa @210a * //
analyzed: sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin zhing med par mkhyen pa la sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa @210a * //
translated: The knowledge that the mind's concentration and elaborations are not real suchness and do not exist is the knowledge of the concentration and elaborations.🔽

original: mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the mind's withdrawal and proliferation as not being the real nature of things is called the knowledge of the mind's withdrawal and proliferation.

original: de nas yang sems bsdus pa dang spros pa de dag ji ltar mkhyen zhes gsol pa dang / zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nas yang sems bsdus pa dang spros pa de dag ji ltar mkhyen zhes gsol pa dang / zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: Then, when asked how those withdrawn and proliferating minds are known, it is taught by exhaustion, separation from attachment, cessation, and so on.

original: sems can zad pa'i chos nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid dang 'gag pa'i chos nyid dang spong ba'i chos nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben par mkhyen pa la sems de dag mkhyen zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems can zad pa'i chos nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid dang 'gag pa'i chos nyid dang spong ba'i chos nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben par mkhyen pa la sems de dag mkhyen zhes bshad do //
translated: The knowledge of the nature of sentient beings' exhaustion, the nature of separation from attachment, the nature of cessation, the nature of abandonment, and the nature of being empty by its very essence is explained as the knowledge of those minds.

original: de'i 'og tu rab 'byor sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya bas 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la sogs pa mkhyen par ston to //🔽'di la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen zhes bya ba la 'dir gal te 'dod chags dang / sems dang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid kyang de ltar shes na 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i sems kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ma yin gyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ces bya ba'i chos ngo bo nyid kyis dben
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rab 'byor sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya bas 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la sogs pa mkhyen par ston to // 'di la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen zhes bya ba la 'dir gal te 'dod chags dang / sems dang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid kyang de ltar shes na 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i sems kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ma yin gyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ces bya ba'i chos ngo bo nyid kyis dben
translated: After that, “Subhūti, any mind that is associated with attachment is not the suchness of the mind” shows the knowledge of a mind associated with attachment and so on.🔽Here, “he knows as it really is a mind associated with attachment as a mind associated with attachment” means that if attachment, the mind, and being associated with attachment are known in that way, then a mind associated with attachment does not exist as a phenomenon of the mind in reality.

original: pa la sems kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: pa la sems kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The suchness of a phenomenon called the suchness of the mind is a phenomenon called the suchness of the mind that is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa shes rab shin tu rnam par dag pa ni sems sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa shes rab shin tu rnam par dag pa ni sems sam /
translated: The Tathāgata, who is completely pure wisdom, is not to be grasped as mind,

original: 'dod chags sam /
analyzed: 'dod chags sam /
translated: or as desire,

original: sems las byung ba'i chos sam /🔽'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs par mi bzung ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos sam / 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs par mi bzung ste /
translated: or as a mental factor,🔽or as associated with desire, and so on.

original: 'dod chags dang bcad pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi kun brtags pa de shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcad pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi kun brtags pa de shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the imagined state of being associated with desire, and so on, is completely nonexistent.
